story:
The Campaign 

     This campaign was created to promote happiness all throughout the world in an attempt to do its part to combat depression. Happiness can be somewhat of an elusive thing. After all is said and done, it is truly what we seek more than the self-gratifying things of the world such as money, fame, or earthly achievements. Those things will give us momentary happiness, but it is the type of happiness that fades rapidly.


     Studies show that money does not buy happiness, nor does status, and neither a wall full of trophies or accomplishments. So, where is this elusive happiness, and how do we obtain it? That’s the question all of us ask but few can answer. But don’t let happiness slip between your fingers. Choose today to start your personal path to happiness. 


     We here at the Choose Happy campaign believe that happiness is a choice. It can be inspired and preserved through tradition and the sharing and hearing of stories as a way to gain inspiration in this seemingly dark and gloomy world. We are traveling the world promoting happiness, sharing stories, and meeting as many people as we can as to share their stories with you. We personally have experienced the power of happiness through the sharing of stories, and that is why we desire to find those willing to share so that we can be the medium to share with the rest of the world. You deserve to be happy! Choose today to be happy!

What We Need & What You Get

     We are doing this fundraiser so that we can get this movement started. In our world today where billions of videos are watched and shared daily. Not millions, but billions. We understand that video marketing plays such an important role in getting the word out to the people. We need your help to get the equipment needed to start recording the amazing stories so that they can be shared with the world. The need for our cause is great, and we are trying to do everything we can to help all those around us to choose happy and spread joy throughout the world. 

     Most importantly we need your support for the cause! Simply, we know together we can make a difference. But this will only work if we come together and work as a team. We are counting on you to come lend a hand. Do your part to help those in need. Everyone in one way or another has been effected by depression, here is your chance to stand up against it, shoulder to shoulder with others who are in the same fight. The fight choosing happiness! Choose happy and join our cause. When you do you will get that warm feeling inside when you do what is right, you will be and feel part of the team, and you will be another voice added to the whole in this fight.  

The Impact

     Happiness is contagious and like a smile it can make a huge difference with a ripple effect reaching out and helping more people than you can imagine. We plan to make this campaign big. Bigger than just us as individuals. We want to spread this feeling of happiness to all corners of the world. To the people who are stuck in the grips of depression, and those who are just having a rough day. This campaign is here to help you, and everyone you know and love. We want to bring the world together as a family, and create a community where positive energy and stories can be shared. By helping to fund this campaign, you're not just helping those with depression, you're helping create a community that will battle depression and sadness at its very roots.

Risks & Challenges

     350 million people worldwide suffer from depression. That is 5% of the world's population. Up to 15% of those diagnosed with depression die by suicide. There are so many all around us suffering today.  At We Choose Happy, we do not aspire to eradicate depression, but to alleviate it. Our stories focus on those who have battled depression and found a better way of living. Some have lost close friends to this disease. We hope to bring some joy through our books and stories, a new perspective, to shed some light on this issue. We hope to bring our story to countries affected the most by depression such as China, the U.S., Tonga, and African nations. Reducing stigma can not only lead to a better informed public, but it can also save lives.

"Be kind, for everyone you meet is fighting a hard battle." -Plato

Cost Breakdown

    The bulk of our earnings will go to production. This includes production for our website, social media sites, and book. It also includes costs of travel to stories, editing of short films, and costs of publishing our book. Equipment will be for camera and filming equipment to create stunning photos and videos that do the stories justice. 8% goes to Indiegogo for running our campaign and the rest goes to fulfilling our promises in rewards to you.

Rewards Timeline

  • Dec 18: Featured Stories will begin to be posted
  • Dec 21: Contributors List will be posted in website
  • Dec 23: Thank you letters sent out
  • Jan 4: T-shirts sent out
  • May 15: We Choose Happy book shipped
  • June 3-8: Trip to Hawaii

Project Timeline

  • Dec 14: Campaign Ends
  • Dec 15: Website and social media will begin posting and editing featured stories.
  • Dec 20: T-shirts ordered
  • Jan-March: Collection of International stories and videos, book first draft created.
  • April-May: Final drafts of book, publishing and binding of book.
  • May: Preparation for Hawaii Event and film footage
  • June 3-8: Stories of those who travelled to Hawaii for event and celebration.

Other Ways You Can Help

    If anything we want people to get the word out about this campaign. Share with everyone you know so that they can be happy, and start spreading happiness as well! Remember a simple smile or kind gesture goes a long way. Happiness is contagious, so chose today to be happy! Like us on Social Media and Share our message with everyone you know! 

https://www.facebook.com/wechoosehappy/

https://www.instagram.com/wechoosehappy/

https://twitter.com/WeChooseHappy1

Meet Us

Dillon and Sheyanne Petrovich, 

    We are both students here studying at Brigham Young University Hawaii. I, Dillon, am majoring in  International Cultural Studies with an emphasis on Peace-building I am also get a certificate in Legal Studies and a minor in Spanish. My wife is Majoring in Social Work and TESOL (Teaching English to Speakers of Other Languages) and minoring in Spanish as well. We both served 2 year service missions for our church. I served on the East Coast of the U.S. in the state of South Carolina, and my wife served in the capitol of Argentina in the city of Buenos Aires. 

     The inspiration to start this campaign came while we were living abroad in mainland China. We met so many wonderful people living in very poor circumstances. We saw extreme poverty and situations which made us wonder why all these people we met were still so happy. We wanted to know so we started to interview all those we met who were happy and asked what made them happy. We found that happiness was a choice that they were all making and they were not letting their environment or circumstances dictate their choice to be happy. We Choose Happy is our way to reach those who need help, we are doing our part to help them out! 

 

Amanda Lyzwinski,

    I also went through my own journey to chose happiness. As I found the Choose Happy way of life, I have seen my motivation increase, my comfort zone has been obliterated, and I have had more joy in living than ever before. In this project I bring my expertise in Finance and Accounting. As an Accounting and Math major here at Brigham Young University Hawaii, I have worked in finance and business technology for more than 3 years. When approached by the team at We Choose Happy I was more than willing to join, I knew that this was a worthy cause and dedicated my time to do whatever was needed to support. 

Kyler Peek, 

     I am a current student attending Brigham Young University Hawaii majoring in Business. While I lived in a foreign country for 2 years serving a faith mission for my church, my experiences in Peru made me realize how much poverty and unhappiness there is in the world. This is why I have joined and am dedicated to the We Choose Happy movement to spread happiness and joy to those around us. With my extensive knowledge of business I have used what i have learned throughout my time to help We Choose Happy overcome the obstacles that  we have experienced as our efforts to further the cause to fight depression. 

Jackson Measles,

     I am a Communications major here at BYU-Hawaii. I personally have seen depression deeply affect the people around me and this has motivated me to pursue what makes people happy. As I was approached by We Choose Happy I did not hesitate to offer my help and join the cause. With my background in the Humanities and Communications i have worked very closely with the Social Media department on the team to help spread the word so our movement can start making big waves. 

 

La campaña

     Esta campaña fue creada para promover la felicidad en todo el mundo en un intento de hacer su parte para combatir la depresión. La felicidad puede ser un tanto esquiva. Después de todo lo dicho y hecho, es realmente lo que buscamos más que las cosas gratificantes del mundo como el dinero, la fama o los logros terrenales. Esas cosas nos darán felicidad momentánea, pero es el tipo de felicidad que se desvanece rápidamente.

      Los estudios demuestran que el dinero no compra felicidad, ni el estatus, ni una pared llena de trofeos o logros. Entonces, ¿dónde está esta elusiva felicidad, y cómo la obtenemos? Esa es la pregunta que todos hacemos, pero pocos pueden contestar. Pero no dejes que la felicidad se deslice entre tus dedos. Elija hoy para comenzar su camino personal hacia la felicidad.

      Aquí en la campaña de “We Choose Happy” creemos que la felicidad es una decisión. Se puede inspirar y preservar a través de la tradición y el intercambio y el oído de historias como una forma de obtener inspiración en este mundo oscuro y sombrío. Estamos viajando por el mundo promoviendo la felicidad, compartiendo historias y conociendo a tantas personas como podamos para compartir sus historias con ustedes. Nosotros personalmente hemos experimentado el poder de la felicidad a través del intercambio de historias, y es por eso que deseamos encontrar a aquellos dispuestos a compartir para que podamos ser el medio para compartir con el resto del mundo. ¡Te mereces ser feliz! ¡Elige hoy para ser feliz!

Desglose de los costos

      La mayor parte de nuestras ganancias irá a producción. Esto incluye producción para nuestro sitio web, sitios de redes sociales y libros. También incluye los costos de viajar para encontrar las historias, la edición de cortometrajes y los costos de publicación de nuestro libro. El equipo será para la cámara y el equipo de filmación para crear impresionantes fotos y videos que hagan justicia a las historias. El 8% va a Indiegogo para ejecutar nuestra campaña y el resto se destina a cumplir nuestras promesas en recompensas.


Cronograma de recompensas

18 de diciembre: Las Historias Destacadas comenzarán a publicarse

21 de diciembre:Lla Lista de Colaboradores se publicará en el sitio web

 23 de diciembre: Cartas de Agradecimiento será enviado

4 de enero: Camisetas será enviado

15 de mayo: We Choose Happy Libro será enviado

3-8 de junio: Viaje a Hawaii

 

Línea de tiempo del proyecto

·      14 de diciembre: Campaña finaliza

·      15 de diciembre: el sitio web y las redes sociales comenzarán a publicar y editar historias destacadas.

·      20 de diciembre: camisetas finalizada

·      Enero-marzo: colección de historias y videos internacionales, primer borrador del libro creado.

·      Abril-mayo: Borradores finales del libro, publicación y encuadernación del libro.

·      Mayo: Preparación para Hawaii Evento y filmación

·      3-8 de junio: historias de quienes viajaron a Hawai para un evento y una celebración.

 

Puedes ayudar de otras formas

     En todo caso, queremos que las personas hagan correr la voz sobre esta campaña. ¡Comparte con todas las personas que conoces para que puedan ser felices y comiencen a difundir la felicidad también! Recuerde que una sonrisa simple o un gesto amable va un largo camino. La felicidad es contagiosa, ¡así que elige hoy para ser feliz! ¡Dénos me gusta en las redes sociales y comparta nuestro mensaje con todos sus conocidos!

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

      Estamos haciendo esta recaudación de fondos para que podamos comenzar este movimiento. En nuestro mundo de hoy, donde miles de millones de videos son vistos y compartidos diariamente. No millones, sino miles de millones. Entendemos que el video marketing es tan importante para hacer correr la voz a la gente. Necesitamos su ayuda para obtener el equipo necesario para comenzar a registrar las historias increíbles para que puedan ser compartidas con el mundo. La necesidad de nuestra causa es grandiosa, y estamos tratando de hacer todo lo que podamos para ayudar a todos los que nos rodean a elegir alegría feliz y difundida en todo el mundo.

      ¡Lo más importante es que necesitamos tu apoyo para la causa! Simplemente, sabemos que juntos podemos hacer la diferencia. Pero esto solo funcionará si nos juntamos y trabajamos en equipo. Estamos contando contigo para que ayudes. Haga su parte para ayudar a los que necesitan. Todos de una forma u otra han sido afectados por la depresión, aquí está tu oportunidad de enfrentarte a ella, hombro a hombro con otros que están en la misma lucha. ¡La lucha eligiendo la felicidad! Elija feliz y únase a nuestra causa. Cuando lo haga, sentirá esa sensación cálida en su interior cuando haga lo correcto, será y se sentirá parte del equipo, y será otra voz agregada al todo en esta lucha.

 

El impacto

     La felicidad es contagiosa y, como una sonrisa, puede marcar una gran diferencia con un efecto de onda expansiva que ayuda a más personas de las que puedes imaginar. Planeamos hacer esta campaña grande. Más grande que solo nosotros como individuos. Queremos difundir este sentimiento de felicidad en todos los rincones del mundo. Para las personas que están atrapadas en los apretones de la depresión, y aquellos que están teniendo un día difícil. Esta campaña está aquí para ayudarlo, y a todos los que conoce y ama. Queremos unir al mundo como una familia, y crear una comunidad donde la energía positiva y las historias se puedan compartir. Al ayudar a financiar esta campaña, no solo ayuda a las personas con depresión, sino que ayuda a crear una comunidad que luchará contra la depresión y la tristeza juntos.

 

Dillon y Sheyanne Petrovich,

    Los dos estamos estudiando aquí en la Universidad de Brigham Young Hawái. Yo, Dillon, estoy especializándome en los Estudios Culturales Internacionales con énfasis en la construcción de la paz. También recibiendo un certificado en los Estudios Legales y una especialización en español. Mi esposa se especializa en Trabajo Social y TESOL (Enseñanza de Inglés para Hablantes de Otros Idiomas) y también habla y estudia el español. Ambos servimos misiones de servicio de 2 años para nuestra iglesia. Serví en la costa este de los EE. UU. en el estado de Carolina del Sur (South Carolina), y mi esposa sirvió en la capital de Argentina, en la ciudad de Buenos Aires.

     La inspiración para comenzar esta campaña vino mientras estábamos viviendo en China continental. Conocimos a tantas personas maravillosas que vivían en circunstancias muy pobres. Vimos pobreza extrema y situaciones que nos hicieron preguntarnos por qué todas estas personas que conocimos todavía estaban tan felices. Queríamos saberlo, así que comenzamos a entrevistar a todos los que conocimos que estaban felices y les preguntamos qué los hacía felices. Descubrimos que la felicidad era una decisión que todos ellos estaban haciendo y que no estaban dejando que su entorno o sus circunstancias dictaminaran su decisión de ser felices. “We Choose Happy” es nuestra forma de llegar a aquellos que necesitan ayuda, ¡estamos haciendo nuestra parte para ayudarlos!

Jackson,

      Estoy esdudiando comunicaciones aquí en el Universidad de BYU-Hawaii. Personalmente, he visto que la depresión afecta profundamente a las personas que me rodean y esto me ha motivado a buscar lo que hace felices a la gente. Cuando me puse en contacto con We Choose Happy, no dudé en ofrecer mi ayuda y unirme a la causa. Con mi experiencia en Humanidades y Comunicaciones, he trabajado muy cerca con el departamento de Redes Sociales del equipo para ayudar a difundir el mensaje, de modo que nuestro movimiento pueda comenzar a generar grandes olas.

 

Kyler,

    Soy un estudiante actual que asiste a la Universidad Brigham Young de Hawaii especializándome en Negocios. Mientras viví en un país extranjero durante 2 años sirviendo en una misión de fe para mi iglesia, mis experiencias en Perú me hicieron darme cuenta de la pobreza y la infelicidad que hay en el mundo. Es por eso que me uní al movimiento We Choose Happy y nos dedicamos a difundir felicidad y alegría entre quienes nos rodean. Con mi amplio conocimiento de los negocios, he utilizado lo que he aprendido a lo largo de mi tiempo para ayudar a We Choose Happy a superar los obstáculos que hemos experimentado en nuestros esfuerzos por promover la causa de la depresión.

Amanda Lyzwinski,

      También he realizado mi propio viaje para elegir la felicidad. Al encontrar la forma de vida de “Choose Happy”, he visto aumentar mi motivación, mi zona de comodidad se ha borrado y he disfrutado más de la vida que nunca. En este proyecto, aporto mi experiencia en Finanzas y Contabilidad. Como estudiante de Contabilidad y Matemáticas aquí en la Universidad Brigham Young Hawái, he trabajado en finanzas y tecnología empresarial por más de 3 años. Cuando se nos acercó el equipo de “We Choose Happy”, estaba más que dispuesto a unirme, sabía que esta era una buena causa y dediqué mi tiempo a hacer lo que fuera necesario para apoyar.

Dec 18: Featured Stories will begin to be posted

Dec 23: Thank you letters sent out

     En todo caso, queremos que las personas hagan correr la voz sobre esta campaña. ¡Comparte con todas las personas que conoces para que puedan ser felices y comiencen a difundir la felicidad también! Recuerde que una sonrisa simple o un gesto amable va un largo camino. La felicidad es contagiosa, ¡así que elige hoy para ser feliz! ¡Dénos me gusta en las redes sociales y comparta nuestro mensaje con todos sus conocidos!
Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes
      Estamos haciendo esta recaudación de fondos para que podamos comenzar este movimiento. En nuestro mundo de hoy, donde miles de millones de videos son vistos y compartidos diariamente. No millones, sino miles de millones. Entendemos que el video marketing es tan importante para hacer correr la voz a la gente. Necesitamos su ayuda para obtener el equipo necesario para comenzar a registrar las historias increíbles para que puedan ser compartidas con el mundo. La necesidad de nuestra causa es grandiosa, y estamos tratando de hacer todo lo que podamos para ayudar a todos los que nos rodean a elegir alegría feliz y difundida en todo el mundo.
      ¡Lo más importante es que necesitamos tu apoyo para la causa! Simplemente, sabemos que juntos podemos hacer la diferencia. Pero esto solo funcionará si nos juntamos y trabajamos en equipo. Estamos contando contigo para que ayudes. Haga su parte para ayudar a los que necesitan. Todos de una forma u otra han sido afectados por la depresión, aquí está tu oportunidad de enfrentarte a ella, hombro a hombro con otros que están en la misma lucha. ¡La lucha eligiendo la felicidad! Elija feliz y únase a nuestra causa. Cuando lo haga, sentirá esa sensación cálida en su interior cuando haga lo correcto, será y se sentirá parte del equipo, y será otra voz agregada al todo en esta lucha.
 
El impacto
     La felicidad es contagiosa y, como una sonrisa, puede marcar una gran diferencia con un efecto de onda expansiva que ayuda a más personas de las que puedes imaginar. Planeamos hacer esta campaña grande. Más grande que solo nosotros como individuos. Queremos difundir este sentimiento de felicidad en todos los rincones del mundo. Para las personas que están atrapadas en los apretones de la depresión, y aquellos que están teniendo un día difícil. Esta campaña está aquí para ayudarlo, y a todos los que conoce y ama. Queremos unir al mundo como una familia, y crear una comunidad donde la energía positiva y las historias se puedan compartir. Al ayudar a financiar esta campaña, no solo ayuda a las personas con depresión, sino que ayuda a crear una comunidad que luchará contra la depresión y la tristeza juntos.
 
Dillon y Sheyanne Petrovich,
    Los dos estamos estudiando aquí en la Universidad de Brigham Young Hawái. Yo, Dillon, estoy especializándome en los Estudios Culturales Internacionales con énfasis en la construcción de la paz. También recibiendo un certificado en los Estudios Legales y una especialización en español. Mi esposa se especializa en Trabajo Social y TESOL (Enseñanza de Inglés para Hablantes de Otros Idiomas) y también habla y estudia el español. Ambos servimos misiones de servicio de 2 años para nuestra iglesia. Serví en la costa este de los EE. UU. en el estado de Carolina del Sur (South Carolina), y mi esposa sirvió en la capital de Argentina, en la ciudad de Buenos Aires.
     La inspiración para comenzar esta campaña vino mientras estábamos viviendo en China continental. Conocimos a tantas personas maravillosas que vivían en circunstancias muy pobres. Vimos pobreza extrema y situaciones que nos hicieron preguntarnos por qué todas estas personas que conocimos todavía estaban tan felices. Queríamos saberlo, así que comenzamos a entrevistar a todos los que conocimos que estaban felices y les preguntamos qué los hacía felices. Descubrimos que la felicidad era una decisión que todos ellos estaban haciendo y que no estaban dejando que su entorno o sus circunstancias dictaminaran su decisión de ser felices. “We Choose Happy” es nuestra forma de llegar a aquellos que necesitan ayuda, ¡estamos haciendo nuestra parte para ayudarlos!
Jackson,
      Estoy esdudiando comunicaciones aquí en el Universidad de BYU-Hawaii. Personalmente, he visto que la depresión afecta profundamente a las personas que me rodean y esto me ha motivado a buscar lo que hace felices a la gente. Cuando me puse en contacto con We Choose Happy, no dudé en ofrecer mi ayuda y unirme a la causa. Con mi experiencia en Humanidades y Comunicaciones, he trabajado muy cerca con el departamento de Redes Sociales del equipo para ayudar a difundir el mensaje, de modo que nuestro movimiento pueda comenzar a generar grandes olas.
 
Kyler,
    Soy un estudiante actual que asiste a la Universidad Brigham Young de Hawaii especializándome en Negocios. Mientras viví en un país extranjero durante 2 años sirviendo en una misión de fe para mi iglesia, mis experiencias en Perú me hicieron darme cuenta de la pobreza y la infelicidad que hay en el mundo. Es por eso que me uní al movimiento We Choose Happy y nos dedicamos a difundir felicidad y alegría entre quienes nos rodean. Con mi amplio conocimiento de los negocios, he utilizado lo que he aprendido a lo largo de mi tiempo para ayudar a We Choose Happy a superar los obstáculos que hemos experimentado en nuestros esfuerzos por promover la causa de la depresión.
Amanda Lyzwinski,
      También he realizado mi propio viaje para elegir la felicidad. Al encontrar la forma de vida de “Choose Happy”, he visto aumentar mi motivación, mi zona de comodidad se ha borrado y he disfrutado más de la vida que nunca. En este proyecto, aporto mi experiencia en Finanzas y Contabilidad. Como estudiante de Contabilidad y Matemáticas aquí en la Universidad Brigham Young Hawái, he trabajado en finanzas y tecnología empresarial por más de 3 años. Cuando se nos acercó el equipo de “We Choose Happy”, estaba más que dispuesto a unirme, sabía que esta era una buena causa y dediqué mi tiempo a hacer lo que fuera necesario para apoyar.

story:
Why we need your help

We are seeking your help to heal our fellow citizens of Botswana, as well as members of our global village. Our country has long suffered one of the highest prevalence rates of HIV/AIDS in the world.  While 27 new infections per day is a shocking number, what is not reported is the stress of living with the disease as well as the strain placed upon family members and caregivers. Instead of a medical response however, we seek to heal the psychological wounds inflicted upon our local and global populations.

Our Story

Hi!  I'm Dr. Didi Sekoko-Biorn, a clinical psychologist trained in the US, and now practicing in my home country Botswana.  As a former fellow of the Disaster Mental Health Institute (DMHI), my experiences in conducting therapy throughout the years have led me to the understanding that we are all collectively hurting or recovering from various levels of trauma. 

Feeling like my years of conducting therapy were analogous to "putting out fires", I teamed up with my lifetime sister-friend and mindfulness coach, Mother K Masire, to create a sustainable, eco-friendly retreat camp in the African bush through our organization, AfroBotho. We seek to bring groups of people together and serve as a place to heal from the pressures of the modern world. 

 

Our intended approach is preventative rather than reactive, and seeks to provide visitors with world-class accommodation, spectacular wildlife viewing, and integrated programs and services that foster wellness holistically. 

 

 

We will offer unique wellness-tourism activities and skills sharing seminars to both local and international clients seeking rest, rejuvenation, and re-connection with their authentic selves.

After securing 40 acres of beautiful, untouched land just a 15-minute drive from Botswana's tourism capital of Maun, (gateway to the UNESCO world heritage site, the Okavango Delta), we felt so strongly about our idea that we both sold our family homes to fund the construction.

Our vision has proved to be bigger than our bank accounts, so we are seeking help to complete the construction and create a place that will provide healing and respite for generations to come.

We have begun building our retreat at an accessible location that is close to nature, using off-the-grid green technologies and locally sourced materials as much as possible.  Overlooking a private river-fed lake with access to fresh water year-round, our camp will utilize organic fruit and vegetable farming to add value to the camp’s sustainability.

So far with our own funds, we have built a septic and water reticulation system, a reception area (consisting of a curio shop, reception and two offices) with tented canvas walls and traditional thatch roofing, a campsite with 8 toilets/6 showers, and an infinity swimming pool overlooking the waters of the delta floodplain.

The Impact

We are here to challenge you in the same way the people of Botswana challenged themselves in 1976—to give what they could to create something sustainable and for the greater good. Did you know that our country of Botswana was crowdfunding before crowdfunding was a thing?

As a fledgling democracy in 1976, ten years after its independence and one of the poorest countries in Africa at the time, our government appealed to its citizens to donate whatever they could to help build our first University. The campaign was called "motho le motho kgomo", (one man, one beast) and asked people from around the country to donate whatever they could (cash, cattle, grain, eggs, etc…).

The movement ultimately managed to raise enough to get the University of Botswana up and running by 1982!  We seek to revive the same spirit of giving, and to build a place that will heal people locally and from around the globe by once again rallying around giving for a common good.

The Bigger Picture

We consider mental health the nation's wealth. Let’s face it. We are all hurting and wounded on some level.   Hurt people — hurt others, whether directly or indirectly, because we are interconnected and interdependent beings.  We want to break this cycle so that when you leave our camp, you take back peace, healing, and well-being to your own families and communities. 

The rat race keeps us too busy to stop and look at the aspects of our lives that cause us stress and prevent us from returning to balance. We see our healing retreat as an integrated model that combines wellness programs with world-class safari tourism, in one of the last remaining unspoiled natural environments on the planet.

One of our signature programs, Heal the Healer, specifically targets first responders, social workers, doctors, nurses, police, fire fighters, paramedics, and human resource professionals to name a few, and it has been delivered to hundreds of participants over the years.   We hope our model, once launched in our own facility, could inspire other healing centers and retreats around the world.

Our Track Record

Our organization, AfroBotho, is a training, service, and sustainable development organization inspired to promote mental health and wellness within individuals, organizations, and communities.  We seek to improve access to mental health services, and to co-create innovative public mental health solutions, that go upstream and positively strengthen our community's resilience, utilizing the human values of compassion, collaboration, and Botho!

AfroBotho is committed to partnering with existing organizations and systems to provide innovative mental health solutions that address our current psycho-social challenges.  We have a track record of excellence and have provided consulting services and wellness programs to government offices, non-profit organizations, as well as local corporate clientele.

Our driving value, "Botho", is the Setswana word for the concepts of kindness and compassion, or to act with integrity by acknowledging the divinity in another, and to say, "I am because you are." Offering our tried-and-tested programs and services from our own venue will allow us to host more people than ever before, and help make a difference in our world, one heart at a time.

 

What We Need

Are you ready to contribute towards participating in an African healing journey of a lifetime? Your help is important to us! All perks will be redeemable after camp completion (anticipated Aug/Sept 2018). We are seeking to raise $100,000 to complete construction of the following:

-$15,000 for additional building materials, grass for thatching, gumpoles, timber, and canvas

-$20,000 for kitchen/dining room appliances and fittings

-$25,000 for a  distributed Solar power system (48kWh system with panels, batteries, inverters, wiring and lights)

-$40,000 for Fixtures, Beds, Mattresses, Linens, Tables, Chairs, and Pool/deck furniture to accommodate 50 people.

The Perks - What You Get

If you feel guided to help us, know that all contributions will be honored and will allow us to quickly begin hosting visitors seeking healing and rejuvenation. 

Whether your contribution is $20 or $20,000, know that you will be reserving a time in the near future, to come and take advantage of all that our African retreat camp will offer.

Consider your contribution as a down payment on a vacation in the future. All contributions will be redeemable to access our programs, services, seminars, spa treatments, meals, accommodation, and safari activities.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share our campaign on social media with all your friends and help us create an African healing sanctuary! One love!!

story:
About us and our Vision

Innisfree Farm and Botanic Garden is a 7 acre property on Vancouver Island.  It is home to the only registered botanic garden in British Columbia that specializes in medicinal plants and herbs, as well as a not-for-profit society, Gardens without Borders, that delivers horticulture therapy programs to disadvantaged and disabled individuals. The gardens were founded by Chanchal Cabrera and Thierry Vrain in 2003.

At Innisfree we grow culinary herbs, medicinal plants, vegetables, and berries and offer cooking and gardening classes, herbal medicine workshops, and nature therapy programs.  On Fridays and Saturdays throughout the summer we open our gates to the public so they can explore the farm. We host a small cafe featuring al fresco breakfast, lunch, and tea items and a market stand offering fresh vegetables, and a range of health and wellness products handmade at the farm.  We also host special events and have a Yurt for guests who wish to plan overnight visits.

We started Innisfree Farm and Botanic Garden as a refuge for people to escape to, away from their busy and hectic lives. We create opportunities for people to connect with nature and food in intimate ways - where healing and wellness begin with how we nourish our bodies and souls.  

 

Help us Grow Innisfree Farm and Botanic Garden into a Premier Wellness Destination in Western Canada

We need $100,000 for a series of updates on the farm as well as to jump-start a series of revenue-generating activities to support our work. We dream of having a farm that is available and accessible to as many people as possible - to teach about medicinal plants and herbs, to use nature to heal physical and emotional pain. And this is why we’re asking for your support. Building a dream takes time and resources, much like growing a garden.

The projects we’ll be able to complete with $100,000 are:

  • Build the new front fence and gates at the entrance to the gardens
  • Pave paths from the street and through the gardens for improved access for all users
  • Install accessible bathrooms
  • Create service counter with sink and fridge for outdoor cafe service area
  • Landscape cafe area with retaining wall, hedge, pond, and flagstone
  • Build a recreational area for children with natural materials
  • Install benches, waste receptacles, information boards, maps and directional signs 

  • Install bike racks

With funding to support these very important projects we’ll be in a better position to:

  • share our farm and programming with more guests;
  • establish Innisfree as a premier destination in Western Canada to experience, learn, and benefit from natural medicine and connections with nature;
  • generate more revenue to reinvest into our horticulture therapy and nature  programs;
  • create healthier people through meaningful connections with food and nature.

We’ve already invested incredible quantities of our resources into this farm but to fulfill our dream we need your help.

 

How You Can Help

We hope you'll help us make our dream come true. Your support will not go unnoticed no matter the size of your contribution. We’ve curated a variety of ways that we can express our thanks to you. Please check out all of our perks - from samples of the products we create and sell at Innisfree to eco-therapy immersions or sponsoring trees on the property, we have something for everyone!

And if you can’t contribute financially we would be so grateful if you could share this video with your family, friends, colleagues and on social media.  Any and all support that you can show to our campaign is truly invaluable to us.  Use the Indiegogo share tools! They make sharing super easy!

Thank you, from the bottoms of our muddy farm boots to the tips of our Douglas Firs.  

x Chanchal and Thierry

 

Do you have more questions? We might have some answers! Here are some Frequently Asked Questions.

Who runs and manages Innisfree Farm and Botanic Garden?

Innisfree Farm is owned and operated by Chanchal Cabrera and Thierry Vrain who purchased the farm in 2003.

Chanchal has been a member of the National Institute of Medical Herbalists (UK) since 1987 and was awarded  a Fellowship in 2009. She gained her MSc in herbal medicine at the University of Wales in 2003 and she held the faculty chair in Botanical Medicine at the Boucher Institute of Naturopathic Medicine in New Westminster  from 2004 – 2016. She holds diplomas in Botanic Garden Management and in Botanic Garden Education from Royal Botanic Gardens, Kew, in Shinrin Yoku (forest bathing) and is a certified Master Gardener and a certified Horticulture Therapist

Chanchal runs a private herbal medicine clinic with a specialty in holistic oncology and offers a monthly student training clinic that provides free health services to the community. The farm also hosts Gardens without Borders, a federally registered not-for-profit society established to run the botanic garden and provide horticulture therapy. 

Thierry was born and raised in Paris. He completed his undergraduate studies in Caen in Normandie and he then moved to Montréal to teach plant physiology. Thierry completed his graduate studies in Raleigh, North Carolina, and worked for 30 years doing research for the Canadian Department of Agriculture.   Thierry retired 16 years ago and for 7 years he ran a successful CSA (community supported agriculture) program at Innisfree, growing food for 20 households. For the last 6 years he has been lecturing extensively across Canada and USA about the chemical contamination of foods through commercial agriculture practices.

What’s the rush? Why do you need $100,000 right now?

We have some urgency because we have been building up to this for a while, gathering momentum, learning and figuring out how to do this whole project of a botanic garden.  Now we are ready.

We have to do the front fence and gates immediately because the old wood one that served us for 10 years has finally fallen down. While replacing the fence we have the opportunity to move equipment onto the land for building our cafe space. And with improved facilities, we want to accommodate as many guests as possible - but grass is far less friendly than paved paths for strollers and wheelchairs.  So flagstone, landscaping, and paving will improve conditions.  Costs for these improvements add up quickly !

How do you know $100,000 will be enough to complete your desired projects?

We’ve done our best to estimate the costs associated with the projects we want to complete.  We have plans drafted and contractors waiting on hold to help us put them into motion. While we understand that there are unforeseen costs associated with almost every project, we are hopeful that our plans are inclusive and cost-effective.

If we don't raise all the funds we've made a budget for priority projects and will work to complete what we are able to with the funds we raise. 

What will you do if you don’t raise $100,000?

If we are unsuccessful in raising $100,000 we will work to complete the projects that we have listed based on priority. We’ve chosen a flexible campaign on Indiegogo so we will have access to the funds we raise even if we do not raise the whole $100,000.   

We have planned some realistic compromises - for example, we have to do the fence and we have no choice, but we can, if we have too, grass the terrace instead of flagstones. It is not as durable and not as smooth for wheelchairs, but it still works.

With that being said, we understand that $100,000 is a big goal but we also feel we have a compelling cause and we’re very motivated to achieve our goal. We have so much of the Botanic Garden infrastructure and critical mass in place, and this construction project is the last piece required to make the garden really work.

When will the projects be completed?

The fence and gates will be completed in May 2018. The cafe, terrace, and landscaping will happen very shortly thereafter.

Have you looked for funds elsewhere?

So far, most of the investment in the land has come from us as the owners. Draining, ditching, soil building, planting trees and making herb gardens, deer fencing and so on has been our investment over 12 years.

Chanchal went to school in London for 10 weeks in 2013, at her own expense, to study at Kew Gardens and get a diploma in Botanic Garden management. The following year, 2014, she got a $6600 grant from the Alan Lennox Boyd Memorial Trust in UK, to attend a 6-week program in Botanic Garden Education (teaching science in a garden).

We have done over $10,000 of fund  raising in the past through events and dinners at the farm, and we have received almost $5000 of donations from private donors.

How can I stay up to date with information about this crowdfunding campaign and Innisfree Farm and Botanic Garden's progress? 

We regularly update our friends via our newsletter. We'd love to add you to the list. You can subscribe by clicking this link or visit our website: www.innisfreefarm.ca

What is a botanic garden?

A botanic garden is an establishment where plants are grown for scientific study and display to the public. Innisfree Botanic Garden specializes in medicinal plants and our demonstration garden is organized based on different organs in the body. We also have a collection of sacred and medicinal trees. Innisfree Botanic Garden is one of six registered Botanic Gardens in British Columbia, and the only one in B.C. that specializes in medicinal plants and herbs.

What is the not-for-profit that is hosted at Innisfree?

Gardens without Borders is the not-for-profit society that runs programming at Innisfree Farm and Botanic Garden. Its mission is to provide healing opportunities through plants and gardening (Horticulture Therapy). Horticulture Therapy (HT) uses plants and the natural world to facilitate participants in achieving specific and measurable goals in the domains of overall personal well being: physical, mental, emotional, spiritual, vocational, and creative health.  Currently, Gardens without Borders operates only within the growing season at Innisfree Farm, but the intention is to make it available year-round with more funding.

What programs are offered to the public at Innisfree?

We offer a number of programs that are open to the public at Innisfree. We offer longer term courses and practice in herbal medicine, herbal training camps, retreats, full moon dinners, shirin yoku forest bathing, and we’re open for drop-in guests on Fridays and Saturdays from  June to September. To learn more about our programs and events visit our website www.innisfreefarm.ca or subscribe to our newsletter. 

Can I visit Innisfree Farm and Botanic Garden?

Of course! We would love to have you. Innisfree is located in Royston, British Columbia. It’s a small community on Vancouver Island. We’re an easy day trip from Parksville or Nanaimo. The farm is open to the public on Fridays and Saturdays from June to September.  We also offer all sorts of educational programs and welcome volunteers. You can find our address and information on all the programs we offer on our website www.innisfreefarm.ca or subscribe to our newsletter to get up to date information. 

Where does the name Innisfree come from?

The name Innisfree is in a short poem by Yeats describing his dream of a peaceful place in Nature while he is stuck in the city.  William Butler Yeats (1865-1939), an Irish poet, dramatist and prose writer, one of the greatest English-language poets of the 20th century received the Nobel Prize for Literature in 1923.   

What if I live near Innisfree and I'd like to pick-up my perk rather than have it shipped? 

Send us an email innisfreecrowdfunding@gmail.com and we can let you know how to do skip the shipping cost. 

Can I sign up for the Innisfree newsletter? 

Absolutely! Click here to sign up for the Innisfree newsletter.

Innisfree Farm and Botanic Garden is a 7 acre property on Vancouver Island.  It is home to the only registered botanic garden in British Columbia that specializes in medicinal plants and herbs, as well as a not-for-profit society, Gardens without Borders, that delivers horticulture therapy programs to disadvantaged and disabled individuals. The gardens were founded by Chanchal Cabrera and Thierry Vrain in 2003.
At Innisfree we grow culinary herbs, medicinal plants, vegetables, and berries and offer cooking and gardening classes, herbal medicine workshops, and nature therapy programs.  On Fridays and Saturdays throughout the summer we open our gates to the public so they can explore the farm. We host a small cafe featuring al fresco breakfast, lunch, and tea items and a market stand offering fresh vegetables, and a range of health and wellness products handmade at the farm.  We also host special events and have a Yurt for guests who wish to plan overnight visits.


We started Innisfree Farm and Botanic Garden as a refuge for people to escape to, away from their busy and hectic lives. We create opportunities for people to connect with nature and food in intimate ways - where healing and wellness begin with how we nourish our bodies and souls.  
 
Help us Grow Innisfree Farm and Botanic Garden into a Premier Wellness Destination in Western Canada
We need $100,000 for a series of updates on the farm as well as to jump-start a series of revenue-generating activities to support our work. We dream of having a farm that is available and accessible to as many people as possible - to teach about medicinal plants and herbs, to use nature to heal physical and emotional pain. And this is why we’re asking for your support. Building a dream takes time and resources, much like growing a garden.
The projects we’ll be able to complete with $100,000 are:

Build the new front fence and gates at the entrance to the gardens
Pave paths from the street and through the gardens for improved access for all users
Install accessible bathrooms
Create service counter with sink and fridge for outdoor cafe service area


Landscape cafe area with retaining wall, hedge, pond, and flagstone
Build a recreational area for children with natural materials
Install benches, waste receptacles, information boards, maps and directional signs 

Install bike racks

With funding to support these very important projects we’ll be in a better position to:

share our farm and programming with more guests;
establish Innisfree as a premier destination in Western Canada to experience, learn, and benefit from natural medicine and connections with nature;
generate more revenue to reinvest into our horticulture therapy and nature  programs;
create healthier people through meaningful connections with food and nature.

We’ve already invested incredible quantities of our resources into this farm but to fulfill our dream we need your help.

 
How You Can Help
We hope you'll help us make our dream come true. Your support will not go unnoticed no matter the size of your contribution. We’ve curated a variety of ways that we can express our thanks to you. Please check out all of our perks - from samples of the products we create and sell at Innisfree to eco-therapy immersions or sponsoring trees on the property, we have something for everyone!
And if you can’t contribute financially we would be so grateful if you could share this video with your family, friends, colleagues and on social media.  Any and all support that you can show to our campaign is truly invaluable to us.  Use the Indiegogo share tools! They make sharing super easy!
Thank you, from the bottoms of our muddy farm boots to the tips of our Douglas Firs.  
x Chanchal and Thierry
 
Do you have more questions? We might have some answers! Here are some Frequently Asked Questions.
Who runs and manages Innisfree Farm and Botanic Garden?
Innisfree Farm is owned and operated by Chanchal Cabrera and Thierry Vrain who purchased the farm in 2003.
Chanchal has been a member of the National Institute of Medical Herbalists (UK) since 1987 and was awarded  a Fellowship in 2009. She gained her MSc in herbal medicine at the University of Wales in 2003 and she held the faculty chair in Botanical Medicine at the Boucher Institute of Naturopathic Medicine in New Westminster  from 2004 – 2016. She holds diplomas in Botanic Garden Management and in Botanic Garden Education from Royal Botanic Gardens, Kew, in Shinrin Yoku (forest bathing) and is a certified Master Gardener and a certified Horticulture Therapist
Chanchal runs a private herbal medicine clinic with a specialty in holistic oncology and offers a monthly student training clinic that provides free health services to the community. The farm also hosts Gardens without Borders, a federally registered not-for-profit society established to run the botanic garden and provide horticulture therapy. 
Thierry was born and raised in Paris. He completed his undergraduate studies in Caen in Normandie and he then moved to Montréal to teach plant physiology. Thierry completed his graduate studies in Raleigh, North Carolina, and worked for 30 years doing research for the Canadian Department of Agriculture.   Thierry retired 16 years ago and for 7 years he ran a successful CSA (community supported agriculture) program at Innisfree, growing food for 20 households. For the last 6 years he has been lecturing extensively across Canada and USA about the chemical contamination of foods through commercial agriculture practices.
What’s the rush? Why do you need $100,000 right now? 
We have some urgency because we have been building up to this for a while, gathering momentum, learning and figuring out how to do this whole project of a botanic garden.  Now we are ready.
We have to do the front fence and gates immediately because the old wood one that served us for 10 years has finally fallen down. While replacing the fence we have the opportunity to move equipment onto the land for building our cafe space. And with improved facilities, we want to accommodate as many guests as possible - but grass is far less friendly than paved paths for strollers and wheelchairs.  So flagstone, landscaping, and paving will improve conditions.  Costs for these improvements add up quickly !
How do you know $100,000 will be enough to complete your desired projects?
We’ve done our best to estimate the costs associated with the projects we want to complete.  We have plans drafted and contractors waiting on hold to help us put them into motion. While we understand that there are unforeseen costs associated with almost every project, we are hopeful that our plans are inclusive and cost-effective.
If we don't raise all the funds we've made a budget for priority projects and will work to complete what we are able to with the funds we raise. 

What will you do if you don’t raise $100,000?
If we are unsuccessful in raising $100,000 we will work to complete the projects that we have listed based on priority. We’ve chosen a flexible campaign on Indiegogo so we will have access to the funds we raise even if we do not raise the whole $100,000.   
We have planned some realistic compromises - for example, we have to do the fence and we have no choice, but we can, if we have too, grass the terrace instead of flagstones. It is not as durable and not as smooth for wheelchairs, but it still works.
With that being said, we understand that $100,000 is a big goal but we also feel we have a compelling cause and we’re very motivated to achieve our goal. We have so much of the Botanic Garden infrastructure and critical mass in place, and this construction project is the last piece required to make the garden really work.
When will the projects be completed?
The fence and gates will be completed in May 2018. The cafe, terrace, and landscaping will happen very shortly thereafter.
Have you looked for funds elsewhere?
So far, most of the investment in the land has come from us as the owners. Draining, ditching, soil building, planting trees and making herb gardens, deer fencing and so on has been our investment over 12 years.
Chanchal went to school in London for 10 weeks in 2013, at her own expense, to study at Kew Gardens and get a diploma in Botanic Garden management. The following year, 2014, she got a $6600 grant from the Alan Lennox Boyd Memorial Trust in UK, to attend a 6-week program in Botanic Garden Education (teaching science in a garden).
We have done over $10,000 of fund  raising in the past through events and dinners at the farm, and we have received almost $5000 of donations from private donors.
How can I stay up to date with information about this crowdfunding campaign and Innisfree Farm and Botanic Garden's progress? 
We regularly update our friends via our newsletter. We'd love to add you to the list. You can subscribe by clicking this link or visit our website: www.innisfreefarm.ca
What is a botanic garden?
A botanic garden is an establishment where plants are grown for scientific study and display to the public. Innisfree Botanic Garden specializes in medicinal plants and our demonstration garden is organized based on different organs in the body. We also have a collection of sacred and medicinal trees. Innisfree Botanic Garden is one of six registered Botanic Gardens in British Columbia, and the only one in B.C. that specializes in medicinal plants and herbs.
What is the not-for-profit that is hosted at Innisfree?
Gardens without Borders is the not-for-profit society that runs programming at Innisfree Farm and Botanic Garden. Its mission is to provide healing opportunities through plants and gardening (Horticulture Therapy). Horticulture Therapy (HT) uses plants and the natural world to facilitate participants in achieving specific and measurable goals in the domains of overall personal well being: physical, mental, emotional, spiritual, vocational, and creative health.  Currently, Gardens without Borders operates only within the growing season at Innisfree Farm, but the intention is to make it available year-round with more funding.
What programs are offered to the public at Innisfree?
We offer a number of programs that are open to the public at Innisfree. We offer longer term courses and practice in herbal medicine, herbal training camps, retreats, full moon dinners, shirin yoku forest bathing, and we’re open for drop-in guests on Fridays and Saturdays from  June to September. To learn more about our programs and events visit our website www.innisfreefarm.ca or subscribe to our newsletter. 
Can I visit Innisfree Farm and Botanic Garden?
Of course! We would love to have you. Innisfree is located in Royston, British Columbia. It’s a small community on Vancouver Island. We’re an easy day trip from Parksville or Nanaimo. The farm is open to the public on Fridays and Saturdays from June to September.  We also offer all sorts of educational programs and welcome volunteers. You can find our address and information on all the programs we offer on our website www.innisfreefarm.ca or subscribe to our newsletter to get up to date information. 
Where does the name Innisfree come from?
The name Innisfree is in a short poem by Yeats describing his dream of a peaceful place in Nature while he is stuck in the city.  William Butler Yeats (1865-1939), an Irish poet, dramatist and prose writer, one of the greatest English-language poets of the 20th century received the Nobel Prize for Literature in 1923.   
What if I live near Innisfree and I'd like to pick-up my perk rather than have it shipped? 
Send us an email innisfreecrowdfunding@gmail.com and we can let you know how to do skip the shipping cost. 
Can I sign up for the Innisfree newsletter? 
Absolutely! Click here to sign up for the Innisfree newsletter.

story:
Safety Should Be Affordable

We believe that in times like this safety should be everyone's top priority.  Unfortunately others have leveraged the current crisis to prey on fear. This has resulted in grossly inflated prices on essential item that are crucial to the safety of all Americans.

No one should have to worry about purchasing basic virus protection/prevention items because they fear they cannot find or afford them. We have the opportunity to team up and give everyone the access buy FDA Approved KN95 medical grade safety masks at an affordable price.

With your help we hope to reach our goal of providing all American families with the safety and protection they need.

KN95 is an industry standard and means that the mask provides the intended effectiveness of filtering 95 percent of particles with a mass median diameter of 0.3 micrometers. Therefore, our mask can protect you well from PM10, PM2. 5, and even smaller particles. Our masks are FDA Approved & CE certified and tested.

Our Cause & Charitable Efforts

We strongly believe in the power of unity and coming together to help those in need, especially during extreme hardships. Right now a crisis is escalating with the closing of schools &  workplaces across the country. Currently there are more that 30 million children who participate in the National School lunch Program; No Kid Hungry is an outstanding program though which needy children across our nation are fed.  Without this program these children would go hungry.  Right now with school closures, these children are left wondering where there next meal is coming from. 

Our pledge is to donate on Your behalf to No Kid Hungry. With every mask purchased, 10% of all sales will be donated to the No Kid Hungry initiative.

Let’s come together as a nation and help each other through these tough times.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We at Last Mile LLC are in the blessed position to secure thousands of certified medical-grade KN95 safety masks. We are only able to purchase the masks and lock in these low rates with the manufacturer if we make high-volume orders, that's why we are here!

You'll receive the amount of masks you order (10 individual masks min).  These masks are extremely effective in capturing and filtering out small  particles like bacteria, viruses, dust and smog. We recommend changing then out every couple days or as needed.

Now we would like to do our part and ensure anyone and everyone in need can purchase a mask at an affordable price.  Use these for your friends, family, loved ones or to donate. 

 

The Impact

With everything we cannot control, we can protect ourselves and feed millions of children in need. As 3/19/20 there have been over 68 million lunches missed due to school closures! No Kid hungry let's unify & reduce that number.  

 

Risks & Challenges

We're putting a substantial amount of resources, time and energy to ensure that people aren't stuck paying the obscene rates of $20 for a single mask.  People are using this time to profit off of the fear of consumers. 

The only way we can fire up operations is to place a bulk order with YOUR help!  Your order to not only help you stay safe but it will help children in need. 

Thank you for your support! Please share this post on your social media! 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you do not need a mask, we ask you to donate what you can to children in need by following this link to the No Kid Hungry intiative:
https://secure.nokidhungry.org/site/Donation2;j...

story:
Introducing City Cakes CARES

City Cakes CARES, a division of City Cakes’ New York based operation, captures different forms of philanthropic work through donations, product sales, and outreach. We are launching earlier than scheduled in May 2020 to encompass the massive support needed during the current pandemic.

  • City Cakes has been around since 2007 specializing in notable baked goods, from stunning custom cakes to innovative gourmet products, and notably is the Original Home of the Half Pound Cookie, shipping across the US.
  • Our platform gives us a unique ability to call attention to important issues faced, and embraced, by the City Cakes’ community. We have an outlet to raise funds and provide charitable, “sweet” relief to those in need. 
  • In this sad and unprecedented time, first responders and essential workers have selflessly stepped up in hopes of saving lives and keeping people healthy. They need as much mental and physical sustenance as we can bring to the table, so we are shifting resources to not only receive donations to provide to them, but also to take specific requests on who/where in the USA our support is needed.

 

How Can YOU Help City Cakes CARES?

City Cakes CARES' Covid-19 relief is a bit different because we have the ability to deliver and ship products not only across the NYC area, but across the country. 

  • By making a donation, you will directly provide our incredible treats to first responders, essential workers or needing families of victims of Covid-19. Your donation can even match a specific Donation Request to recipient/s of your choice.
  • For each donation level, there are perks for you to share in the City Cakes CARES spirit during this time. We know the physical and emotional toll this pandemic is having on just about everyone, and thank you for your donation with City Cakes credit and awesome City Cakes CARES merch (also available for purchase).

 

The Impact

We are setting a goal of $30K which may seem like a lot, but it isn't. The amount of product we can create for that amount won't even begin to make a dent in what is needed, but any amount counts. 30K will convert to roughly 1.5 TONS of treats donated! 

  • City Cakes has been doing community and charity work for over 10 years, raising significant funds for groups in need, donating hundreds of pounds of products and raising immeasurable awareness for causes and groups including NYC Anti-Violence, Wildlife Warriors, World Central Kitchen, National Breast Cancer Foundation, Puerto Rican Relief and more. It has come time for us to unify our efforts under a dedicated resource in City Cakes CARES.
  • By creating an identity behind the charitable efforts that our customers and friends support and believe in, we can also include the community that means so much to us. We want to share and continue to be a driver in awareness and are all about the act of putting money where ones' mouth is!

 

What Stands in our Way?

  • Since we know we aren't bound by geography outside of the US, and our treats are unique and already being purchased as paid gifts for the groups we are looking to donate to, we know this program is going to be successful, but we will certainly have capacity restraints.
  • We will dedicate Tuesdays and Thursdays to completely fulfill City Cakes CARES donations and requests. We will reach limits on donation requests we can fulfill each week, but know that in 8 weeks we will be able to fulfill 30K worth of donations, and likely be able to continue beyond that.

 

How Else Can You Help?

If you can't make a donation today, we are also selling specific City Cakes CARES merchandise that will also benefit getting goods to those that need them! Check out the merchandise on CityCakes.com.

By shipping cookies to yourself or others on our site, or shopping at our contactless location in NYC, you are helping to keep our team running at City Cakes! That in itself allows us to keep doing what we're doing ,and provides for the team and the resources needed to make City Cakes CARES function.

Other key ways to help:

  • Make sure to follow us on social media @citycakes and @citycakescares and also like, tag, share, follow - the more people that know, the more City Cakes CARES can grow!
  • Be on the lookout for our City Cakes & City Cakes CARES gifs! Search #citycakes when you're looking for gifs on giphy-supported apps, and use em up!
  • Help share this IndieGoGo campaign, and also our Donation Request Portal... again, the more people that know, the more City Cakes CARES can grow and help more people!

story:
We are students at The University of Tennessee and we are wanting to raise money for The Dream Connection, a non-profit organization here in East Tennessee, that raises money for children with life-threatening illnesses to provide them with a dream of their choice.  

 

Charlotte Spaulding "Charlie" is a 6-year-old girl who has been fighting Acute Leukemia for 2 years. Acute Leukemia is a type of cancer of the blood and bone marrow that affects white blood cells. The Dream Connection is raising money for Charlie to go to Disney World and have the Bibbidi-Bobbidi-Boutique experience! The Bibbidi Bobbidi Boutique is a magical beauty salon at the Magic Kingdom where little girls can get princess makeovers. Charlie wants to get a makeover like Belle from Beauty and the Beast. She told us they also have a swimming pool and all you can eat ice cream. She is super excited about that!

 

When we got to meet Charlie we learned so much about her. She has a little sister (Emma) and a big sister (Caitlin). Charlie's favorite color is yellow. She LOVES Batman! All the things she wants for Christmas are Batman related. She told us when she gets older she wants to be a firefighter, an artist, and an oncology nurse.

 

 If you can't make a donation then simply sharing the link to get the word out will help us out! Thank you so much for your help making Charlie's wish come true!!
