story:
Story

The birth center will be run by Lindsay Kinman, (LDM) a licensed Oregon midwife. Lindsay is a sharp, thoughtful, empathic provider who facilitates safe loving passages for birthing women, babies, and their families. Lindsay is a wife and mother of three who persisted for her dream through years as a nursing assistant, empowering families as a doula, obtaining a bachelors of science in midwifery, and ultimately offering full maternity care as a trusted and experienced midwife. She has supported the birth process in hospitals, in homes, and in freestanding birth centers. Her goal, and her heart, in every encounter, has been for women to find the power they have within to bring their children into the world and for the process to leave them whole and well. Mothers she has cared for will attest to her sound judgment, joyful presence, and unwavering support throughout the birth process and beyond. 

The long-term vision for the Believing in Birth Wellness Center includes the opportunity for women to receive whole-person care in one setting with services such as nutrition classes, counseling, and obstetrics, in a model that emphasizes wholeness and wellbeing. The startup you will be supporting will get the central freestanding birth center up and running.

How Much Do We Need?

  • We need to raise $250,000. This will cover construction and renovation, provide 6 months of operating capital, and $25,000 for set up (office supplies, computers, gynecological tables, etc.)
  • Perks include Ruby Rain Organics gift boxes, T-shirts, free advertising and web site promotion, and more!
  • We have chosen flexible funding which means that we will take what we earn to start the process of getting the center up and running. Every penny counts!

What do your contributions mean?

-Your contributions will allow Believing in Birth to offer the unique kind of care that is available in a freestanding birth center- in a setting that is directly across the street from a hospital but unencumbered by hospital schedules.

-Your contributions will turn the concerns of women who cannot afford the kind of care they seek into the excitement and relief of a family who finds an organization that will not turn them away.

-Your contributions will affirm that there is a safe place for those seeking birth experiences with the utilization of interventions only when sufficient evidence suggests it would be efficacious.

-Your contributions will ensure that women and their families have the full extent of birthways available, which research has proven necessary for meeting the wide variety of needs that women bring to such a demanding, powerful, and transformative time as birth.

-Your contribution allows us to provide maternity care, information, and support to ensure the wellbeing of all women in our community and beyond.

The Impact

What would happen to the mothers and babies in our area if one community used all of the tools at its disposal to support and care for them? What would happen to families if they felt in control of their birth process? What would happen if we limited trauma and unnecessary interventions? What would it look like if access to such care was not based on insurance or ability to pay?

We believe that your ongoing support will allow Believing in Birth to provide tangible answers to these questions in such a way as to offer a hopeful and healing path forward, building resilient families one birth at a time. We are certain that Believing in Birth Wellness Center is the initial brick in an intricate and grassroots-led path of whole-woman care.

Risks & Challenges

Non-profits often suffer common pitfalls, and we are working hard to wrestle with the kinds of barriers that can be expected. For instance, to ensure that we are not duplicating services, but instead meeting unique and unmet needs, Lindsay is already networking with established obstetricians and midwives in the area.

The birth center has a unique advantage in its setting. Rather than purchasing, building, or completely renovating, Believing in Birth will lease a building that already meets stringent codes and standards. Thus funding will allow a remodel in order to create two birthing rooms and otherwise will utilize already existing spaces for services such as clinic, counseling, and birth education.

We realize that after initial startups, non-profits often fail or limp along due to inadequate attention to ongoing fundraising. Believing in Birth will persist in creating and maintaining donor databases, record-keeping, and relationships that foster thriving organizations. The center already has multiple dedicated volunteers who believe whole-heartedly in the cause.

Our board, although in its infancy, consists of business professionals who have extensive experience in both for-profit and nonprofit realms. They are actively assisting in the planning and development of this birth center in hope to overcome challenges that inhibit other nonprofits.

Finally, Believing in Birth recognizes the risk of losing a personal connection to donors as the list of donors grows. We commit ourselves to the grateful and graceful attempt to keep our donors informed, connected, and appreciated as we grow.

Other Ways You Can Help

Launching the Believing in Birth Wellness Center in Silverton, OR has been Lindsay’s dream for many years. She has inspired confidence in others to jump on board because it’s based on the belief that we as a community can gather around and support all women- putting aside bias and fear. We want to provide whole-woman care that betters the community, but we need your help to make it a reality!

Can’t donate financially? There are other ways to help! If you have a trade that would be beneficial to the restoration of the original setting, to include two birthing rooms, please let us know! If you have a trade that might support the long-term vision for the center in any way, including services or products beneficial to pregnant and parenting families, please get in touch and let’s partner. Finally, sharing this campaign goes a long ways in helping us move the vision into reality, and we are grateful for any and all ways that you pass on our information and our needs.
story_txt:
Story
The birth center will be run by Lindsay Kinman, (LDM) a licensed Oregon midwife. Lindsay is a sharp, thoughtful, empathic provider who facilitates safe loving passages for birthing women, babies, and their families. Lindsay is a wife and mother of three who persisted for her dream through years as a nursing assistant, empowering families as a doula, obtaining a bachelors of science in midwifery, and ultimately offering full maternity care as a trusted and experienced midwife. She has supported the birth process in hospitals, in homes, and in freestanding birth centers. Her goal, and her heart, in every encounter, has been for women to find the power they have within to bring their children into the world and for the process to leave them whole and well. Mothers she has cared for will attest to her sound judgment, joyful presence, and unwavering support throughout the birth process and beyond. 
The long-term vision for the Believing in Birth Wellness Center includes the opportunity for women to receive whole-person care in one setting with services such as nutrition classes, counseling, and obstetrics, in a model that emphasizes wholeness and wellbeing. The startup you will be supporting will get the central freestanding birth center up and running.

How Much Do We Need?

We need to raise $250,000. This will cover construction and renovation, provide 6 months of operating capital, and $25,000 for set up (office supplies, computers, gynecological tables, etc.)
Perks include Ruby Rain Organics gift boxes, T-shirts, free advertising and web site promotion, and more!
We have chosen flexible funding which means that we will take what we earn to start the process of getting the center up and running. Every penny counts!


What do your contributions mean?
-Your contributions will allow Believing in Birth to offer the unique kind of care that is available in a freestanding birth center- in a setting that is directly across the street from a hospital but unencumbered by hospital schedules.
-Your contributions will turn the concerns of women who cannot afford the kind of care they seek into the excitement and relief of a family who finds an organization that will not turn them away.
-Your contributions will affirm that there is a safe place for those seeking birth experiences with the utilization of interventions only when sufficient evidence suggests it would be efficacious.
-Your contributions will ensure that women and their families have the full extent of birthways available, which research has proven necessary for meeting the wide variety of needs that women bring to such a demanding, powerful, and transformative time as birth.
-Your contribution allows us to provide maternity care, information, and support to ensure the wellbeing of all women in our community and beyond.
The Impact
What would happen to the mothers and babies in our area if one community used all of the tools at its disposal to support and care for them? What would happen to families if they felt in control of their birth process? What would happen if we limited trauma and unnecessary interventions? What would it look like if access to such care was not based on insurance or ability to pay?
We believe that your ongoing support will allow Believing in Birth to provide tangible answers to these questions in such a way as to offer a hopeful and healing path forward, building resilient families one birth at a time. We are certain that Believing in Birth Wellness Center is the initial brick in an intricate and grassroots-led path of whole-woman care.

Risks & Challenges
Non-profits often suffer common pitfalls, and we are working hard to wrestle with the kinds of barriers that can be expected. For instance, to ensure that we are not duplicating services, but instead meeting unique and unmet needs, Lindsay is already networking with established obstetricians and midwives in the area.
The birth center has a unique advantage in its setting. Rather than purchasing, building, or completely renovating, Believing in Birth will lease a building that already meets stringent codes and standards. Thus funding will allow a remodel in order to create two birthing rooms and otherwise will utilize already existing spaces for services such as clinic, counseling, and birth education.
We realize that after initial startups, non-profits often fail or limp along due to inadequate attention to ongoing fundraising. Believing in Birth will persist in creating and maintaining donor databases, record-keeping, and relationships that foster thriving organizations. The center already has multiple dedicated volunteers who believe whole-heartedly in the cause.
Our board, although in its infancy, consists of business professionals who have extensive experience in both for-profit and nonprofit realms. They are actively assisting in the planning and development of this birth center in hope to overcome challenges that inhibit other nonprofits.
Finally, Believing in Birth recognizes the risk of losing a personal connection to donors as the list of donors grows. We commit ourselves to the grateful and graceful attempt to keep our donors informed, connected, and appreciated as we grow.

Other Ways You Can Help
Launching the Believing in Birth Wellness Center in Silverton, OR has been Lindsay’s dream for many years. She has inspired confidence in others to jump on board because it’s based on the belief that we as a community can gather around and support all women- putting aside bias and fear. We want to provide whole-woman care that betters the community, but we need your help to make it a reality!
Can’t donate financially? There are other ways to help! If you have a trade that would be beneficial to the restoration of the original setting, to include two birthing rooms, please let us know! If you have a trade that might support the long-term vision for the center in any way, including services or products beneficial to pregnant and parenting families, please get in touch and let’s partner. Finally, sharing this campaign goes a long ways in helping us move the vision into reality, and we are grateful for any and all ways that you pass on our information and our needs.

story:
WHO WE ARE

We are a small, diverse group of yoga teachers dedicated to bringing the practice of yoga to underserved communities who have been been left out of the mainstream yoga story. We are also first time business owners, yoga teachers, artists and practitioners of limited means who, like most people in our communities, know what it's like to struggle to make ends meet. We know how vital affordable yoga can be for that struggle. 

By the generosity of a small group of private investors, we have been able to raise about half of the start-up money needed to cover the initial costs of opening a studio. What we need is your help, to raise an additional $10,000 to cover the remainder of our opening costs. This will allow us to deliver the utmost care within each and every one of our classes, at an accessible cost to students, as we promote and grow a sustainable, affordable yoga studio from the ground up. 

 

WHAT WE’RE ABOUT

Our classes will be taught as accessibly as possible, with an emphasis on body positivity, awareness, and personal empowerment through breath, movement and sound. 

Every class will be an All Levels Vinyasa class, for beginners and veteran practitioners alike.

Every class will be a $5-15 donation on a sliding scale, based on each student’s estimation of their need. No one will be turned away for lack of funds.

We value an ethic of accessibility in all areas of studio management - from the language of class dialogue and class costs, to centering the needs of the most marginalized communities. 

The goal of this studio is not really to redefine what yoga is, but to ask what it can be; not to redefine who it should or shouldn’t be for, but to ask the question, who hasn’t had access to yoga, and how can we change that? 

We seek to create a spaces and program where wellness-minded people of all backgrounds and experiences can gather in community and solidarity. 

 

OUR LOCATION

The space is a “raw” gallery-style space downtown, at the intersection of the warehouse and arts districts and Little Tokyo, with a lot of potential. Trees filled with birds line the relatively quiet street outside, with ample parking nearby and a reasonable walk from Metro and bus lines. 

We seek to preserve the integrity and openness of the space while bringing very minimal changes for the maximum comfort and accessibility for our students. Drawing on our experiences managing yoga studios from NYC, to the Bay area, from huge warehouse spaces to cozy in-home studios, we seek to create a space that is homey but clean, spiritually inclined but agnostic, so that the broadest audience we can envision can come and deepen their relationships with themselves in safety and community. 

 

THANK YOU!

Thank you for helping us realize this dream! Together we can bring yoga to the communities that need it the most. If you're unable to help, please consider sharing this page through your networks and stay tuned for announcements about our opening dates and events! Much love xoxo 

www.communityyogaLA.org

 

Some pictures of the space as it is!

story:
Our story

When Dr. Carolin Dohle, a young mother with a two and a half-year-old son, was diagnosed with early-stage breast cancer in September 2015, she studied her options, met with two surgeons, and decided to have a lumpectomy the following month. While a mastectomy is always accompanied by a radical removal of all lymph nodes in the axilla on the affected side, a lumpectomy is a lot less invasive... however some “sentinel lymph nodes” are also removed.

After her surgery, she was given a booklet with a link to a video with some exercises to do, and then she was on her own. After healing, she began lifting weights to regain her strength which ultimately led to her learning she had lymphedema, which often goes undiagnosed.

Dr. Dohle wanted to help other women, and when she shared her story with friends, they decided to establish DivaCare as an initiative providing a platform designed for women who find themselves in similar situations.

DivaCare was born in 2016 with a focused goal to develop, deliver, and enhance a mobile application that women can use to improve their health, wellness, and lives after breast cancer surgery through safe and guided exercises.

Dr. Carolin Dohle

-- I am the founder of DivaCare.

My Personal Story

The idea for DivaCare came from my personal experience with breast cancer.

I was diagnosed with stage 1 invasive ductal carcinoma 2 years ago, at the age of 37. At the time, I had a two and a half year old son and was working full time as a physician. The diagnosis came as a complete shock to me; in an instant, my life was turned upside down.

I remember a whirlwind of appointments, talks about prognosis, procedures, fertility.

After much deliberation, and consultations with several experts, I decided to undergo a lumpectomy followed by 6 weeks of radiation therapy.

The Problem

What came as a real surprise though was how much these therapies affected my life.

I was considered cured, but I was not nearly back to normal. Despite having had a relatively “minor” procedure, I developed some heaviness and pain in my arm that was later diagnosed as early lymphedema.

I experienced a decreased range of motion in my right arm and because it was so tight and painful, I had no idea how I could safely return to my previous life. Could I go back to yoga? Lift weights? Carry my son? Carry heavy shopping bags?

All of the most recent literature shows that exercise after breast cancer therapy is probably beneficial in avoiding complications such as lymphedema, but there is very little information about how to exercise safely.

I had been given stretching exercises after my surgery and initially responded quite well to them. However, the tricky part about radiation is that it will change your tissue immediately after you finish treatments, and for months afterward, so you have to keep going with your exercises even after you are officially “done”.

Why Is This Problem Important

Overall, I was surprised to find during my breast cancer journey that rehabilitation was an overlooked and shockingly neglected topic.

While I was undergoing diagnostic studies and treatments, I was in regular touch with my doctors and nurses. But when treatments were done, that interaction was suddenly much less frequent, even though I had just begun the recovery “journey” and was still far from being normal.

As a neurologist, I specialize in stroke rehabilitation. I see firsthand the importance of rehabilitation after a devastating illness. I believe that there are many women out there that have very significant limitations after their breast cancer treatments, and are often not aware that physical therapy can help some of these symptoms.

What Is Our Solution

At DivaCare, we want to give you the tools you need to rehabilitate from breast cancer treatment.

Our app will ask you if you have symptoms, and suggest that you ask your doctor to refer you to physical therapy if you do. We will provide a list of PTs specializing in breast cancer rehab in your area.

We will give you exercises, and our app will remind you to do these exercises- whether you have 2 min, 5 min or 15 minutes available that day to do them.

We will provide videos of yoga and pilates that are adapted to the need of breast cancer survivors. You will also find tips on nutrition, wellness, and meditation, as well as makeup tutorials after chemotherapy and tips on how to get through chemo and radiation therapy a bit easier.

Whether you are considered cured, in remission, or are still undergoing treatments, DivaCare aims to help you alleviate the side effects.

Frank Fleming

-- I help out with the business and technological development at DivaCare.

Who Would Use The Platform?

1 in 8 women in the U.S. will be diagnosed with breast cancer in their lifetime.

In 2016 there will be approximately 246,660 new cases of invasive breast cancer diagnosed.

More than 2.8 million breast cancer survivors in the United States

The DivaCare app fills the information void in care and offers easy access to:
-- Information and inspiration.
-- An interactive community.
-- Remote connection to an expert physical therapy provider.
-- Video exercises to actively engage them in their surgical rehab.

Business Model

DivaCare’s immediate goal of is to raise between $500k and $1.5m for content and software development, exercise video creation, and marketing which will bring the DivaCare app to hundreds of thousands of women receiving a breast cancer diagnosis each year.

We are doing this through corporate sponsorship, grants, and your donations.

As we develop this approach and our user base we foresee larger opportunities for distribution, sponsorship and even white labeled licensing of portions of the application.

DivaCare is pending approval by the Internal Revenue Service as a 501 (C) (3) tax-exempt organization

Sustainability

We are simplifying the complex system of approaches to the restoration, management, and optimization of a woman’s health before and after breast cancer surgery.

Our product roadmap embraces a broad spectrum of recovery practices having a sound scientific and environmental basis that are environmentally, economically & socially viable.

Who are our Competitors?

There are many physiotherapy and wellness apps in the field addressing various aspects of breast cancer.

There are currently no self-serve or physical therapist-driven software products that can comprehensively deliver expert, evidence-based multi-discipline resources to the pre-and post-habilitation breast cancer surgery patient.

How do we approach the Market?

Our approach thus far has been through community events, fundraisers and word of mouth resulting in negotiations with health care & cancer centers, community activists, corporations, boards and individual therapists who intrinsically understand our uniquely personal story and user-generated content.

Validation

We are currently working with 2 healthcare centers, a global financial services firm and a pharmaceutical company to establish our socially responsible “founders circle”.

Our Team

I am business development professional specializing in startups and directing the efforts of our company Interlecta in getting this platform off the ground.

Why do we need money?

The product, platform and program design and application development stages over the past 18 months have been internally funded. We need funds to graduate the product from technological feasibility to General Availability.

This comes at a particularly critical time when both DivaCare and the breast cancer awareness marketplace are experiencing dramatic growth.

More women than ever are asking for a platform/companion to guide them through this emotional and personal journey and assist them with Pre-& Post Breast Cancer surgery health needs. The additional funding gives us the opportunity to build upon this momentum.

The platform currently pairs clients with therapists specializing in breast cancer through their DivaCare website and mobile app. We intend to expand this to an array of specific services and wellness treatments.

How Are We Going тo Spend It?

We will use our crowdfund returns to move forward and expand further into the underserved and overdue delivery of expert, evidence-based multi-discipline resources to the pre-and post-habilitation breast cancer surgery patient.

We will apply funds to R&D, the creation of pre & post surgery and specialized physical therapy exercise training videos as well as indirect costs related to licensing existing content.

Costs associated with software testing (i.e. alpha, beta tests), maintenance, bug fixes, QA, customer support services and other direct production costs associated with bringing the DivaCare mobile platform services to market.

Neven Boyanov

-- I lead the technology at DivaCare.

What is our solution?

We’re building a cloud-based mobile platform that connects patients with their Doctor, physical therapy provider, support group, video exercises and a constantly growing list of resources and services….

The mobile app

The user will receive important information on their mobile phone regarding their treatment plan and condition as well as scheduled appointments and remote exercises.

The therapist dashboard

The therapists have access to an online dashboard where they are able to communicate with their patients, schedule their activities as well as monitor their progress.

Our team

I have a masters degree in Mathematics and Computer Science.

I am Currently working on my Ph.D. thesis in the field of cryptography.

Future

We’re adding new capabilities such as metadata analysis and the use of artificial intelligence.

Features such as integration of smart bracelet support to more effectively track and monitor user exercises as well as video call capability from the mobile app directly to the therapist were recently added. More features are on the way.

Why we need money?

We have already built a working prototype of the platform as well as run some trials within a closed beta group of friends.

We have reached that critical stage where we need to move development to get to the “next stage” and begin integrating a new set of more sophisticated features and modules to the platform.

As a sign of appreciation, we will give you free access to our closed beta program.

Call for action

Support our crowd-funding campaign and help us build that platform.

story:
Who are We?

We are Tupaarnaq and Adam Kopeck.  We've been passionate about teaching Bikram Yoga for a combined experience of 13 years.  Tupaarnaq, a studied Banker from Greenland, loves what yoga has relieved her from regular migraine attacks.  Her mission is now to be able to share her learning and experience with everyone willing to participate.  Adam, a licensed auto mechanic from Canada, originally started practicing to alleviate bad knees and constant back pain.  What started as relief from physical pain, has now transformed into a long life passion to learning and teaching the power of harnessing the mind through the use of yoga.

Transforming our outback house into a hot yoga studio has become our 2018 mission project to help more people understand the unprecedented power that studying yoga has to give.  We've taken on this challenge as our karmic yoga to help many others to realise their true potential in leading healthier and happier lives.      

By contributing to this build, it directly affects roughly 75,000 people by bringing convenience and accessibility of hot yoga to the local area where 8 out of 10 people are directly affected by stress, one of the todays leading causes of disease and mental instability.  A big vision to change the world often begins with small steps in the right direction.  We feel starting in our local community with our neighbours and friends is a way we can begin to influence the world to a more balanced way of life.

 

How you can Help?

As it stands, the building we are transforming was built in 1850 to function as a blacksmiths shop.  Over the years it's seen some challenges.  The transformation to a yoga studio includes:

First Part of the Budget - 30,000 

  • New roof and removal of the second floor
  • Removal of existing walls
  • Removal and rebuild of concrete floor with heating
  • New plumbing and electrical
  • Closing of unnecessary doors and windows

Remaining Budget for completion of the Studio Build - 50,000

  • Heat pump and Humidifier
  • Subwalls and Insulation
  • Finished ceiling and lighting
  • Showers and Toilet 
  • Painting and finished flooring 
  • Mirrors and doors

A successful campaign to raise the initial amount gives us the opportunity to involve our bank to get us the rest of the way to seeing this dream become reality.

Help us get the word out and make some noise, Click the Back it! button as well as the ease of use social media buttons beside it.
story_txt:
Who are We?
We are Tupaarnaq and Adam Kopeck.  We've been passionate about teaching Bikram Yoga for a combined experience of 13 years.  Tupaarnaq, a studied Banker from Greenland, loves what yoga has relieved her from regular migraine attacks.  Her mission is now to be able to share her learning and experience with everyone willing to participate.  Adam, a licensed auto mechanic from Canada, originally started practicing to alleviate bad knees and constant back pain.  What started as relief from physical pain, has now transformed into a long life passion to learning and teaching the power of harnessing the mind through the use of yoga.
Transforming our outback house into a hot yoga studio has become our 2018 mission project to help more people understand the unprecedented power that studying yoga has to give.  We've taken on this challenge as our karmic yoga to help many others to realise their true potential in leading healthier and happier lives.      
By contributing to this build, it directly affects roughly 75,000 people by bringing convenience and accessibility of hot yoga to the local area where 8 out of 10 people are directly affected by stress, one of the todays leading causes of disease and mental instability.  A big vision to change the world often begins with small steps in the right direction.  We feel starting in our local community with our neighbours and friends is a way we can begin to influence the world to a more balanced way of life.
 

How you can Help?
As it stands, the building we are transforming was built in 1850 to function as a blacksmiths shop.  Over the years it's seen some challenges.  The transformation to a yoga studio includes:
First Part of the Budget - 30,000 

New roof and removal of the second floor
Removal of existing walls
Removal and rebuild of concrete floor with heating
New plumbing and electrical
Closing of unnecessary doors and windows

Remaining Budget for completion of the Studio Build - 50,000

Heat pump and Humidifier
Subwalls and Insulation
Finished ceiling and lighting
Showers and Toilet 
Painting and finished flooring 
Mirrors and doors

A successful campaign to raise the initial amount gives us the opportunity to involve our bank to get us the rest of the way to seeing this dream become reality.
Help us get the word out and make some noise, Click the Back it! button as well as the ease of use social media buttons beside it.

story:
The Project

The purely natural and strikingly beautiful and serene environment of the Ecuadorian Amazon is the perfect setting for a Zen temple. That was our thought in 2014, when we moved to Ecuador with the mission of building a Zen temple in this very particular region.


Dedicated to spreading the authentic practice of zazen as we are, we, Gyula and Caroline, a Zen monk and nun (from the Mokusho sangha, Deshimaru lineage, disciples of Master Yvon Myoken Bec), have now been living in Tena, in the Amazonas area of Ecuador, where we are already practicing with a small group of people.


Wanting to move forward with our project to build the first ever Zen temple in Ecuador and in the Ecuadorian Amazon, we already bought a beautiful plot of land outside the town, where we are going to build this very special place dedicateted to the pure practice of zazen. The land is in the outskirts of the Colonso Chalupas protected area, crossed by two streams, surrounded by the jungle, so the surroundings could not invite more to a peaceful life of practice.


The Execution

The temple will be built of bamboo, using the local traditional building techniques, and the work will be carried out by sangha members, friends and volunteers. This will be a beautiful and balanced self-sustainable place that will accommodate people who truly want to practice the Buddha Way.


To make it, we need to:

  • Build a road and a bridge to facilitate the access to the temple site. The building will be elevated by 1m in concrete pillars. The construction itself will be mainly bamboo and adobe. We estimate the costs of building materials to be around $12.000.

  • Install electricity (we need to cover a distance of 500m), which will cost $2.500.

  • Bring water. There are two streams running across the land from which we can take water for most uses. We need a pump and pipes to bring it to the temple, and tanks to make a water purification system for drinking water, which will cost $2.500.

  • Cover the travel costs for the architect and the bamboo builder expert who are going to supervise the construction works, which will require $3.000.


The Outlook

We intend to firstly build the main structure of the building and the dojo. If we do not manage to reach our funding goal of $20,000 for the completed work, we will build as much as we can – and then continue to do so with the help of the sangha.


The Purpose

We believe this temple will have a very positive influence for the local community and the society as a whole. A zen temple is a place where you can practice together with others, regardless of the differences of beliefs, creeds, languages and culture. It will also offer a place where people can practice the Way of awakening and from where this teaching can spread through space and time.


The Master’s Encouragement

Our Master, Yvon Myoken Bec, has offered us a very appreciated encouragement. In his own words, "Gyula Mokurin Barna and Caroline Nyoze Bacquet are two monks of the Deshimaru-Zeisler lineage who've been practicing with me for several years in Europe. They intend to establish a place of practice in Ecuador to continue there the teaching and transmission lineage of Master Deshimaru with the help of the Universe, meaning You".


If this calling makes as much sense to you as it makes to us, we invite you to please take a look at the rewards that we have on offer, selecting your way of supporting this wonderful project that all Zen students will surely appreciate.


We also invite you to share it with your friends and family members who may also be interested in supporting the construction of Ecuador’s first Zen temple.


Also, keep in mind that the climate and the low living costs here make it possible for anybody to come and practice with us – so you are more than welcome to come and join us!


If you cannot make a financial contribution to this project, you are still very welcome to come and help with the actual building work. Food and accommodation will be provided for the helpers, and you can also take part in the Zen practice.


Thank you very much and we hope to be reporting soon with very good news about the project’s progress.

story:
A Healing Space Accessible to All

  • Hawai'i Spiritual Center is a fiscally sponsored 501(c)3 organization, which means all your donations are tax-deductible.
  • Help create an epicenter for healing in paradise with lush tropical garden foods and a top-quality retreat to help care for the mind, body and soul. 
  • Hawai'i Spiritual Center looks into a beautiful valley that is bordered by the Kaluanui Stream which flows from the legendary Sacred Falls 
  • Our team is comprised of visionaries, healers and entrepreneurs who aim to serve all those who love Hawai'i and anyone seeking to heal by communing with nature.

Our Offering to You

  • We’re happy to share our gifts to you as we work to fund our first phase of improvements that will cost an estimated $300,000
  • All contributions will go to the completion of top-quality eco-friendly accommodations, consecrated medicinal gardens and edible landscaping. 
  •  Please support us and receive the gifts for being a part of our movement!
  • Remember, all donations are tax-deductible and come with a gift, which means that everything is free. You receive your gift and your money gets returned to you when you file taxes. 
  • Find out more at the link below https://hawaiispiritualcenter.org/

Our Vison to Empower our Community

Hawai'i Spiritual Center exists to share with the world an example of tending to land as a spiritual practice and as a path to healing and transformation.

  • In this era of great transition, we endeavor to be a beacon of light representing the qualities of the Divine Masculine and Divine Feminine to the world without prejudice 
  • In the short time that we have been preparing our space, we have had over 100 people attending various volunteer days and fundraising events, with a deep desire to be a part of this project 
  • We are honored to have the support from well-respected and established local organizations, facilitators and Hawaiian Cultural Practitioners 

Risks & Challenges 

We are cleaning up a piece of land that has been ignored for many years. This valley had over 100 cars strewn all about just a decade ago. The structures on the land require many upgrades and our commitment to taking it one step at a time will be valuable as we face the challenges of building this center from the ground up.

  • Our Executive Team have had many years of experience in the corporate, start-up and entrepreneurial sector while being connected to the spiritual aspirations of living in integrity with intention and guided by our intuition
  • With your support, we will be able to hire capable consultants and to have the funds to implement the vision of a peaceful and transformative space

Other Ways to Help

If our message touches your heart, we would so appreciate your contribution even it if is not monetary.  

  • Please share this to get the word out and spread the spirit of love all around.
  • Indiegogo has created tools to make it easy for you to share on your social media

story:
Yoga In Our City began in Hartford in 2012 by providing one free yoga class each week in Bushnell Park. The response was tremendous, even life-changing, and so the rally to create more reach, more access and more program sustainability began.

This year, the program has grown to offer six classes every week in Hartford while also launching programs serving up multiple more weekly classes in Bridgeport, New Haven and Waterbury! 

This campaign is an opportunity to help grow the schedule in your community and support our partner studios and teachers. These perks are a great way to keep your yoga practice as well as free access to others going into the fall and hopefully beyond.

Thank you Vasu Studio, Breathing Room Yoga Center, Great Heart Yoga and the City of Waterbury, Parks and Recreation for making this program possible!

story:
JOJOMOKA Skincare is a single-origin skincare product line that is completely free from chemicals and focuses on the natural essence of the ingredients.

By simply focusing on the five of the highest quality natural ingredients, JOJOMOKA has redefined the way we approach skincare and delivers the most holistic and sustainable skincare line, like no other.

 

          

                

"Japanese spa and wellness veteran to launch DIY skincare brand." - Cosmetic design-asia*

"(JOJOMOKA) is on a mission and it’s a big one. Her vision is nothing less than convert people to using home made all-natural skin care and to stop them buying it from Big Cosmetic." - AsiaSentinel*

(JOJOMOKA's) advice as an independent consultant is much in demand throughout the industry regionally." - AsiaSentinel*

"..the perfect resource for self-discovery in health, beauty, and happiness." - Luxruve*

Please see our website: www.jojomoka.net* for more media coverage.​

*refer to the relevant links to the foot note.

 

 

 

Our products are directly sourced from artisanal farmers that share our core values of sustainability, simplicity, and fair trade. Each product can be applied as a standalone product or it can be blended with each other to deliver the most comprehensive and flexible skincare regimen for every unique individual. With simplicity at its core, we have distilled the essence of what skincare is all about into 5 raw ingredients. 

 

JOJOMOKA’s extremely stringent process of identifying and working with the most ethical farmers enables us to have a hand in developing the safest products to be delivered to you. Our products contain zero chemicals while our packaging is 100% recyclable and biodegradable.

Skincare products should only contain ingredients that your skin needs. Nothing more, nothing less. JOJOMOKA products retain the highest level of natural nutrients in each ingredient.

JOJOMOKA products are designed to work singly or in blended fashion within the product line or with natural food ingredients found in your kitchen. To achieve holistic long term health, blending our ingredients will amplify the efficacy of our products.

  • How do you really know that the natural and organic skincare products you buy are truly safe for your health and environment? The average woman uses 12 personal care products daily (or nearly 3,000 products in her lifetime) and 89% of more than 10,000 ingredients that go into these products have not been evaluated for safety*. 
  • The average age of starting to wear make-up is getting as young as 11*.
  • Synthetic ingredients formulated in commercial skincare products are often called functional ingredients: to smoothen, to stabilise or to thicken, it makes the product usable but in reality it does very little, if nothing, to the health of your skin.
  • Skincare businesses spend more time and money on packaging than the ingredients of a product. 

*refer to the relevant links in the foot note

 

 

Through our work, we became aware how commercial skincare ingredients are mass produced and laden with toxic pesticides. Those ingredients are traded at very low price because there are many companies in between before a skincare product is marketed. 

On the other hand, there are a small group of artisan farms who produce the highest quality skincare ingredients, that are not only organically grown and food-grade but also produced in the most labour-intensive traditional methods. When we visited those farmers, we realised that many of them are forced to turn to unsustainable mass production methods to survive. 

That is where JOJOMOKA comes in: to bring these products to market fairly, sustainably and affordably. 

The majority of JOJOMOKA products are sourced from Japan. Japan has a long tradition of natural therapy using well-studied indigenous herbs and plants grown across the country in diversified natural habitats. Japan has a well-deserved reputation for its dedication to quality, producing many effective and innovative raw ingredients for skincare products. 

This is the list of the perks you can enjoy when you join JOJOMOKA Indiegogo campaign. Select your choice of perk from the sidebar at the top of this page.

 

Beauty Confidential book Soft cover, 174 pages

A holistic natural beauty guide to natural ingredients and personalised homemade skincare recipes you can get started today.

 

Natural Clay Set 100 gram each

Used as face mask or face scrub or blend with Plant Oil, Hydrosol or dry food to personalise. This pack includes the following 3 natural clays:

French Green: works to brighten the complexion and acts to replenish the skin wonderfully.

French White: renowned for its ability to purify the skin and hair, it instantly brightens while deeply revitalises.

French Pink: balances as it absorbs excess sebum, gently cleanses and stimulates natural defences, to give a look of renewed vigour.

 

Luxury Bath Soak Set 250 gram each

This pack includes the following 2 Bath Soaks that are curated by a team of Aromatherapists:

Deeply Blue CALM: A relaxing formula that calms the mild while also soothing the skin. Mineral salt, kelp, lavender, chamomile.

Intimately Pink DETOX: An uplifting formula that cleanses while also helping to tone, clarify and smoothen the skin. Himalayan pink salt, turmeric, bergamot, rose. 

 

Artisan Essential Oil Set 10 ml each

​

This pack includes the following 3 essential oils that are organically and wild grown and distilled by artisan farms:

Japanese Yuzu, Japanese Hinoki, Hokkaido Fir

 

JOJOMOKA Pure Skincare

This is the most comprehensive starter kit that includes a Beauty Confidential book (1 soft cover book and 1 eBook), Natural Clay (100 gram 3 packs), Essential Oils (10 ml 3 bottles), Luxury Bath Soak (250 gram 2 jars) and the following products:

Japanese Sunflower oil: Grown organically in the southern part of Japan, it contains twice as much  oleic acid and vitamin E compared to anything else in the market. Beneficial for anti-aging and pigmentation. It can be used as moisturiser or blended with Essential oil to personalise.

Hokkaido Yomogi Hydrosol: Wildly grown in Hokkaido, Yomogi (Japanese mugwort) is a very popular and versatile herb. It is known to improve complexion, treat acne and pigmentation. Suitable for normal skin. It can be used as a toner or blended with Essential oil or Castile Soap to personalise.

Castile Soap is made with a blend of Plant Oils, suitable for all skin types including sensitive skin.

 

Wholesale JOJOMOKA Skincare

It contains 25 sets of the JOJOMOKA Pure Skincare pack as above, excluding the Beauty Confidential book. 

Wellness Consultation with 10% discount

Not sure what products best suit you? No problem! Our professional wellness consultant will select the best suited products. We will send you a thorough questionnaire comprised of lifestyle and skincare routine in order to determine the best products to compliment your skincare. In addition, you will be entitled to receive additional 10% on any of the perks or the products that may be hidden from the list!

*Please note that the packing design listed as Perks is for illustration purpose only and the actual products may differ from the pictures.

  Tomoka Nguyen: Founder, Managing Director  

Tomoka is the author of Beauty Confidential and certified Aromatherapist, with extensive Spa & Wellness background in the capacity of Director and Vice President for prestigious brands like ESPA and The Peninsula.  She is professionally trained on perfumery, spa cuisines and natural skincare formulation.​ @TomokaNguyen 

   Hitomi Fujita: Research and Development 

After obtaining a degree in Business, Hitomi joined a growing skincare brand in Japan and travelled extensively to connect with producers in Japan and buyers overseas. She currently holds a senior position as a trading advisor in Japan. Her expertise lay in fine artisanal products to be found in Japan.

     Duen Punyashthiti: Creative Director       

With a Bachelor’s Degree in Fine Arts at Chulalongkorn University and a Master’s in Design at Domus Academy in Milan - Italy, Duen is an outstanding creative director, designer, and illustrator delivering award-winning creative design solutions for International skincare brands. Duen joined JOJOMOKA Skincare in 2017 to lead all creative design.

     Jacqueline Tan: Marketing Specialist

Jacqueline graduated from the National University of Singapore with a Bachelor degree in Business Management. She left her corporate Market Research job to pursue her passion in the wellness industry. She enjoys working with start-ups and is inspired by like-minded people. She is passionate about building brands and is constantly intrigued by the power of brands. 

In addition to our core team, JOJOMOKA works with industry's leading laboratory to assess the quality and the efficacy of our products.  And of course we work closely with exceptional group of farmers in Japan who are committed to their farms and produces. 

We spent several years testing the formula and now we selected amazing and unique products to bring to the market. Now we need your help. Your support will allow us to initiate manufacturing and bottling of the products so we can make JOJOMOKA Skincare available to you and the millions of people who have never had such pure and safe skincare option.

Let's make a difference in how people perceive skincare products and make our skincare cleaner and holistic.

  • Be the first to experience the product.
  • You've never been satisfied with your skincare and always wanted a truly holistic and simplified skincare that is safe for you and the environment.
  • You love the idea of transparency through skincare knowing how it is supporting the small farms and community.

Related links:

  • Press

Cosmetic design-asia

AsiaSentinel

Luxruve

www.jojomoka.net

  • Facts about skincare

Safety of the skincare

Average age of wearing make-up

This is the most comprehensive starter kit that includes a Beauty Confidential book (1 soft cover book and 1 eBook), Natural Clay (100 gram 3 packs), Essential Oils (10 ml 3 bottles), Luxury Bath Soak (250 gram 2 jars) and the following products:
Japanese Sunflower oil: Grown organically in the southern part of Japan, it contains twice as much  oleic acid and vitamin E compared to anything else in the market. Beneficial for anti-aging and pigmentation. It can be used as moisturiser or blended with Essential oil to personalise.
Hokkaido Yomogi Hydrosol: Wildly grown in Hokkaido, Yomogi (Japanese mugwort) is a very popular and versatile herb. It is known to improve complexion, treat acne and pigmentation. Suitable for normal skin. It can be used as a toner or blended with Essential oil or Castile Soap to personalise.
Castile Soap is made with a blend of Plant Oils, suitable for all skin types including sensitive skin.
 
Wholesale JOJOMOKA Skincare

It contains 25 sets of the JOJOMOKA Pure Skincare pack as above, excluding the Beauty Confidential book. 
Wellness Consultation with 10% discount
Not sure what products best suit you? No problem! Our professional wellness consultant will select the best suited products. We will send you a thorough questionnaire comprised of lifestyle and skincare routine in order to determine the best products to compliment your skincare. In addition, you will be entitled to receive additional 10% on any of the perks or the products that may be hidden from the list!
*Please note that the packing design listed as Perks is for illustration purpose only and the actual products may differ from the pictures.
  Tomoka Nguyen: Founder, Managing Director  Tomoka is the author of Beauty Confidential and certified Aromatherapist, with extensive Spa & Wellness background in the capacity of Director and Vice President for prestigious brands like ESPA and The Peninsula.  She is professionally trained on perfumery, spa cuisines and natural skincare formulation.​ @TomokaNguyen    Hitomi Fujita: Research and Development After obtaining a degree in Business, Hitomi joined a growing skincare brand in Japan and travelled extensively to connect with producers in Japan and buyers overseas. She currently holds a senior position as a trading advisor in Japan. Her expertise lay in fine artisanal products to be found in Japan.     Duen Punyashthiti: Creative Director       With a Bachelor’s Degree in Fine Arts at Chulalongkorn University and a Master’s in Design at Domus Academy in Milan - Italy, Duen is an outstanding creative director, designer, and illustrator delivering award-winning creative design solutions for International skincare brands. Duen joined JOJOMOKA Skincare in 2017 to lead all creative design.     Jacqueline Tan: Marketing SpecialistJacqueline graduated from the National University of Singapore with a Bachelor degree in Business Management. She left her corporate Market Research job to pursue her passion in the wellness industry. She enjoys working with start-ups and is inspired by like-minded people. She is passionate about building brands and is constantly intrigued by the power of brands. In addition to our core team, JOJOMOKA works with industry's leading laboratory to assess the quality and the efficacy of our products.  And of course we work closely with exceptional group of farmers in Japan who are committed to their farms and produces. We spent several years testing the formula and now we selected amazing and unique products to bring to the market. Now we need your help. Your support will allow us to initiate manufacturing and bottling of the products so we can make JOJOMOKA Skincare available to you and the millions of people who have never had such pure and safe skincare option.Let's make a difference in how people perceive skincare products and make our skincare cleaner and holistic.
Be the first to experience the product.
You've never been satisfied with your skincare and always wanted a truly holistic and simplified skincare that is safe for you and the environment.
You love the idea of transparency through skincare knowing how it is supporting the small farms and community.
Related links:PressCosmetic design-asiaAsiaSentinelLuxruvewww.jojomoka.netFacts about skincareSafety of the skincareAverage age of wearing make-up

story:
Help us open Eclipse Studio this November!

With your help, Eclipse Studio will become a year-round community space in downtown Vineyard Haven. Open to all, the studio will offer affordable wellness, recovery, fitness, yoga, the arts, education, dance, music, and continuing education. The studio will also offer holistic services like massage, chiropractic, mindfulness & acupuncture. 

There are costly updates necessary to turn the studio space into something wonderful like this:

 

Short Summary

  • About two months ago, we became aware of a commercial space in need of renovation, right in the heart of Vineyard Haven. We were inspired by the possibilities.The only catch? Starting in the off-season with many, many renovations to be done. 
  •  We have a responsible business model at Eclipse that has proven profitability in the last ten years. We need your help (just this once) to cover the costs for winter rent and renovations in our start-up year. 
  • You can help us create a one-of-a-kind community space on Martha's Vineyard,

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need $35,000 to cover commercial rent, renovations, and other start-up costs this winter. Moving forward, we'll be able to generate this through summer profits. 
  • At nearly every donation level, there's an amazing massage package waiting for you!

The Impact

  • Increase year-round activities for the community that are varied and affordable.
  • Help us showcase local practitioners, artisans, musicians, and educators on the island!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Come by and say hello at 68 Lagoon Pond Road.
  • Rent the space for a community event or class.
  • Give us ideas for use of the space.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools and spread the word!

f


Crysalis Medicine Temple

Devi Temple - Sweatlodge- Rebirthing Chamber
Manifestation
Evolution of Creation
Seed and Womb
Cosmic Child Temple
Grace of the Divine Mother

Follow Progress at http://crysalismedicinetemple.tumblr.com

"Temple of the Heart"

An invitation to Artists, Avatars, Alchemists, Cosmic Children, Builders, Families, Healers, Mystics, Masters, Musicians, Magi, Rainbow Warriors, Prophets, Priestess’, Poets, Pathfinders, Filmmakers,  Shamans, Therapists, Visionaries, Yogis, Herbalists, Tantrics and Truth Bearers. Together we can embark on a sacred journey and a magical mission to create a sacred medicine healing space. With the blessings of The Great Mother, participate in the creation, collaboration and construction of a Cosmic Creative Chrysalis , the Seat of the Mother. 

Built with a Geodesic Dome and seating up to 40 people, this sacred temple is an ecological masterpiece, featuring sacred stones, plants, medicines and instruments from around the world.


Imagine the stem as a walkway lined with medicinal healing plants as one walks towards the Temple as the top loop. On either side of the stem are bath tubs for people to take herbal healing baths with the plant energies they choose to pick on walking up to the temple. 

The purpose of this Temple is to create a permanent, dedicated, consecrated space for ceremonies with sound healing journeys and plant allies . As a group project of construction and consecration, you are warmly invited to contribute either through suggestions, donations of healing or artistic resources ( plants, instruments, books, alchemical resources or suggestions etc ), financial donations for the yurt construction and your prayers.

The Universal Mother is the Supreme Cosmic Energy, Shakti, the creative life force responsible for the flowering of all life forms. As the Goddess of the universe, she is not only the intelligence behind nature but the electromagnetic, energetic root matrix responsible for birthing this planet ( and the entire universe) .

Co-creation of a Birthing Crysalis, a space to give Birth to our cosmic dreams, to witness the Ceremonial Activation of Higher Consciousness, Higher Art, Higher Healing and our Higher Selves. A space of community, connectivity, receptivity, remembrance, realisation, recalibration, illumination,  transcendence, transformation, knowledge and sacred healing and therapeutic arts. 

The temple is an invitation for considering transformational and transmutational technologies to be utilised for healing purposes such as water vortexes, plant alchemies, yogas and meditational practices, sound healing technologies ( gongs, crystal bowls etc )



The approx cost of the Dome is $30 000
The approx cost of the plants/instruments/ritual items is $2500
Recording Equipment $2500
Float Tank $5000
Tipi Village to accomodate Temple Visitors- $5000
Toilet Facilities- 5000
Sweat Lodge $5000
considering the total approx expenses to get this established- $55000
Please come visit the ashram retreat in Pt Elliot
www.authenticity.com.au

14-30 Waterport Road

Port Elliot, SA 5212

Please Support Visionary Art
www.alexcarletti.com
www.alexcarletti.tumblr.com
Keep updated for it's evolution at
http://crysalismedicinetemple.tumblr.com
Co-Creation of Heaven on Earth
Planet Art Whole
aho

story:
The giving of inspirational messaged Grails is based on a spiritual philosophy that when you choose to give a gift to inspire life, the returns are 10-fold!  The Law of 10-fold return is a universal principle wherein gifts freely given for spiritual use return to the grantor good fortune equal to, or greater than, 10-times the loss. 

The Law works on the principle that when a vacuum is created, it must be filled.  When a seed is planted, it will bear fruit greater than its weight and original value.  

Each Grail is hand-made (start-to-finish) in Scottsdale, Arizona.  Our main concern is quality over quantity.   

I am reaching to you because I would like your consideration to be part of Grail Giving.  I believe the Grail will benefit anyone who desires an object to serve as a reminder of how powerful and wonderful life is, especially in times of hardship or trouble.  

The Grails® are proudly handcrafted entirely in the USA.       

The current 2017 design is 5th-generation.  Grails are a physical reminder to help people change their outlook, attitude, and behavior in life through the inspirational messaging.  I consider myself a serial entrepreneur.  This adventure began with an idea and was launched on the proverbial “shoestring” while working more than five-years ago.  Production began in China, but after significant research and development, and constant networking, production of the Grail prototypes are now 100% in the USA.  

I am very proud, and honored, to think of the Grails® as a “shining light”.

All Grails are flameless and therefore safe for home and office.  

           

    

  ​                              

Bill Kurasz   CEO & Inspiriter

Abundant Thoughts was designed to impact and uplift people's lives.  A lifestyle for the new paradigm of shifting into authenticity and limitless living.  I navigate through this life consciously, creatively and collectively. I myself play an irreplaceable part in nurturing the world to greater abundance. Five years ago I started the Grail project on a shoestring and now its finally growing and ready to be launched.  I am passionate, creative and determined to make this company and this idea a huge success. You are invited to become a part of a shift into positivity.  I invite you to join this movement of negative thoughts to positive ones.

 Handcrafted in USA   

 Become an Inspiriter ( to fill with Spirit )

A Grail is an object eagerly pursued or sought after.  The manufactured Grails and other inspirational products to remind others to change their outlook. This start up is ready to make a difference.  Become part of our positivity.

The funding will launch production, packaging, printing, shipping, and building a small inventory of Grails consisting of six different colors with six different affirmations.   As explained above, the Affirmation and Abundance Grails are proudly designed and produced in USA. The Grail base is  pewter and the colored goblets are treated Libby glassware.  We produce  reminders in the form of inspirational products designed to remind buyers and recipients to change their outlook to think and live abundantly.  

I am blessed with passion and drive to make this a huge success! 

As a serial entrepreneur I am experiencing  an incredible journey from ideas to products.  This time around I was gifted with seed money; enough to do research, development and produce prototypes.  This Grail design is 5th generation and in the course of the last 5 years I have remained undaunted. My passion fuels enthusiasm and opens my thinking to unlimited creativity and abundance. Yes, you could write your affirmation on a mirror with lipstick, but I made these flameless candle holders so attractive you will be proud to display them anywhere, and they last a lot longer than the lipstick writing.  

  Safe at home or office.  The Grail is a great conversation starter.

Our products are designed and manufactured in the USA.  

So here's where the money goes:

  1. Inventory (includes packaging)

   2.  Intellectual Property Protection (I have the registration mark for the Grail, and copyrights)

   3.  Utility patent pending

   4. Upgrade space for shipping, receiving and assembly

   5.  Social media marketing plan

   6.  Advertising                                                             

 

Perfect Perks for Positive People

 $25 PERK             Includes: the Friendship Grail & Journal

$55 PERK  

2 Signed Limited Edition  "Carry the Message"  art posters . 

                                                                   

 

 

$ 70 PERK       Two Amazing Perk Grails!                                                 

The Impact

Abundant Thoughts was designed to impact and uplift the lives of others.  A lifestyle for the new paradigm of shifting into authenticity and limitless living.  The growth of one blesses all.

A Grail is the best gift to give.  To yourself and others.  

I want you to inspire people.

I want someone to look at you and say because of you I didn't give up.  

YOU can make a difference.

Because of you and your desire to make these Grails a reality I can't wait to hear of your giftgiving experiences.  Your stories will be posted on the AbundantThoughts.com.

Other Ways You Can Help

Forward this campaign to your family and friends and share the good news of an opportunity for them to see the impact the Grail can have on people's lives.  Get the message out there with Indiegogo share tools.

   6.  Advertising

2 Signed Limited Edition  "Carry the Message"  art posters . 
                                                                   
 

 
$ 70 PERK       Two Amazing Perk Grails!

Other Ways You Can Help

Forward this campaign to your family and friends and share the good news of an opportunity for them to see the impact the Grail can have on people's lives.  Get the message out there with Indiegogo share tools.

story:
Our Story

Qhali Kay Organics was founded by cousins Alvaro Lopez and Sven Jacobsen Diaz. At the time, Alvaro was living in Germany and Sven in Denmark. Each had the idea to create a brand that would represent their Peruvian roots and allow them to make ancient Peruvian superfoods.

Without having spoken since they were children, Al and Sven met at a wedding in October 2018, and found out they had both registered a company back in August… four days apart! They hit it off and decided to join forces to create Qhali Kay Organics.

 

About us

Sven was born and raised in Lima, Peru, but traveled to Andean regions often where his mom’s side of the family is from. Sven moved to Denmark to live with his dad in 2009 and is currently finishing a master’s degree in Agricultural Economics at the University of Copenhagen.

Alvaro was born and raised in Lima, Peru until he was 6 years old. His family moved to the Washington DC area, maintaining many customs and diets that are used in Peru at home. He still remembers when his mom would have to search for many hours to find quinoa and other Peruvian ingredients before they boomed in popularity.

Our mission with this campaign is to help us grow Qhali Kay Organics faster help improve the nutritional intake of our customers, and strengthen the underdeveloped economy of Peru. Currently, we are a very small business with limited reach and capital, therefore, we wish to seek help to expand our reach among people with similar values to ours, and provide them with the option of authentic, organic Peruvian products using our delicious recipes.

 

 

 

Our new product range

We have been working hard to create new amazing products for you, and finally, here they are!

Our new range of USDA organic products consists of the following:

  • Muscle Strength
    • Sacha Inchi, Quinoa, Maca, Lucuma, Cacao
    • Build muscle mass
  • Energy Boost
    • Quinoa, Maca, Lucuma, Acai, Camu Camu
    • Increase your daily energy
  • Immunity Rise
    • Maca, Ginger, Chia, Acai, Cacao
    • Help your immune system
  • Paleo Mix
    • Quinoa, Maca, Chia, Ginger, Turmeric
    • Enhance your daily diet
  • Organic Maca
    • Gelatinized Maca
    • Increase libido

 

 

 

Made in Peru

All of our ingredients are grown and produced in Peru. 

We are proud of our Peruvian heritage and we want to share the foods from our country with the rest of the world. There are incredible crops across the Andes, Coastal, and Amazonian region in Peru. One of our main goals is to help you discover the health benefits of these products from one responsible source.

 

 

 

What do you get?

We are looking to reach our goal of $10,000 in 30 days. We want to establish our own webshop so that we can provide our products to you in a much more efficient and cost-effective way!

In turn, we offer you the following packages for your funding:

·         "Try the Inca Way" $15: get a free 16oz Organic Maca ($18 value!)

·         "Inca Family" $25: get a free large 12oz Organic Mix ($30 value!)

·         "Incan Royalty" $100: get 4 large 12oz Organic Mixes ($120 value!) + donation of 20 meals to the Sunflower Children's Home

 There is something for everybody and we hope you find a perk that suits you! Use them on one specific product, or get a bigger bag for less!

 In case we do not reach our goal, the funds will be used to begin the process of establishing our webshop, creating new products for you to enjoy, and investing in giving back to those most in need in Peru.

 

 

 

The impact we want to make

Any contribution to our campaign will be forever appreciated. Because we are a small company with limited resources, we cannot sustain to compete at the same level as some of our competitors and have limited visibility. By contributing to our campaign, you're helping people seeking to do good, grow a company that they want to use to help every person involved in our value chain. We also have big ambitions of working directly with NGOs/charities to develop educational grants for young adults that come from backgrounds of extreme poverty.

Allow us to be candid; we have BIG objectives, and we are all very ambitious with this brand. We want to do things right and to make sure that when we grow everybody else grows with us.

 

 

 

Other ways you can help

You don’t need to contribute to help us! Any ounce of help is appreciated, therefore, if you do not have the option to contribute, you can help us by spreading the word. You can share our campaign, tell your family and friends about us, give us a “follow” on Instagram! Anything helps, and we are very grateful for your help!

REMEMBER! Indiegogo makes it easy for you to share this with your family and friends.

Muchas gracias!

His family moved to the Washington DC area, maintaining many customs and diets that are used in Peru at home.
