Currently, we are a very small business with limited reach and capital, therefore, we wish to seek help to expand our reach among people with similar values to ours, and provide them with the option of authentic, organic Peruvian products using our delicious recipes.   Our new product rangeWe have been working hard to create new amazing products for you, and finally, here they are!Our new range of USDA organic products consists of the following:

Muscle Strength
Sacha Inchi, Quinoa, Maca, Lucuma, Cacao
Build muscle mass



Energy Boost
Quinoa, Maca, Lucuma, Acai, Camu Camu
Increase your daily energy



Immunity Rise
Maca, Ginger, Chia, Acai, Cacao
Help your immune system



Paleo Mix
Quinoa, Maca, Chia, Ginger, Turmeric
Enhance your daily diet



Organic Maca
Gelatinized Maca
Increase libido


   Made in PeruAll of our ingredients are grown and produced in Peru. We are proud of our Peruvian heritage and we want to share the foods from our country with the rest of the world. There are incredible crops across the Andes, Coastal, and Amazonian region in Peru. One of our main goals is to help you discover the health benefits of these products from one responsible source.   What do you get?We are looking to reach our goal of $10,000 in 30 days. We want to establish our own webshop so that we can provide our products to you in a much more efficient and cost-effective way!In turn, we offer you the following packages for your funding:·         "Try the Inca Way" $15: get a free 16oz Organic Maca ($18 value!)·         "Inca Family" $25: get a free large 12oz Organic Mix ($30 value!)·         "Incan Royalty" $100: get 4 large 12oz Organic Mixes ($120 value!) + donation of 20 meals to the Sunflower Children's Home There is something for everybody and we hope you find a perk that suits you! Use them on one specific product, or get a bigger bag for less! In case we do not reach our goal, the funds will be used to begin the process of establishing our webshop, creating new products for you to enjoy, and investing in giving back to those most in need in Peru.   The impact we want to makeAny contribution to our campaign will be forever appreciated. Because we are a small company with limited resources, we cannot sustain to compete at the same level as some of our competitors and have limited visibility. By contributing to our campaign, you're helping people seeking to do good, grow a company that they want to use to help every person involved in our value chain. We also have big ambitions of working directly with NGOs/charities to develop educational grants for young adults that come from backgrounds of extreme poverty.Allow us to be candid; we have BIG objectives, and we are all very ambitious with this brand. We want to do things right and to make sure that when we grow everybody else grows with us.   Other ways you can helpYou don’t need to contribute to help us! Any ounce of help is appreciated, therefore, if you do not have the option to contribute, you can help us by spreading the word. You can share our campaign, tell your family and friends about us, give us a “follow” on Instagram! Anything helps, and we are very grateful for your help!REMEMBER! Indiegogo makes it easy for you to share this with your family and friends.Muchas gracias!

story:
Our Mission & Vision

Through the creation of this physical community space, focused on Yoga, Meditation, Self-Love, nourishment, community Co-creation, and conscious education, our mission is to support each individual on their path of self-realization, personal transformation and conscious living--to Awaken the body, mind & soul of each individual.

We believe each individual desires to live happy, fulfilled and at peace. We know that every person has the ability to decide for this to be a reality in their life. With the right support, environment and guidance, this is possible. Our mission is to support each individual and each other in coming to this realization.

Our intent is to create a unique space for the city of Ottawa is a hub for awakened living, a space of convergence for individuals of heart-centered nature. Awaken is a space for all to come together to celebrate, connect, nourish, breath, dance, move and explore. A space that washes away separation, dogma and old mentalities. A space of inclusion, equality, love-based service, conscious living and a home for one to realize their true nature.
 

Our Story

Awaken Founder - Corey Sheikh - has been devoted to uncovering the secrets and mysteries that had him questioning and contemplating since a young boy. A deep inner desire and longing to know his purpose, to know the bigger storyline, to understand what life really is. Through years of study and direct experience in a profound array of experiences, he was tested, challenged and constantly pushed into further growth and continued self-realization.

The Journey evolved from a young age, and expanded into his early twenties, where during the creation of the first Ottawa Lifestyle Center within Ottawa, a similar space, focused on fitness, martial arts, meditation and overall wellness.. he experienced a profound spiritual awakening.

This awakening catalyzed into many years of dedicated study of yoga, meditation, detoxification based nutrition, energy work, & entrepreneurship, all pointing to the ultimate goal of inner happiness, well-being, and peace.

This process of transformation eventually led to a time of more solitude, away from the direction of the previous center and into his own heart, alone. It was during this 2 years where he went into the most intense spiritual training of his life. Coming across great master teachers from around the globe, seeking the golden keys that would further support his quest in finding the answer the question "Who AM I?"

During this time, the clarity of creating a new center, a new foundation emerged. The question arose, "what would a new-world community center look like? operate like? run like?.... are we ready for such  a space?". This inquiry fueled the natural synchronicity in which emerged as a vision for this space - 1111A Bank St.

Awaken is a space which has naturally aligned with the intentions of many -- to bring together a community space for awakening, conscious living, heart-centered education and self-love.

A space that is a gathering ground for the yogis, entrepreneurs, visionaries, movement buffs, meditators  artists, yuppies, and simply anyone open, willing and humble enough to embark on their journey of transformation.

Here we are naturally connecting the right leaders, students and members all equally valuable in creating this visionary space.

The call to action is now to the community, to support in raising our first goal of $25,000 to finish further renovations and take this space to new heights.
 

The Space

The space looks to become a unique community hub to cover the array of offerings that will support one on their journey of transformation.



Full Spectrum Alchemy Fuel Bar: Fueled by the Fuel bar to nourish the human body based on the modern approach to mucus-free & more ancient approaches of eastern traditions. A mix of  juices, smoothies, snacks, small meals and specially created tonics & formulas for your well-being.

Experience Hub and Co-Creation Lounge: A dynamic hub of experiences and co-creative workshops, immersions, events and sessions. All geared to support in creating an ongoing space of connection, awakening, transformation, well-being and self-love. Experience everything from chilled out lounge sessions with friends, to the depths of a sound healing , or even the expansiveness of a sober ecstatic dance party. 

Multi-sensory Meditation & Yoga Room: A new look at the silent temple-like Meditation room. An array of guided meditation sessions, along with silent times for personal practice. Eventually - we look to merge advanced multi-sensory audio, visual and scent based technology to create an immersion experience for meditation, contemplation and healing. 

Integrative 1on1  Rooms, And Personal Silent Rooms: Specialized 1on1 rooms merging the best of ancient and modern technology. An approach to service based health that takes a complete new step for Ottawa. Covering the array of energy healing, nutritional detox, mind re-programming, spiritual life guidance and advanced forms of traditional therapy.

 

Experiences At Awaken

We have created a curriculum of experiences within this center in which is designed to awaken the body, mind and soul.

Class Sessions With Intention: An array of class sessions in which focus on an array of different intentions and goals. Activating & energizing yoga classes, blissful & soothing Meditation sessions, dance & body exploration, spiritual discourse & communication based experiences. Something for everyone

Social Experiences For The Soul: Events that focus on providing an intimate social experience with the common intention of expanding, evolving and awakening.. Cooking classes, social music experiences, insightful speaking events, sober dance parties and more.

Heart Centered Immersions: The new era of education balances mind & heart. Experience our immersions, workshops and urban retreats that take you on an in depth journey of expansive awakening, personal transformation and insight expansion.

1on1 Personal Guidance, Coaching & Support: An in depth process of support, coaching, & guidance along your path of transformation. An array of wellness, spiritual, relationship, and purpose creation guidance services by a team of focused, experienced and educated individuals.

Retreats -  A Home Away From Home:  Multi-Night stay retreats, workshops and live-in programs of Yoga, Meditation Nutrition Self-Care and Transformation. Our partnered retreat space, a new home away from home for complete immersions into your self.

 

The Impact Within The Community

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Non-Profit principles that look to regeneratively distribute resources back into community efforts
  • A Pay What You Feel , Love Exchange model is our goal. One in which opens up to support those with financial constraints. 
  • A portion of monthly revenues redistributed into community projects to support, low income families, at-risk youth and other community initiatives determined by the community.
  • Children and Teen based programs to support full family dynamic.
  • Incubated projects, facilitator programs and offerings that inspire entrepreneurial energy within members.

 

A Co-Operative Structure

The intention is to build a non-profit oriented co-operative structure. At this moment we are determining what legal structure is best to approach the intention behind creating a new paradigm community space that each individual within it feels a part of directing its future and its ability to serve the community as a hole.

Council: Core Leaders of the community. A circle of advanced practitioners who hold space for decision making, resolution and project initiation

Leaders: Core facilitators, healers, coaches and leaders on specific incubated projects within center.

Ambassadors: Individuals representing the message of the center through the support & mentor-ship of other students and members. Special access to training's, project involvement opportunities and specific positions within Center.

Students: Attendance of Specific Workshop immersions and programs for more immersive growth & transformation. Membership access to exclusive events & programs.

Members: Regular attendees of various core sessions, events. Base level membership access into community.

 

Becoming A Founding Member, 

Our founding members will be the first members to take part in the seeding of this new space. They will have exclusive access to all of our core sessions, events and workshops. Each founding member will also have the opportunity to be further involved within the community, in taking part in voting on specific decisions, support in various projects, and to be able to facilitate ones own offerings!

There are a few different founding member and perk packages covering:

  • Awakening Tools & Goodies
  • Core Membership Packages
  • 1on1 Programs and Sessions
  • Immersive out of town Retreats
  • Plant Based Food Experiences & Catering Options


Imagine a world where the businesses in which serve you, are your own? That all is kept local, within the community and on the ground level of the day to day of community life?

Can you feel into how the dynamics of your interactions with local business, community and gathering spaces would be like, if you were to also have a say in the decisions, direction and unfoldment of them?

A new vision for co-operative involvement within the physical spaces that you inhabit within your community. An approach to community based projects, co-creation and living that sets the bar for the way we can reconnect our communities, our selves and our purpose.

Initially, with this crowdfund you are using your voice to tell US of your interest and intention to support this space by actively participating and receiving the support it is designed for. 

 

Love Exchange Dynamics

Based on the principles of the gift economy, Awaken looks to adopt and evolve the principles of exchange that go beyond only financial means. Through the approach to exchange that can be done in many ways, inclusive of skill, love, insights and each person following their highest excitement, Awaken looks to create a new dynamic of inner currency.

    Funding Requirements

    The vision here goes beyond ONLY financial needs. We have an extensive history of exchange based on value alone amongst those within the community. If you feel you have something in specific to offer, please reach out.

    We have set prices for our rewards, at the same time we are open to love offerings of any amount and are open to working with each individual based on their needs, and the exchange that is feasible to them.

    Goal 1: $25,000

    Our core requirements, and the direction where the funding will be placed is as follows:

    • Plumbing and Core Renovations
    • Furniture, Fixtures and making the space COZY!
    • High Tech Integration within Center Space
    • Media Documentation and Taking YOU on this journey with us.

    Stretch: $50,000

    • Extensive renovations taking the space, lighting and sound system to new heights.
    • Complete online media platform and social media approach that gives you access wherever you are.
    • Invited in special world renowned facilitators, teachers and guides to provide workshops and core offerings.

    What if we DON'T Get the money needed?

    Well, we have prepared for everything. Naturally, the space is ALREADY usable, as we have been using for many weekly events. The key for us is making the space what it has the potential to be. This crowdfund holds the intention of growing at the pace that the community wants it. We will respond accordingly!

     

    Other Ways You Can Support

    We few resources, support and exchange far beyond ONLY financial - there are other ways to get involved.

    • Spread the word on social media! - Share our events, your experience at the center, or even this crowdfund!
    • Would you like to facilitate or become a leader in the center? Message us.
    • Would you like to volunteer on specific tasts or projects?
    • Are you an investor, or someone who is desiring to support this project in a bigger capacity? Please contact us directly!
    • Attend an event! We have many events upcoming that cover the full spectrum of experiences on your path. It is time to awaken your body, mind and soul!

     

    Trends & Timing In Market

    We are leading this project at a natural time of evolution in the Ottawa wellness, yoga and spiritual community. A community that is calling for a central gathering ground within the city.

    • The Ottawa yoga community is evolving! 5 Meditation studios opening in Fall 2018
    • A need for a new type of social experience and space of connection
    • Old Ottawa south a perfect community space for this type of offering!
    • Ottawa has one of the bigger yoga & spiritual communities in Canada.

     

      Risks & Challenges

      There are a number of potential risks and challenges we would like to address that a

      • Molding of the vision and communication of changes that arise
      • Many forward moving concepts that are to be explored in a very new way with this space.
      • Attending to the amount of influx of people over initial months and management of schedule in a proper way to maximize value for each member.
      • What if we DON'T Get the money needed?

story:
What is Setu?

Setu is an inclusive online yoga community, home to 900+ students and teachers. We want more people to experience the benefits of yoga and that's why we are creating Setu for You.

Visit our website to browse our existing directory of teachers and access free online classes. This will give  and take a sneak peek on what a practice could look like for you with one of our teachers. Sign up on Setu.yoga and view our directory of diverse teachers which we'll transform into the service booking platform.

 

 

 

Why Setu for You?

Too often we hear people say they can’t find a yoga teacher who looks like them or understands their body. This is disheartening and we want to surface awareness of more diverse teachers, so people feel seen and appreciated in yoga. 

We are building Setu for You a booking service that will be part of our yoga teacher directory. Through Setu for You, you can book 1:1 and small group sessions with diverse teachers. 

In awareness that this kind of service is a luxury to use, we are giving 10% of each booking to a yoga non-profit that provides mindfulness practices to in-need communities.

 

 

Why you need Setu for You

Your yoga practice will be led by a teacher who understands you and your yoga practice needs.  A teacher who will guide and support your every step. Each teacher offers something different and has a big impact on your personal yoga practice.

We know how hard it is to fit yoga into your daily schedule. Setu for You makes it possible to book yoga in your available time slots and at locations convenient for you.

Bonus

You know that feeling you get when you finish yoga and wish it was available to more people? We have you covered. 10% of your booking will go to an organization that provides yoga to in-need communities.

 

How Setu for You works

Setu for You is a service where people can find and book yoga teachers for private and small group yoga sessions. You create a profile on our website and submit a booking request to a teacher including your preferred time, day, location and description of what you want the practice to provide. The teachers will respond within 12 hours and set up an intro call to learn more about you, then confirm the booking.

We will build this booking functionality into our existing yoga teacher directory. The booking experience will be similar to browsing the directory today but with the added navigation and information to guide you in finding a teacher to work with.

 

Funding Goal

Our goal is $200,000 to build and launch Setu for You from beginning to end. If we are not able to raise all the funds, here’s what we’ll do with less money.

 

We can use $80,000 from March - September in this capacity.

  • $32,000 front end developer to design and code the service
  • $12,000 research role
  • $12,000 community engagement role
  • $12,000 product development role
  • $5,000 UX designer
  • $4,000 legal fees for contracts with teachers, end user agreements, privacy policy, terms and conditions and freelancer contracts
  • $1,000 accounting fees to budget, plan and map our finances
  • $2,000 design and branding of the service and website

 

Launch Timeline

  • March: Create the customer journey
  • April:  Wireframe the UI, run it by Setu yoga teachers and subscribers for feedback
  • May: Build out backend functionality
  • June: Beta test the online portion of the service with Setu teachers and subscribers
  • July: Beta test the whole service end-to-end (from booking online to holding a session)
  • August: Publicly launch the service in NYC

 

 

About the team

Libby, Hillary and Mary Lou are all yoga teachers, students and community leaders. Libby founded Setu and soon after connected with Mary Lou and Hillary who've been volunteering with Setu ever since. They each are personally invested in the yoga industry and want to see it evolve in a healthier capacity through inclusivity, empowerment and financial balance for teachers and students.

 

Libby Nicholaou

I started Setu after completing my 200 hour yoga training in 2017. It was a time when I experienced the power of yoga. I’m a queer identifying woman and face physical challenges in my body that causes my practice to look different than a fully healthy body. Even though I am white and pass as straight, I didn’t feel comfortable in the mainstream yoga scene. After hearing similar sentiments from others, I decided to contribute to the work of making yoga inclusive.

 

Mary Lou Burkhardt

I  like most, dove into yoga by curiosity. I was always looking for ways to move by body and feel good mentally and physically. Yoga continues to help me do this, on and off the mat. I craved to share this with others; those who felt yoga wasn’t for them so that they may thrive as I have. I think of yoga as a beautiful dance I invite my students to perform and explore ways to invite more ease into their lives. I invite them to get pretty from the inside out.

 

Hillary Lopes

Since 2009, yoga has been a source of embodiment  that I can trust and grow with. I am an embodied social activist and yoga and mindfulness teacher who is immersed in the New York yoga community. I hold a vision for the world in which space for my community of sisters and brothers of color to thrive and be well is honored by any means necessary. My yoga practice has given me the space in my heart, body and mind to live more courageously and do so with compassion. I want to be able to share that.

 

 

What we've been doing already

Over the last year we’ve built a directory for 350+ yoga teachers from around the world and created a library of 35 online yoga and meditation classes to which 500+ people subscribe and practice with daily. We’ve built relationships with the teachers in our directory through interviews with them on our blog and meeting more than half of them at our events in New York City. We are encourage by the continual growth on our platform and excited to bring it life more through Setu for You.

 

 

Setu's media coverage

Setu has received great attention from the media leading up to this point. We believe there are many more stories to come! Read articles from the publications below.

Vice Tonic

The Greatist

Wanderlust

Blavity

MindBodyGreen

YellowCo

 

In 2018, Wild Combination created the film 'I See You' expressing the mission of Setu.

 

 

 

Thank you for visiting our campaign for Setu for You. Whether you are a yoga teacher or student of yoga, you are part of our community. We are here for you!
story_txt:
What is Setu?
Setu is an inclusive online yoga community, home to 900+ students and teachers. We want more people to experience the benefits of yoga and that's why we are creating Setu for You.
Visit our website to browse our existing directory of teachers and access free online classes. This will give  and take a sneak peek on what a practice could look like for you with one of our teachers. Sign up on Setu.yoga and view our directory of diverse teachers which we'll transform into the service booking platform.
 


 

 
Why Setu for You?
Too often we hear people say they can’t find a yoga teacher who looks like them or understands their body. This is disheartening and we want to surface awareness of more diverse teachers, so people feel seen and appreciated in yoga. We are building Setu for You a booking service that will be part of our yoga teacher directory. Through Setu for You, you can book 1:1 and small group sessions with diverse teachers. In awareness that this kind of service is a luxury to use, we are giving 10% of each booking to a yoga non-profit that provides mindfulness practices to in-need communities.
 

 
Why you need Setu for You
Your yoga practice will be led by a teacher who understands you and your yoga practice needs.  A teacher who will guide and support your every step. Each teacher offers something different and has a big impact on your personal yoga practice.
We know how hard it is to fit yoga into your daily schedule. Setu for You makes it possible to book yoga in your available time slots and at locations convenient for you.
Bonus
You know that feeling you get when you finish yoga and wish it was available to more people? We have you covered. 10% of your booking will go to an organization that provides yoga to in-need communities.

 
How Setu for You works
Setu for You is a service where people can find and book yoga teachers for private and small group yoga sessions. You create a profile on our website and submit a booking request to a teacher including your preferred time, day, location and description of what you want the practice to provide. The teachers will respond within 12 hours and set up an intro call to learn more about you, then confirm the booking.
We will build this booking functionality into our existing yoga teacher directory. The booking experience will be similar to browsing the directory today but with the added navigation and information to guide you in finding a teacher to work with.


 

Funding Goal
Our goal is $200,000 to build and launch Setu for You from beginning to end. If we are not able to raise all the funds, here’s what we’ll do with less money. We can use $80,000 from March - September in this capacity.

$32,000 front end developer to design and code the service
$12,000 research role
$12,000 community engagement role
$12,000 product development role
$5,000 UX designer
$4,000 legal fees for contracts with teachers, end user agreements, privacy policy, terms and conditions and freelancer contracts
$1,000 accounting fees to budget, plan and map our finances
$2,000 design and branding of the service and website

 
Launch Timeline

March: Create the customer journey
April:  Wireframe the UI, run it by Setu yoga teachers and subscribers for feedback
May: Build out backend functionality
June: Beta test the online portion of the service with Setu teachers and subscribers
July: Beta test the whole service end-to-end (from booking online to holding a session)
August: Publicly launch the service in NYC

 

 
About the team
Libby, Hillary and Mary Lou are all yoga teachers, students and community leaders. Libby founded Setu and soon after connected with Mary Lou and Hillary who've been volunteering with Setu ever since. They each are personally invested in the yoga industry and want to see it evolve in a healthier capacity through inclusivity, empowerment and financial balance for teachers and students.
 
Libby Nicholaou
I started Setu after completing my 200 hour yoga training in 2017. It was a time when I experienced the power of yoga. I’m a queer identifying woman and face physical challenges in my body that causes my practice to look different than a fully healthy body. Even though I am white and pass as straight, I didn’t feel comfortable in the mainstream yoga scene. After hearing similar sentiments from others, I decided to contribute to the work of making yoga inclusive.
 
Mary Lou Burkhardt
I  like most, dove into yoga by curiosity. I was always looking for ways to move by body and feel good mentally and physically. Yoga continues to help me do this, on and off the mat. I craved to share this with others; those who felt yoga wasn’t for them so that they may thrive as I have. I think of yoga as a beautiful dance I invite my students to perform and explore ways to invite more ease into their lives. I invite them to get pretty from the inside out. Hillary Lopes
Since 2009, yoga has been a source of embodiment  that I can trust and grow with. I am an embodied social activist and yoga and mindfulness teacher who is immersed in the New York yoga community. I hold a vision for the world in which space for my community of sisters and brothers of color to thrive and be well is honored by any means necessary. My yoga practice has given me the space in my heart, body and mind to live more courageously and do so with compassion. I want to be able to share that.
 

 
What we've been doing already
Over the last year we’ve built a directory for 350+ yoga teachers from around the world and created a library of 35 online yoga and meditation classes to which 500+ people subscribe and practice with daily. We’ve built relationships with the teachers in our directory through interviews with them on our blog and meeting more than half of them at our events in New York City. We are encourage by the continual growth on our platform and excited to bring it life more through Setu for You.
 
 

Setu's media coverage


Setu has received great attention from the media leading up to this point. We believe there are many more stories to come! Read articles from the publications below.
Vice Tonic
The Greatist
Wanderlust
Blavity
MindBodyGreen
YellowCo
 
In 2018, Wild Combination created the film 'I See You' expressing the mission of Setu.

 
 


 
Thank you for visiting our campaign for Setu for You. Whether you are a yoga teacher or student of yoga, you are part of our community. We are here for you!

story:
Short Summary

Ciao Y'all! Dello’s humans here (David and Kayla). If you know us, you know Dello is our baby. He’s not just a dog to us, he’s our kid- he completes our family unit. About a month after Dello turned 2 years old, we found out that he is living with a fatal genetic heart condition, Arrhythmogenic Right Ventricular Cardiomyopathy. While this condition is pretty common for Boxers, generally it doesn’t affect them until they are 6-8 years old.  Dello, unfortunately, started expressing symptoms at a year and a half years old.  He collapsed, vomited, and at the vet had a heart rate up to 300bpm (a normal heart rate for adult dogs is between 60 and 120bpm). He needed some emergency doses of Lidocaine to stabilize his heart. He will need to be on heart stabilizing medication for the rest of his life to try to keep his heart beating as regularly as possible. One of the scary realities of this disease is that at any point, with no warning, Dello’s heart will just stop. His cardiologist told us this could happen anywhere in the next few weeks, months, or hopefully years. He is living on borrowed time.  And we need your help to borrow as much time as possible.  

 

What We Need 

We’re not usually the ones to ask for financial help, but unfortunately, to keep his heart beating as long as possible, we’re facing a big financial struggle. The most basic level of disease maintenance to keep him going will cost us $1700 per year, and that is assuming he doesn’t have another incident where his heart gets triggered and he needs life-saving immediate medical care at the 24-hour medical veterinary center. Unfortunately, he has two of these incidents already this year, and those life-saving visits cost us about $1200 and $3200, respectively. Luckily, we had some room on our credit cards to be able to get him the treatment he needed at the time, but we’re now looking at a lot of credit card debt, interest fees, and a hemorrhaging of our savings. We are hoping to make a dent in the existing debt we’ve built up in the last month and depending on the amount of support we’re able to accrue, be more intensive in the care we are able to provide (holistic veterinary care, cardiac support vitamins and CBD oil for starts) and save money for his future medical costs which will be lifelong. In a perfect world, we would love to raise $10,000 which would cover his existing medical costs ($4400), help keep him going for the next two years with the basic level of care ($3400), and hopefully provide him with some more intensive holistic personalized care to help his heart keep beating.  While we recognize that this a huge number and a lofty goal, we are aiming high. Even if we are unable to meet this goal, any bit of donation will help us continue to provide the level of care Dello needs to continue adventuring with us as long as he can. 

What You Get

As we mentioned, it is extremely humbling for us to ask for help, especially financially. To keep us from feeling like we are simply asking for your charity, we are offering a load of fun perks and items to thank you for helping us keep our family strong and healthy. Dello’s humans love food and are offering some delicious baked goods, homemade hummus, pasta and intimate full-scale dinner experiences. We are offering some fun Dello merch including stickers, thank you cards, and shirts. You can also purchase some goodies for your own pooches including doggie biscuits and tea (homemade broth to enjoy tea time with your dogs)! And for our out of town friends, Dello will personally video chat you to say thank you (and you can catch up with his humans). We sincerely appreciate any help our community can offer and are hoping to express our thanks through the handmade experiences that bring us joy. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We’re thankful for any support we can get financially, or otherwise!  If you are interested in helping but are not able to offer any financial support, we would be super grateful if you could help spread the word, offer some time to help us create and package the perks for donors, share the campaign on social media, or send some general good vibes Dello’s way. We appreciate you all so much for your help and love.  

Also, keep an eye out for information about our pop-up pizza night at Lil's Bagels!

story:
HEALTHY SOLUTIONS FOR DEPRESSION

RAISING A BLACK DOG, by Monet Tiran

"Raising a Black Dog" is just one of Monet TIran's two amazing initiatives toward creating awareness of the subject of mental health, and offering real and healthy solutions for those suffering with mental health issues such as depression. The book itself is a brave and authentic memoir that ultimately teaches us how to create a fulfilling life in spite of the threats the modern and often relentless world throws our way, ferocious black dogs included (depression). Covering a span of twenty years worth of experience and research, forty-nine countries and more than a million miles, Tiran’s story rolls along like a sturdy train, leading us in the end to a treasure chest of spiritual and practical tools. Read Tiran to understand how depression stalks its victims and how, in learning to heal from and cope with this very common and deadly disease, we can discover how much more there is to life than meets the conventional, ambitious eye.

~ 800,000 people die from suicide globally each year (one death every 40 seconds).

~ Less than 2% of the global median of health budget was allocated to mental health in 2017.

~ 9 is the median number of health workers per 100,000 people in 2017.

~ 94,553 women and 127,540 men between the ages of 10 and 29 years committed suicide in 2017.

"No, I am not okay."

How many more lives will suicide claim, before we start realizing the signs, not only in others, but in ourselves? When will it become the norm to raise your hand and say, "actually, no, I am not okay?"

Monet Tiran, "Raising a Black Dog."

"Through dialogue, through being honest with our feelings and sharing them, we can make a change. It starts and ends with us, all of us. We all need to be change-makers, no matter how big or small we are, or the change we seek to make is. We do it because we have to, because the earth and the living creatures in it are suffering, and people are taking their lives as a result. Don't seek to make a change for credit or for pats on the back. Do it as a selfless act of kindness, and kindness shall find its way back to you."

"Give, and it shall be given unto you." (Luke 6:38).

SPREADING THE PRANA

"I have dealt with depression off and on throughout my life, but there was a brief period where it's safe to say that I only thought about one thing every day. Suicide. There was a time when I could hardly get out of bed. One day I'm jetting around the world, rising through the corporate ranks, growing cash, the next, I'm in a psyche ward eating medicine. Prana, combined with good friends, good doctors and a lot of compassion, is how I overcame my struggle and suffering and to this day continue into a hopeful and rewarding future."

Prana is the Sanskrit word for "breath" and is often used in referring to the "life force" or "life energy." It comprises all cosmic energies that permeate the Universe on all levels, including us. I documented my experience in order to spread the Prana, the healing energy that I would discover during my journey. My hope is that others who are raising a black dog as I was, can see the signs before it's too late, and as I did, find the healing that exists in us, and in the universe. In my case, as with many others, all the signs were there. Whether I and everyone else subconsciously ignored them, or were simply too caught up in our own drama to realize them for what they were, I will never know. All the people around me at the time exhibited actions that revealed on a deeper level they knew something was wrong, and ultimately that we are all connected in some intuitive way more powerfully than our distracted, conscious minds could override. Seize the connection you have with others.

Through the very extended and hard process of healing I have learned many lessons. I have acquired new skills. Made new friends. Lost some old ones. But most of all, I dealt with my demons and will never allow myself to go back to such a dark place. 

By the grace of God, I am very lucky that I did not end up taking my own life, having gotten so close to doing it, so many times.

God bless you, and please help us to help others, and please find us here if you need help. Or also, here.

Do no harm. Not to yourself, anyone or anything.

Monet Tiran (with a mostly-black border collie, who didn't bite him, and who looks a lot like another famous border collie, who was also South African :)

 

WHAT I AM GRATEFUL FOR

I have covered for all the costs associated with making my story available to others, and would be grateful for any contribution, regardless of size. My objective is very simple, to use my story as a basis for raising awareness - in my own country and beyond - on the subject of mental health, and moreover to produce more and more stories all with the same focus, "transforming suffering into tangible acts of hope and peaceful social activism."

Kind of intriguing, really, that the HOK logo was taken from a picture of my sweet little Saluki girl's eye not long before she would pass on to the other world (lots of running space I hear). From one dog to another (Emile).

story:
Short Summary

Wulf Fitness was founded in 2016, and have designed and created high-quality sportswear, with an initial stock ready for pre-sale, marketing and testing:

  • Our high-quality fitness & sportswear is suitable for both sports and leisure activities. They are all 100% vegan, including no wool or silk and in the future, we intend to include more Eco-friendly materials, such as bamboo.
  • After first-hand experience of Homeless Shelters, from both volunteering and having a number of friends who have been homeless on several occasions, it seems the problem continues to get worse. To the point, The Guardian recently wrote 'homelessness is reaching a point that is penetrating the public consciousness and that we have, indeed, gone back to the 80s.' and many people have become so numb to it, they barely bat an eyelid to see many streets with piled up boxes and sleeping bags, the only possessions of an unfortunate human being.

  •  

    Whilst most Indiegogo campaigns are for start-ups or not yet formed companies, we have already begun selling our products and as such our stock is ready to go. However, we would love to expand our range and multiply the number of people we can help, the more we can donate, the more effectively we can help. Investing in this project will grant you a discount on the sportswear - whilst we still donate the full amount. 

What We Need & What You Get

So, what do we want and what's in it for you?

  • As mentioned previously, we will use this money to help expand our range, moving on to socks, beanies and jogging bottoms. A larger range means we will have more products ready to donate, and more projects that can be created.
  • The early bird perk special will grant you a discount on all of our range, and preorders. This does not affect the amount we donate.
  • As we already have stock ready to go there is no negative implication of us not reaching our goal, it will all go towards forwarding the company and progressing us to the next level. If, however, we exceed our goals we will immediately commence work on our next ranges and began marketing more aggressively.

The Impact

There are over 250,000 homeless people in the UK alone (Shelter's estimations for 2016) we aim to help as many of these as we can, and then focus internationally as our projects become more ambitious:

  • We, in the UK, spend £5.9Bn on sportswear a year (figures from 2014) and we aim to use some of this expenditure and therefore the huge profits in this industry, to help out local communities.
  • The difference we can make is very real, for every item you buy someone in need will receive a brand new piece of clothing, too. You can keep up with our new projects and see us in action over at our website.

Risks & Challenges

As we are only a small company, we have a relatively small cash flow compared to other competitors in the market. Another problem is that we do not have private factories, this could be reflected by slightly longer lead times on new ranges and restocking

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, and that's fine, if you'd like to help us in other ways: 

  • Please Tweet, Facebook and share the link on any other social media outlets. (Indiegogo also has inbuilt share tools)
  • For any press releases or any other contact, please email - wulffitness@gmail.com and we will endeavour to reply as quickly as possible.

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Summary of Group

The Tennessee Tails are a group of University of Tennessee students working with Anderson County Animal Rescue Foundation. We are crowdfunding to raise money and awareness for the ACARF non-profit. We are a diverse group of students  with a range of talents. Together we can make a change 

Summary of Organization     

The Anderson County Animal Rescue Foundation is a registered 501 c(3) organization consisting of volunteers dedicated to promoting the welfare and humane treatment of animals in Anderson and surrounding counties. Their goal is to build and maintain a state of the art Animals Adoption Center. This facility will partner with local rescues and animal welfare agencies to coordinate adoption events, accommodate adoptable animals, host low and no cost spay/ neuter and vaccination clinics, and advance their collective outreach and educational programs and events. 

The Issue / Needs 

The issue of overcrowded animal shelters is a problem.  Anderson County Animal Rescue Foundation wants everyday animal to get adopted  and find their forever home. ACARF and the Tennessee Tails need donations to help animals find their forever homes.   

Purpose

Animals need places to call home, a steady and consistent environment is helpful! The animals are open and willing to love!

What The Money Will Go To 

The money from the Tennessee Tails crowdfunding campaign will go directly to Anderson County Animal Rescue Foundation.

The Tennessee Tails are working to find rescued dogs homes. The top priority is a sweetheart dog named Darcy. 

 Darcy is a 65 lb young adult terrier mix with a beautiful unique look.  She was pulled from Cleveland Animal Control in July.  She is happy and exuberant at home and ALWAYS in a good mood, but she is still working to gain confidence in public.  She is extremely smart and willing and only wants to please her people.  She comes running with a smile and a butt wiggle every time she is called.  With only 3 formal obedience sessions under her belt, she heels so well that she gets mistaken for a service dog.  She wears a special vest while in public that gives her a little space.  It allows her foster family to control her interactions to ensure they will all be slow and positive.  She is quickly learning, with the help of kind strangers and yummy treats, that she can trust humans.  She won’t need the vest forever, but for now, it allows her to go just about anywhere except for a dog park.  Sometimes she doesn’t react well to a strange dog in her face while on leash.  However, she lives in her foster home with 3 other dogs and a cat, and she adores every one of them.  She seems to thrive as part of a pack and she copies their confidence.  She can be trusted unconditionally with all of them, even with toys scattered around the room.  She has a special bond with former Slumdog Darnell, who is similar age and size (~3 years old, 70 lbs).  They love to play rough and they go everywhere together.   She also loves her two smaller foster dog brothers, but shows it with an affectionate lick to the muzzle at every opportunity, rather than the rough play.  Even though she moves a bit like a bulldozer, she is very aware and respectful of how much smaller they are.  She desperately wants to be friends with the cat, and even though she gets a hateful whack on the nose almost every interaction, she doesn’t give up.  

 

Darcy is looking for her forever home!  She would love a fenced in yard, at least one other dog, and a family who understands her insecurities and is willing to help her work through them.
story_txt:
Summary of Group
The Tennessee Tails are a group of University of Tennessee students working with Anderson County Animal Rescue Foundation. We are crowdfunding to raise money and awareness for the ACARF non-profit. We are a diverse group of students  with a range of talents. Together we can make a change 
Summary of Organization     
The Anderson County Animal Rescue Foundation is a registered 501 c(3) organization consisting of volunteers dedicated to promoting the welfare and humane treatment of animals in Anderson and surrounding counties. Their goal is to build and maintain a state of the art Animals Adoption Center. This facility will partner with local rescues and animal welfare agencies to coordinate adoption events, accommodate adoptable animals, host low and no cost spay/ neuter and vaccination clinics, and advance their collective outreach and educational programs and events. 
The Issue / Needs 
The issue of overcrowded animal shelters is a problem.  Anderson County Animal Rescue Foundation wants everyday animal to get adopted  and find their forever home. ACARF and the Tennessee Tails need donations to help animals find their forever homes.   
Purpose

story:
REFILLABLE DEODORANT

 It will help you reduce single use plastic in your life which has to be a good thing. Ultimately reducing the plastic we manufacture globally is the best way to reduce the amount that ends up in the environment causing untold damage. Even if you have been recycling your old deodorant packs (well done you) it is still putting pressure on recycling systems, many still end up in landfill or worst our oceans. Our refillable deodorant is the solution. Buy just one outer case and when you run out simply buy the natural deodorant refill, pop it in, twist down and reduce your plastic usage by over 98%.

 

 

NATURAL DEODORANT
The most important measure of all our products is that they work. This one uses a state of the art plant powered fermentation technique that will neutralise body odour using fermented enzymes that catalyse odours into their heavier molecular weight and non-odorous form. Our natural stick deodorant is also aluminium, paraben and petroleum free, vegan and avoids any ingredients that you shouldn’t put into your armpit making the best option for a healthier you. Breast Cancer Care actively suggests avoiding aluminium anti perspirants and there are concerns about their impact on the endocrine (your hormonal) system.

 

100% PROFITS TO WaterAid
Once we fund the launch and delivery of your Refillable Natural Deodorant the story will only just be beginning. You will have then put us in a position to create a sustainable social enterprise business that will be able to give 100% of future profits* from the World’s Kindest Deodorant to the charity WaterAid - an international not-for-profit, determined to make clean water, decent toilets and good hygiene normal for everyone, everywhere within a generation. A basic human right.

The deodorant market is worth $70 billion a year, it’s an established beauty habit that needs disrupting. Let’s get started…

*100% of the profits from the sale of the World’s Kindest Refillable Natural Deodorant, with a minimum donation of £50,000, will go to WaterAid, an international not-for-profit, determined to make clean water, decent toilets and good hygiene normal for everyone, everywhere within a generation.

 

It will take 60 seconds of your time.

Please help us grow this community of people who want to reduce plastic in the oceans, eliminate health risks due to deodorants and help WaterAid.

Click on the buttons below to share....

 

 

For your first purchase you need to buy the Refillable Natural Deodorant. You will receive your hardwearing outer case with a deodorant stick.  When you run out you simply buy the refill and place into the original case. You can swap scents, you’ll be doing good for the planet and smelling awesome.

CHECK OUT THE VIDEO BELOW ON HOW TO REFILL YOUR DEODORANT

 
  1. Keep your original hardwearing outer case.
  2. Remove the empty cradle and recycle it.
  3. Simply pop in the new deodorant refill and twist it down.
  4. You can swap scents or stick to your favourite. 

THE IMPACT IS 3 FOLD..

1. The planet - remember in just year one when we hit our sale targets we will have saved 130,000 deodorant containers.

2. Your health and your families - using a safer product everyday on an underarm area full of lymph nodes.

3. Other people - we have signed contracts with WaterAid to work in partnership on this project.

Proverb launched 18 months ago but we hope, with your help, to create a sustainable social enterprise arm of our business which gives away 100% of the profit. Our most ambitious project yet.

BUT WHY WATERAID?

Well, we have our daughter Layla to thank for that. Back in 2016, when she was just 6, Luke was talking to Layla about their plan as a family to give 10% of their disposable income to a charity that could help families that were less fortunate than themselves. 

As they sat watching YouTube videos from several charities, this WaterAid one really struck a chord with Layla, she was shocked that there are children in the world that had to walk 4 miles a day for dirty water! This reaction is not a new one but her solution to the problem was one that only the open mindedness of youth could conceive, “why not give them 100% of our income?”

 

At the time the thought of giving 100% of our family disposable income away seemed to be the beautifully naive thoughts of a kind hearted 6 year old but not long after we realised that a social enterprise business could indeed give away 100% of its disposable income (profit). A chance meeting with the inspiration, Karen Lynch, CEO of Belu Water (who give 100% of their profits to WaterAid - £1million last year) made them realise that they could achieve a family dream by creating a sustainable business that would combine their passions for clean, natural, effective products with their drive for wellbeing not only for their customers but the planet.

Over the next 5 years we aim to raise £500,000 which will go towards supporting WaterAid’s mission to deliver clean water, decent toilets and good hygiene everywhere to everyone within a generation. We are blessed to have the help and guidance of Belu Water who have achieved this with great success.

We are the co-founders and owners of 2 Natural and Organic skincare brands.

Our first brand Pinks Boutique is a Soil Association organic certified skincare range with 60 products used by over 120 UK spas including John Lewis &beauty spas, Cowley Manor and the Scarlet. It is 10 years old. In her early 20s Kirstie started, ran and sold a very successful beauty training school which trained over 1500 students a year.

We have spent 10 years immersed in natural and organic product development, sustainability of ingredients and packaging. Proverb is our newest brand and will house the deodorant which will be unisex and for all armpits.

Proverb is a collision of Kirstie’s 20 year’s expertise, creating certified clean, natural and organic skincare and Luke's 2 degrees in human health and genetics from Oxford University, where we both met. 

While studying Biological Anthropology Luke signed a professional rugby contract playing for 11 years in the English Premiership and Championship representing Harlequins RFU (7 years), captaining them in the Heineken Cup and also playing in the England 7s, Great Britain 7’s and the Barbarians squads. Those years of elite sports nutrition, training and fixation on performance as a professional athlete are core to our Proverb ingredient choice and ethos of 360 degree health and wellbeing.

We have self-funded both brands and we have run them with no more than 4 full time people at anyone time including us. We are a total of 17 years into working for ourselves and that rollercoaster called entrepreneurism.  

 

 

"Kirstie and Luke have come up with a great idea where we can all do our bit to help save the planet. Please, please get behind them, get behind this project as it is a really easy way for you to help make a difference."

 

“The first time Kirstie and Luke heard the Belu water story in detail, I was chairing a panel for a WaterAid event for International day of the girl. They got almost as excited as I do on the social enterprise model – (a business that exist primarily to make positive change in the world). They were fascinated to learn how our 100% of profits to WaterAid model worked, given our business also has an ‘environment first’ approach.  It has been joyous to spend time around my kitchen table with this powerhouse of a team, to see their idea develop and to embrace both those things.  This product that truly innovates in its sector to reduce waste.  Combine this with transforming lives through access to clean water through a small change to your personal hygiene routine… what’s not to like? I’ll be signing up for sure.”

 

“We’re delighted to partner with Proverb, who share the value of making a difference in the world through sustainable practices.  Businesses play a crucial role in ensuring everyone, everywhere has access to clean water, decent toilets and good hygiene by helping to raise awareness both with consumers and sector wide and doing business differently by prioritising the health and wellbeing of people and planet.

The crisis in access to water, sanitation and hygiene is ongoing with hundreds of millions of people worldwide being denied access to these basic needs. By working together we really can make a difference.”
 

 

 

Logistics chief, maths wizz kid and very good at catching egg shaped balls. However, his true skill is carrying stuff. His official bio reads...

While studying Biological Anthropology at Oxford University Luke signed a professional rugby contract playing for 11 years in the English Premiership and Championship representing Harlequins (7 years), captaining them in the Heineken Cup, England and GB 7’s and the Barbarians squads.

Unsurprisingly he developed a dedication to elite health, diet and wellbeing leading him to join co-founder Kirstie in 2009 to launch their first organic skincare range, Pinks Boutique, which sells to spas including Aman Resorts and John Lewis.

Luke believed the beauty industry needed a brand with integrity, dedicated to the clean, natural and organic ingredients he ate as part of his elite sports nutrition that would deliver lab proven results and launched Proverb in late 2017.

 

In charge of detail. Formulations, everything organic and natural, design, teaching and training and then some more incessant detail. Her official bio reads…

Listed as Number One Most Influential Person in the Natural Beauty Yearbook ‘Who’s Who’ 2015/16, co-founder of Proverb and award winning organic certified spa brand Pinks Boutique. She has been responsible for developing treatment protocols and training therapists to have an elite 5* spa touch in many spas including Āman Global Resorts, Radisson Edwardian Blu, the Scarlet and John Lewis’s first concept spa chain &Beauty. She developed and sold a beauty, nail and massage school brand in her early 20s. She is a third generation beauty expert and a mass of passion and expert knowledge on green, clean formulations, skin function and results. Her true skill set lies in training and helping the masses understand what is really going into skincare bottles.

 

A super talented and dedicated multi-tasker. Jules swaps from supporting the warehouse, and customer service to design, video editing and social content. He has been part of the team for 4 years and was here since the day Proverb was scribbled on the back of a proverbial fag packet.

 

The maths. She combines her unbelievable business financial and tax knowledge with raising 4 children. We met when she left PwC on her first maternity and her oldest daughter Mollie is Layla’s (our daughter) best friend. 

 

In charge of delivering happiness. Natalie is the sole reason everyone gets their orders, safe and sounds when they are meant to. She is also insanely good at delivering happiness to the office and team.

 

 

How does your support help us deliver the product to market?

Proverb stands for a “statement of truth or advice” and so we aim to be totally transparent about how your funding will help us bring this dream to life. 

We always get the feeling that nowadays product crowdfunding can be a little misleading as businesses in fact have the products already manufactured and are just using it as marketing. So, let us tell you exactly where we are with our mission and why we can’t complete it without you.  

Packaging Design - Version 1 of the refillable case design is done which is what you can see on the campaign page. We have not put this into production though as we need funding to do so. Plus if we overfund the campaign it opens up more possibility to improve the design of the refillable case. We have a working prototype now but only 1!!

Natural Deodorant Formulations and scents - We have been working on and testing the formula for the last 18 months and have 2 versions (scents) signed off. They have been through all legal and human armpit testing ready for manufacturing. The funds will enable this production to happen. For this project to have the biggest impact possible we hope to launch in key retail stores who will require us to formulate more scents which will require funding. 

Deodorant Manufacturing - We have trialled and created a solution to produce the deodorant refill on a scale to meet the demands of our campaign, but we are believers that you could always do better. If we smash crowd funding and raise over ½ million pounds then we could look at a new engineering technology to make the manufacturing process for the refills more time efficient, less impactful and more sustainable. Once they have the packaging the manufacturing team are ready to put the first run into action, all they need now is an order! 

Printing Refill Packaging - Quite simply we need to design this and pay for it all to be made! We have an awesome idea of what it will look like (see above) but we need to finalise design, work with suppliers to make sure ink, cardboard, wrapping is at the very least 100% recyclable, compostable and sustainable. Our vision is to overfund and find the ultimate biodegradable packaging so you can take protecting the environment into your own hands!

Delivering your order - Once we have reached our target we can put the first run into production and get the warehouse stocked up. We already have an integrated stock-management system,      e-commerce website and logistics in place for www.proverbskin.com. However, our expectation is that we will need to increase shelving capacity, manufacturing staffing and the warehouse team required to deliver your order in good time. Fingers crossed we have so many orders to ship out that Kirstie and Luke will be doing the night shift!

Timescales - With funding in place from a successful campaign the team have a detailed timeline to complete the above projects during September and October 2019 to ensure that your orders are fulfilled worldwide in November 2019, the perfect Christmas present. Overfunding will also mean that we will be able to produce prototypes of an extension to the range, a Proverb body wash, shampoo and conditioner to also go into our 100% of profits to WaterAid product gang. We will then target key spa, gym & hotel partners to convince them to stock the World’s Kindest Wash Room Amenities.

The crowdfunding will enable us to finish and actually produce all the products. It doesn’t have a marketing budget within it or money for more team members all of which would have a huge impact. Feel free to help us smash the total so we can add this in and start shouting about it all.

In short together we are on the brink of delivering something incredible… YOU ROCK!!

The crowdfunding will enable us to finish and actually produce all the products. It doesn’t have a marketing budget within it or money for more team members all of which would have a huge impact. Feel free to help us smash the total so we can add this in and start shouting about it all.
In short together we are on the brink of delivering something incredible… YOU ROCK!!

story:
Introducing: LaLaLå!- Jivamukti Yoga Los Angeles

Opening in the Arts District in Downtown Los Angeles, LaLaLa is the first and only Jivamukti Yoga center located on the West Coast. 

Help us make Downtown Los Angeles the new global crossroads for Jivamukti! 


"...without Jivamukti, yoga in the US would still be the obscure practice of a few devotees" Vanity Fair

 

WHAT WE’RE DOING

We’re building a home for Jivamukti on the West Coast! Los Angeles is a hub for all things creative and cultural—and an incredible destination for Jivamukti Yoga! 

Yoga is both the practice and the goal. And though its free to all practice, there are many costs associated with building, opening and running a yoga studio. 

We’re asking for your help to build a new home for Jivamukti Yoga, so that we can both further the mission at the heart of the method, and establish Jivamukti in the hearts, minds, and bodies of practitioners on the West Coast. 

 

WHAT YOU HELP US ACHIEVE 

Jivamukti Yoga it is a path to enlightenment through compassion for all beings. The practitioners of Jivamukti Yoga are adventurers, visionaries, environmentalists, artists and activists, learners and leaders. 

By bringing Jivamukti Yoga to Los Angeles, we are tapping into a demographic of global proportions in a thriving arts and cultural capital. The principals for yogic living are shared and passed on through Jivamukti Yoga, and we have an opportunity to share our practice with people from so many walks of life, while raising the consciousness of the planet one person at a time. 

And it’s only possible through your support. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise a minimum of $75k (ideally 100k) in order for us to complete the buildout and renovations for the space. Your contributions will build walls, fixtures, bathrooms, showers, software and IT infrastructure, a sound system and equipment. Your support will help pay for permits, teachers, staff, contractors, inventory, marketing, accounting and legal expenses—and it will literally give us a floor to stand on. 

Though we have a couple of passionate investors, we need your additional support at this critical time in order to secure and pay for all the services that so many have contributed to this venture. 

Some Perks!: (...aside from savasana)

We don't expect that you'll donate for 'no-thing'...(though you're free to of course) so whether you want to contribute $100 or $5000 we have something for you: 

Even if you don't plan to come to LA for the opening, with a contribution of just $108 you'll be part of this exciting launch with your limited edition organic cotton JYLA LaLaLa t-shirt and 4 classes (enough to send your west coast friend to a 4 week basics course :) 

For $250 we are offering a JivaLA special that you can keep for yourself, or pass on to someone you know and love who will benefit. It’s a special rate 10 class pass with no expiration, so you're free to use it whenever you come to LA (or pass along to someone to share the opportunity), as well as an ICP with a certified Jivamukti Yoga teacher (the exclusive one-on-one experience of a Jivamukti Yoga class). 

For $1008 we offer you a special rate 6 month unlimited class membership, as well as some other fun gifts attached (again, you can gift the opportunity to another practitioner if you can’t make it to Los Angeles but want to support) 

For $5000, along with a 2 year membership (which you can split with you and your loved one if you want to do them simultaneously) you'll also receive 2 ICP's per year during membership, and a spot on one of our outstanding international retreats**...as well as our eternal gratitude on our Thank You wall.  

**based on availability, not including airfare

The Impact

Jiva= individual soul; Mukti = liberation 

Jivamukti Yoga is liberation while living! It is founded on the tenets of Non-Violence, Devotion, Meditation, Study, and Listening. 

Sharon Gannon and David Life (founders of Jivamukti) have been artists and activists their entire lives, and have helped pioneer what we know as modern day yoga... (read the Jivamukti Yoga book if you wanna know more about the history, it’s amazing). 

The global community they have built contributes daily to compassion in politics, arts, human and animal rights, environmentalism—and most importantly—living kindly. The Jivamukti method has influenced the landscape of modern-day yoga and helped to bring ancient teachings into a modern and relevant context. 

By bringing Jivamukti Yoga to Los Angeles, we are able to offer access to students all over the globe to come study, practice, and even teach. As a full service Jivamukti Yoga center, we will offer JTAP apprenticeship programs, continuing education, immersions, and workshops with venerated teachers from many traditions and practices. 

This is a business, but its also a labor of love. It is an offering to a metropolitan community that we believe serves the well-being of the planet as a whole. By bringing this method to a major city like Los Angeles, we’re certain that we’ll create far-reaching and lasting resources for the growth of the Jivamukti method and our collective spirit. 

 

Risks & Challenges

There is a high initial cost in opening in a big city like Los Angeles, and so many on our team have already invested faith, effort, time, money, and skill to get us this far—raising this capital ensures that time and resources won't be lost. 

Your funding is critical to our success. Yoga studios are not inherently huge money-makers, but in success, they can cultivate vital communities that enhance our global society. 

We have the great opportunity to grow with the thriving Arts District community (which believe it or not has NO yoga studios in the immediate area!). We know this is a wise and well-timed investment, not only for the neighborhood, but for all of you that want to breath new life into Jivamukti and share its teachings. 

Our teachers and their teachers have done the work to codify and bring these teachings and practices to the world. It is our responsibility and privilege to continue to share, honor and grow what they have given us. 

 

ABOUT JIVAMUKTI 

Founded in the East Village of NYC in 1984 by activists and artists, Sharon Gannon and David Life, Jivamukti Yoga is a pioneer in integrated yoga. The method has contributed significantly to the exponential rise of yoga in the west. 

ABOUT ME

Ha-Chi Yu was born and raised on the Lower East Side of NYC, during the same time and place as the birth of Jivamukti. She grew up dancing on the sidewalks of the city, then across world stages as a professional dancer. She was a principal dancer with Feld Ballet/Ballet Tech for over 20 years, during which time she also worked as a director, choreographer, ballet master, and dance captain with local and global productions. 

Ha-Chi is an Advanced Certified Jivamukti Yoga teacher, the founder of Prana Productions, and the former Program Director for Jivamukti Yoga® Teacher Training. She has produced trainings, workshops, retreats, and festivals globally, which has granted personal association with some of the most esteemed teachers and spiritual leaders around the world. 

Ha-Chi is a 500hr RYT Yoga Alliance registered through Vibrant Living Yoga and Bhakti Flow Yoga, and a certified teacher in Gyrotonic™  and Pilates method. 

Her experience as a dancer and teacher has taken her around the world, and her career in management has helped bridge her sensible nature with a passion for sharing and implementing the practices of Yoga.

**On a personal note: Through the grace of my family, friends and teachers, I have been able to learn, teach, travel and share so many adventures with so many of you that are reading this. Regardless of what context our paths have crossed, no doubt it was through a community that we share. I know this because all the most important people whom I've met, and all the hats I’ve worn in this lifetime so far, are marked by that distinction—done in the course of building something real and lasting, together. Whether it was NYC, LA, nightlife, daylight, across the sea, city, desert, or mountains, backstage or on-stage, at a bar or at the barre, we have communed in shared experiences that provided new perspectives. That is the effect of satsang, the power of cultivating a community. 

Please be divine and help us shine our light in the City of Angels.

--Other Ways You Can Help--

We know some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share this with those who you think can make a monetary contribution. 
  • Please let us know if you are present and willing to make karma yoga (service) contributions in LA: we'll need skilled assistance in social media, accounting, graphics, marketing and getting the word out...we'll eventually need housing for visiting Jivamukti Yoga teachers and students - but mostly, we need you to just be present, show up. 
  • Send your friends and family and loved ones our way. LA gets millions of visitors every year, please make some noise and find a way to share this with everyone you know who may find themselves in LA and remind them to come visit us and pass it forward. Come to class, support your local studio and teachers! 

 

Lokah Samastah Sukhino Bhavantu

May all beings everywhere be happy and free, and may the thoughts, words, and actions of my own life contribute in some way to that happiness and to that freedom for all. 

Om Shantih

story:
These clients often feel alone and overwhelmed.  Many of them do not receive family support to change their diets, and this is so important. We understand the overwhelm people feel when they are making big lifestyle changes, especially when they are already feeling vulnerable from their health challenges. We have been there ourselves. In 2015, Cathy began experiencing health issues, and was not comfortable taking conventional medicine due to possible side effects. We were so intrigued by the role food plays in overall health that Cathy became a nutritional consultant. Both of us have improved our diets and began eating as much organic food as possible. We wondered if we could grow our own organic produce. Now, we do! John became a Certified Square Foot Gardening Instructor, a method of gardening that produces a high yield of crops in small areas.  He has created a 300 square foot organic urban farm in our backyard.  

Shamballa Urban Farm & Wellness Center is in a unique position with an excellent niche market, no known competition, and working in association with a holistic medicine practice that has been established in the area for 30 years. There are many startup expenses we will have that donors can help with, so we can be fully operational by December 1, 2017. If you like the idea of an organic farmer and chef growing his own organic food and preparing it for delivery to health challenged people, please donate whatever amount you can, and share our campaign with all your friends. Thank you for helping us pay it forward. As Hippocrates said “Let food be thy medicine, and medicine be thy food.”

 

What We Need & What You Get

Mostly supplies are needed to be prepared to launch:

$15 for business cards

$20 for 2 boxes of freezer film

$25 for a car magnet (they would like 4)

$50 for a small marine cooler

$60 for a Costco Business Membership to purchase organic food when not in season on their farm

$100 for logo apparel such as aprons, shirts, ballcaps (for making public appearances)

$100 for a full size marine cooler

$125 for a day of commercial kitchen space rental

$200 for assorted cookware

$250 for a collapsible utility cart

$300 for 6 months of General Liability Insurance

ANY amount is appreciated and can always go towards food costs! 

The Impact

Myrtle Beach SC is an area that has a large elderly population, and proportionately, many residents live with serious health issues. Most of these clients are well over 65 years old, are seriously ill, and many live alone. In Cathy's work as a senior caregiver, she sees many seniors who are malnourished because they either do not want to cook entire meals for themselves, or they don't know what to buy, how to cook it, or how to combine foods. These clients will be able to choose meals weekly from a menu specifically prescribed according to their individual needs. The meals will be frozen for them, and delivered, and they can simply heat them and eat. It will be easy for them to eat healthy and flavorful meals and stay within their nutritional guidelines.

Risks & Challenges

Since the majority of clients will be elderly and have health challenges, retention will unfortunately be a factor if a client passes away. Cathy & John intend to launch this business with 8-10 individuals, providing a week's worth of lunches and dinners for each.  They also anticipate maintaining a waiting list to keep the client number consistent. Cathy & John have been cooking privately for two people for the last year, and have excellent communication with these clients as to their likes and dislikes.  Both clients are satisfied and still receive weekly deliveries.  Myrtle Beach SC is a coastal city on the Atlantic Ocean, so there is a slight possibility of business being interrupted by a hurricane, so just putting it out there to keep things real. 

Other Ways You Can Help

ANY amount of money that you can contribute is accepted in humble gratitude! If you cannot contribute money, you can still help by sharing the campaign to your list of friends on Facebook and your email lists. If you belong to any civic organizations, share this campaign. If you live in a retirement community, you can share this campaign and ask Cathy & John Andrews and Linda Runk to come talk to your group about healthy eating, and receiving medically prescribed foods tailored for individual needs. Gift certificates are available to purchase a week's worth of food (lunches and dinners) for someone.

story:
Help us reach 501(c)(3)status

Your Special Day was created to provide well deserving and underprivileged children with wellness and safety strategies all while creating positive memories by rewarding these children with a day solely for and about them. And by acknowledging their birthdays, good grades, good deeds, and overall contribution to the community, we hope to inspire them to keep striving and encourage them to continue with these positive contributions for the rest of their lives.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We plan to raise $900 over the course of 45 days.
  • The proceeds from this campaign will go solely towards obtaining our 501(c) status (tax exempt status) and other legal fees to help us get our organization up and running. 
  • As an incentive, we will select our most generous donors to receive a personal care package filled with Eco-friendly and vegan items.
  • Other donors can receive a special shout out across our social media or a video message/shout out from us.

The Impact

Our many experiences in life shape the way that we look at the world. In fact, most people consider experiences more valuable than items. And what better experience is there than being celebrated. Thus, our approach to essential life strategies with workshops and the creation of positive memories could make a world of difference in the lives of the children.

Additionally, although we may face the challenge of not raising enough funding with this initial campaign, we plan on reaching our goal by being diligent and persistent to ensure that we achieve our financial goal to get our nonprofit organization off the ground and into our community.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that everyone cannot donate at the moment. However, you can still help out tremendously by making some noise! Help us get the word out about our campaign by sharing our page and our posts.

Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank You!
