story:
Long story short...

The Cabin is an oasis from the hectic city life. Located in rural Spain, nearby Valencia city, it is an idyllic, sacred, off-the-grid place for Individual Retreats, workshops, and community projects.

Kamila, the initiator of the project, has decided to dedicate her life to helping others to find their true self and by teaching them how to re-connect with themselves and with the healing powers of Mother Nature. "I am a transpersonal therapist, nature lover and artist. So far I have been giving treatments in a rented apartment. Now I feel the time has come to take it a step further." - says Kamila. The plan is simple:

  • move to a quiet place in Nature 
  • create a Safe, Sacred and Healing space
  • host people from all over the world.

 

What exactly will happen in The Cabin?

The Cabin will be used to host Individual Retreats, that will give the Guest a chance to have some quiet “me” time, develop their meditation practice, have time for reflection away from work or family and to deepen their spiritual life.

The treatments offered in The Cabin:

  • deep holistic body therapy, that will help you to get rid of physical and emotional toxins,
  • meditations, yoga
  • Forest Baths
  • Shamanic healing
  • diet plans & fasting
  • and many, many more

Apart from the retreats, you will be able to attend the  workshops, Sacred Ceremonies and to participate in community projects (gardening, permaculture, living off-grid, etc.)

What We Need & What You Get

We are still looking for the right place, and have found a couple of houses that could potentially meet our needs. These are the estimates of how much money we need  and where it will go:

  • ~35,000€ to buy a small house with a piece of land+ fees  (including indiegogo) & taxes
  • ~13,000€ for renovation & insurance
  • ~3,000€ to build 2 additional constructions ( super cute cob houses)
  • ~2,500€ to instal solar panels
  • ~1,000€ to buy furniture + appliances
  • ~499€ to buy equipment (for massage, yoga, meditations, music, etc)
  • we also need volunteers who have experience in off-grid living, permaculture & building

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

What's in it for You?

If this projects gets fully funded, every person who backs us or helps us by spreading the word, will be able to visit us in the lovely Cabin, to buy a treatment or come for a longer Retreat. Additionally, we offer substantial discounts for Personalized Retreats, treatments and workshops for top backers, and respective smaller discounts too!

... and if we don't reach the entire goal?

We won't give up! We will keep looking for other ways to get funded, and we'll keep you updated about the progress. We will try to find alternative solutions, for example some of the treatments can be carried out in Kamila's home practice. We will make sure we communicate with you, but most of all, we will make sure The Cabin will become reality!

The Impact - we make this world a better place

Kamila says: "I believe that the kind of Holistic Body work that I offer is one of the most effective therapies that can help people who struggle with depression, anxiety, low self-esteem, PTSDF and a range of other challenges. It is also a powerful tool for people who want to develop their spirituality and feel truly connected with the Source".

Kamila has already succeeded in opening her own practice in Valencia, where she has been working as a therapist since Autumn 2017. On her Spanish website you can read her clients' testimonials as well as see the gallery of her home studio.

"By moving to The Cabin,  this work will become even more meaningful. Surrounded and supported  by Nature, we will provide excellent conditions for healing and transformation."

Moreover, we will prove that living off-the-grid is easy and safe (and comfortable!) and we strongly believe it can help to promote eco-friendly, conscious, simple living on a global scale.

 

Risks & Challenges

Since we want to keep the costs to a minimum, we are looking for a humble rural house. We've already found a few candidates. However, many of such houses in Spain have been build 'illegally' meaning they haven't been registered as homes. This means we might need to spend extra money on the legal matters. 

Another challenge is to make The Cabin sustainable in terms of money - the beginnings might not be easy - before the world hears about us. For that reason, Kamila will keep working as a therapist in Valencia city part-time. We will also use help of volunteers in this project - we have worked as volunteers ourselves, and it has always been such a rewarding thing to do!

Other Ways You Can Help

  1. Become a volunteer! Once we've bought the land, we will need extra help to make it shine
  2. Share this project with people You think would be willing to invest some money in The Cabin. Use some catchy frases to approach them, have them see all the perks & benefits they can get, like having a chance to re-connect with themselves and to become a  happier person, hey, who wouldn't like that?!
  3. Share with us your ideas, experience, contacts, etc.

Thank you, namaste ❤ 

ABOUT KAMILA:

  • Professional profile: http://www.tantricjourney.com/tantric-therapist...
  • Professional profile in Spanish: https://detoxemocional.info/masajista-valencia/
  • Kamila's YouTube adventure channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCZfyz4Wciq_Zi-...
  • Location: Province of Valencia, Spain

 

ESPAÑOL

En breve...

The Cabin podría convertirse en tu segundo hogar. Situado en la España rural, cerca de la ciudad de Valencia, es un lugar idílico, sagrado y 'off the grid' (fuera de la red) para hacer Retiros Individuales, talleres y proyectos comunitarios.

Kamila, la iniciadora del proyecto, ha decidido dedicar su vida a hacer de este mundo un lugar mejor ayudando a otros a regresar a su verdadera esencia y enseñándoles a reconectar consigo mismos y con los poderes curativos de la Madre Naturaleza. "Soy terapeuta transpersonal, amante de la naturaleza y artista. Hasta ahora he estado dando tratamientos en un apartamento alquilado. Ahora siento que ha llegado el momento de llevarlo un paso más allá". - dice Kamila.

El plan es simple:

  1. mudarse a un lugar tranquilo en la naturaleza
  2. crear un espacio seguro, sagrado y sanador
  3. acoger a personas de todo el mundo.

 

¿Qué sucederá exactamente en The Cabin?

La cabaña se utilizará para albergar retiros individuales, que le darán al huésped la oportunidad de pasar un rato tranquilo de "mí", desarrollar su práctica de meditación, tener tiempo para reflexionar fuera del trabajo o de la familia y profundizar en su vida espiritual.

Los tratamientos ofrecidos en The Cabin:

  • terapia corporal holística profunda, que te ayudará a deshacerte de las toxinas físicas y emocionales,
  • práctica suave de yoga meditaciones,
  • Baños del bosque
  • Curación chamánica
  • planes de dieta y ayuno
  • y muchos muchos ma

Además de los retiros, usted podrá visitarnos para talleres, ceremonias sagradas y participar en proyectos comunitarios (jardinería, permacultura, vida fuera de la red, etc.)

 

Lo que necesitamos

Todavía estamos buscando el lugar correcto, y ya hemos encontrado un par de chalets que potencialmente podrían satisfacer nuestras necesidades. Estas son las estimaciones de cuánto dinero necesitamos y dónde irá:

~ 35,000 € para comprar una casa pequeña con un pedazo de tierra + tasas e impuestos

~ 13.000 € reformas  

~ 3.000 € para construir 2 construcciones adicionales (casas de adobe super lindas)

~ 2,500 € para instalar paneles solares

~ 1,000 € para comprar muebles + electrodomésticos

~ 499 € para comprar equipo (para masajes, yoga, meditación, música, etc.)

- también necesitamos voluntarios que tengan experiencia en la vida fuera de la red, la permacultura y la construcción

¿Usted qué saca de esto?

Si estos proyectos se financian por completo, cada persona que nos respalde o nos ayude al difundir la palabra, podrá visitarnos en la hermosa cabaña, comprar un tratamiento o un fin de semana o una semana / Retiro de 10 días. Además, ofrecemos los 'perks' sustanciales para retiros personalizados, tratamientos y talleres para los mejores patrocinadores, y descuentos más pequeños respectivos también! ...

...y si no alcanzamos el objetivo completo?

¡No nos daremos por vencidos! Seguiremos buscando otras formas de obtener fondos, y lo mantendremos informado sobre el progreso. Trataremos de encontrar soluciones alternativas, por ejemplo, algunos de los tratamientos se pueden llevar a cabo en la clínica hogareña de Kamila. Nos aseguraremos de comunicarnos contigo, pero sobre todo, ¡nos aseguraremos de que The Cabin se convierta en realidad!

 

El impacto: hacemos de este mundo un lugar mejor

 

Kamila dice: "Creo que el tipo de trabajo de Body Holistic que ofrezco es una de las terapias más efectivas que pueden ayudar a las personas que luchan contra la depresión, la ansiedad, la baja autoestima, el PTSDF y una variedad de otros desafíos. una poderosa herramienta para las personas que desean desarrollar su espiritualidad y sentirse verdaderamente conectadas con la Fuente ".

Kamila ya ha logrado abrir su propia práctica en Valencia, donde ha trabajado como terapeuta desde el otoño de 2017. En su sitio web en español puede leer los testimonios de sus clientes y ver la galería de su gabinete casero.

Al mudarse a la Cabaña, este trabajo será aún más significativo. Rodeado y apoyado por la Naturaleza, brindaremos excelentes condiciones para la curación y la transformación. Además, demostraremos que vivir fuera de la red es fácil y seguro (¡y cómodo!)

Y creemos firmemente que puede ayudar a promover una vida ecológica, consciente y simple a escala global.

 

Riesgos y desafíos

Dado que queremos mantener los costos al mínimo, estamos buscando una casa rural humilde. Sin embargo, muchas de estas casas en España han sido construidas "ilegalmente" lo que significa que no han sido escritas como casas. Esto significa que podríamos necesitar gastar dinero extra en asuntos legales. Como queremos crear un lugar seguro, una parte de los fondos se destinará a consultar a expertos en vivienda y construcción.

Otro desafío es hacer que The Cabin sea sostenible en términos de dinero, los comienzos podrían no ser fáciles, antes de que el mundo escuche acerca de nosotros. Por esa razón, Kamila seguirá trabajando como terapeuta en Valencia a tiempo parcial. También contrataremos voluntarios en este proyecto; hemos trabajado como voluntarios, ¡y siempre ha sido una tarea tan gratificante!

Puedes ayudar de otras formas

  • ¡Hazte voluntario! Una vez que hayamos comprado la tierra, necesitaremos ayuda adicional para que brille
  • Comparte este proyecto con personas que crees que estarían dispuestas a invertir algo de dinero en The Cabin. Use algunas frases pegadizas para acercarse a ellos, haga que vean todos los beneficios y ventajas que pueden obtener, como tener la oportunidad de volver a conectarse consigo mismos y convertirse en una persona más feliz, hey, ¿a quién no le gustaría eso?
  • Comparte con nosotros tus ideas, experiencias, contactos, etc.

Gracias, namaste ❤

ACERCA DE KAMILA:

Perfil profesional en inglés: http: //www.tantricjourney.com/tantric-therapist ...

Perfil profesional en español: https://detoxemocional.info/masajista-valencia/

El canal de aventuras de Kamila en YouTube: https: //www.youtube.com/channel/UCZfyz4Wciq_Zi -...

Ubicación: Provincia de Valencia, España

story:
We still need contributions!

Even though we've hit our 2nd goal of $12,000 doesn't mean we're where we need to be. That was just an initial amount to make sure we hit our goal for Indiegogo to release our funds and allow us to still receive much-needed contributions after the campaign is over. 

 

✓ $5,000 ✓

We did it! Thanks, everyone :)

 

✓ $12,000 ✓

Wow, we just made it!! Now we can provide animals to all 3 villages! Everyone is so excited. We're putting the plan into action over the next couple of weeks so stay tuned.

 

$25,000

This will allow us to go beyond the 3 initial villages and turn this into a growing movement across Africa. Please help us reach this before the end of the year.

 

 

 

Help Preserve the Fountain of Unlimited Health Uniquely Found in Micro Communities Around the World

In a few places in the world, the natural state of our perfect health remains.  These communities provide a window of what is possible.  They show that illness (both chronic and immediate) is an unnatural state.  However, the health of these communities is under threat. 

Humanitarian and environmental efforts have begun to whittle away at their traditional diets and have encroached on their land.  The children are being fed a school lunch of water, beans, corn, sugar, and vegetable oil. 

If this continues, we will see the same decline in health that we have seen all over the world.  Soon, they too will think that chronic disease and ill-health are normal.  At Cows 4 Kids, our mission is to provide the school children with their traditional tribal diet and to help community members preserve their ancient dietary knowledge in a modern setting. 

Learn more about the positive impact we have and join us in bringing about Cows 4 Kids!

 

 

Here at Cows 4 Kids, we find that it is not good enough to reverse disease.  We are in the business of stopping it all together.  Each of the communities we support consumes a different traditional diet, yet they all maintain perfect health.  We provide them with the animals to continue their unique ancestral diets and keep their wisdom alive.

 

 

The Team

Mary Ruddick, Brian Sanders, and Jay Hanamura started Cows4Kids.com after a life changing trip to Tanzania and Uganda.  All three founding members have long worked toward reversing disease in the western world.  Upon seeing the perfect health of so many villages start to decline, they realized that something had to be done.  Cows4Kids is a result.  Contact us and join the revolution:

hello@cowsforkids.com

 

 

Why We Are Different 

The beauty of giving an animal to a village, is that it is self-sustaining.  These animals will have babies that will have babies, providing unlimited generations with nutrient-dense ancestral nourishment.  This is not a handout.  Further, none of these animals require feed in these regions, as they graze on the wild plants.  The communities supported by Cows 4 Kids have a heritage of animal rearing, and already maintain the skills to keep vibrantly healthy animals. 

 

 

Maasai Village

The Maasai live in Tanzania in the valley of Kilimanjaro.  Their traditional diet includes raw milk, blood, goat meat, beef, and herbal tea.  Although the children have their traditional diets at home, they are fed vegetable oil, corn, and beans at school.  For this Maasai village, 10 cows and 20 goats are needed for the school to provide a proper Maasai lunch.

 

Chagga Village

The Chagga live on Mount Kilimanjaro in Tanzania.  Their traditional diet includes fresh glacial water, milk, butter, goat meat, beef, chicken, fish, eggs, banana, taro, avocado, mango, sorghum, and millet.  In the last hundred years, maize has replaced sorghum.  With this initiative, our goal is to promote proper processing of maize using the five-stage process.  This process is necessary to avoid pellagra and malnutrition.  In addition, we aim to provide enough chickens, goats, and cows to feed the children their traditional diet while at school.  Currently, they are being fed a gruel comprised of unprocessed maize, beans, and water.  For this Chagga village, 20 cows, 30 goats, and 60 chickens are needed.

 

Batwa Village

The Batwa are in a unique situation in Uganda, as they have been displaced by the 1991 Bwindi National Park laws.  Traditionally living as hunter gatherers, the Batwa have always maintained perfect health.  However, as they are now displaced, they can no longer procure their food from hunting, and their health is rapidly declining.  They are in urgent need of livestock.  For this Batwa village, 20 cows, 50 goats, and 60 chickens are needed.

 

 

 

 

$10 Thank you

Every bit counts and we really appreciate your support!

 

$25 Give a chicken

Give a community 2 chickens to supply eggs.

Reward: Photo, video, and email updates from the villages

 

$60 Give a goat

Give a community a goat.

Reward: Photo, video, and email updates from the villages

NoseToTail.org 10% discount

 

$120 Give 3 pigs

Give a community 3 pigs.

Reward: Photo, video, and email updates from the villages

NoseToTail.org 10% discount

 

$300 Give a cow 

Give a community a cow

Reward: Photo, video, and email updates from the villages

NoseToTail.org 10% discount

Handmade ancestral art from Healthy Craft

 

$600 Gold Supporter

Give a community 1 cow, 4 goats, and 5 chickens

Reward: Zoom call with Mary & Brian

Photo, video, and email updates from the villages

NoseToTail.org 10% discount

Handmade ancestral art from Healthy Craft

 

$1000 Benefactor

Give the Chagga 2 cows, 5 goats, and 9 chickens

Reward: Stay for two nights with the Chagga

Photo, video, and email updates from the villages

NoseToTail.org 10% discount

Handmade ancestral art from Healthy Craft

Zoom call with Mary & Brian

 

$5,000 Adopt the Maasai village!

This donation provides 15 cows and 8 goats!

Reward:  Stay for three nights with the Maasai

Photo, video, and email updates from the villages

NoseToTail.org 10% discount

Handmade ancestral art from Healthy Craft

Zoom call with Mary & Brian

 

$10,000 Adopt the Batwa village!

This donation provides 20 cows, 40 goats, and 40 pigs.

Reward:  Stay for three nights with the Batwa

Photo, video, and email updates from the villages

NoseToTail.org 10% discount

Handmade ancestral art from Healthy Craft

Zoom call with Mary & Brian

 

$15,000 Adopt the Chagga village!  

This donation provides 35 cows, 48 goats, and 40 pigs!  This will continue to feed 350 Chagga children year-round.  

Reward: Stay for 4 nights with the Chagga and go on 1 adventure!

Photo, video, and email updates from the villages

Zoom call with Mary & Brian

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Copy the link to this page https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/cows-4-kids and share on any platform :)

Thanks so much!
story_txt:
We still need contributions!
Even though we've hit our 2nd goal of $12,000 doesn't mean we're where we need to be. That was just an initial amount to make sure we hit our goal for Indiegogo to release our funds and allow us to still receive much-needed contributions after the campaign is over. 
 
✓ $5,000 ✓
We did it! Thanks, everyone :)
 
✓ $12,000 ✓
Wow, we just made it!! Now we can provide animals to all 3 villages! Everyone is so excited. We're putting the plan into action over the next couple of weeks so stay tuned.
 
$25,000
This will allow us to go beyond the 3 initial villages and turn this into a growing movement across Africa. Please help us reach this before the end of the year.
 
 

 
Help Preserve the Fountain of Unlimited Health Uniquely Found in Micro Communities Around the World
In a few places in the world, the natural state of our perfect health remains.  These communities provide a window of what is possible.  They show that illness (both chronic and immediate) is an unnatural state.  However, the health of these communities is under threat. 
Humanitarian and environmental efforts have begun to whittle away at their traditional diets and have encroached on their land.  The children are being fed a school lunch of water, beans, corn, sugar, and vegetable oil. 
If this continues, we will see the same decline in health that we have seen all over the world.  Soon, they too will think that chronic disease and ill-health are normal.  At Cows 4 Kids, our mission is to provide the school children with their traditional tribal diet and to help community members preserve their ancient dietary knowledge in a modern setting. 
Learn more about the positive impact we have and join us in bringing about Cows 4 Kids!
 

 
Here at Cows 4 Kids, we find that it is not good enough to reverse disease.  We are in the business of stopping it all together.  Each of the communities we support consumes a different traditional diet, yet they all maintain perfect health.  We provide them with the animals to continue their unique ancestral diets and keep their wisdom alive.
 

 
The Team
Mary Ruddick, Brian Sanders, and Jay Hanamura started Cows4Kids.com after a life changing trip to Tanzania and Uganda.  All three founding members have long worked toward reversing disease in the western world.  Upon seeing the perfect health of so many villages start to decline, they realized that something had to be done.  Cows4Kids is a result.  Contact us and join the revolution:
hello@cowsforkids.com
 

 
Why We Are Different 
The beauty of giving an animal to a village, is that it is self-sustaining.  These animals will have babies that will have babies, providing unlimited generations with nutrient-dense ancestral nourishment.  This is not a handout.  Further, none of these animals require feed in these regions, as they graze on the wild plants.  The communities supported by Cows 4 Kids have a heritage of animal rearing, and already maintain the skills to keep vibrantly healthy animals. 
 


 
Maasai Village
The Maasai live in Tanzania in the valley of Kilimanjaro.  Their traditional diet includes raw milk, blood, goat meat, beef, and herbal tea.  Although the children have their traditional diets at home, they are fed vegetable oil, corn, and beans at school.  For this Maasai village, 10 cows and 20 goats are needed for the school to provide a proper Maasai lunch.
 
Chagga Village
The Chagga live on Mount Kilimanjaro in Tanzania.  Their traditional diet includes fresh glacial water, milk, butter, goat meat, beef, chicken, fish, eggs, banana, taro, avocado, mango, sorghum, and millet.  In the last hundred years, maize has replaced sorghum.  With this initiative, our goal is to promote proper processing of maize using the five-stage process.  This process is necessary to avoid pellagra and malnutrition.  In addition, we aim to provide enough chickens, goats, and cows to feed the children their traditional diet while at school.  Currently, they are being fed a gruel comprised of unprocessed maize, beans, and water.  For this Chagga village, 20 cows, 30 goats, and 60 chickens are needed.
 
Batwa Village
The Batwa are in a unique situation in Uganda, as they have been displaced by the 1991 Bwindi National Park laws.  Traditionally living as hunter gatherers, the Batwa have always maintained perfect health.  However, as they are now displaced, they can no longer procure their food from hunting, and their health is rapidly declining.  They are in urgent need of livestock.  For this Batwa village, 20 cows, 50 goats, and 60 chickens are needed.
 

 
 

 
$10 Thank you
Every bit counts and we really appreciate your support! $25 Give a chicken
Give a community 2 chickens to supply eggs.

story:
Love in Action

Mit Hilfe der Love in Action Kampagne wollen wir schwächere und verletzlichere Mitglieder unserer Gemeinschaft unterstützen:

  • Alleinerziehende, die mit wirtschaftlichen Problemen kämpfen
  • Menschen, die sich von einer schweren Krankheit erholen
  • Flüchtlinge, die ihr Zuhause verloren haben
  • Menschen, die in Krisengebieten aufgewachsen sind
  • Junge Menschen oder Arbeitslose, die sich Seminare nicht leisten können

 

 

Wer sind wir und was wir tun?

Wir sind ein engagiertes Team von erfahrenen Therapeuten und Seminarleitern, die in einer breiten Palette von Ansätzen und Modalitäten geschult sind. Wir lehren diese Arbeit nicht nur, sondern gehen auch selbst den Weg und integrieren die Prinzipien unserer Arbeit in unser eigenes tägliches Leben.

Wir haben eine tiefe Sehnsucht nach einem Leben voller Authentizität, Freude und Verbundenheit, um unser eigenes Potenzial freizusetzen und anderen zu helfen, dasselbe zu tun.
Der PATH of LOVE ist ein 7-Tage-Retreat und das Herzstück unserer Arbeit. Wir haben den PATH of LOVE 1995 zum ersten mal geleitet und heute findet er in 14 Ländern und auf 5 Sprachen in der ganzen Welt statt.
Diese Arbeit gibt dir Werkzeuge, um deine Bewusstheit und emotionale Intelligenz zu entwickeln. Dies ermöglicht eine Veränderung deiner Selbstwahrnehmung, deiner Empathie und Liebe für dich selbst, andere und der Mutter Erde .

 

 

Das Love in Action Programm

Wir haben bereits in mehreren Ländern Fonds eingerichtet, um Stipendien für Path-retreats und damit verbundene Programme anbieten zu können.

Geplante oder abgeschlossene Love in Action-Programme 2018

  • Kroatien, 20. - 27. März 2018, Path of Love. Wir übernehmen einen Großteil der Kursgebühren für mehr als 40 Bewohner aus dem ehemaligen Jugoslawien.

Geplant für 2018/19

  • USA: Awakening of Love (AOL) kostenloses Seminar für Krebs Rehabilitationspatienten.
  • Australien: AOL kostenlos für Menschen, die mit Menschen arbeiten.
  • Brasilien: Hilfe bei der Bekämpfung von Bränden in Brasilien
  • Deutschland: AOL kostenlos für alleinerziehende Eltern und arbeitslose junge Menschen
  • Deutschland: Meditationswochenende kostenlos für Syrische Flüchtlinge

 

 

Was wir mit unserer Kampagne erreichen wollen

Für die Crowdfunding Kampagne 2018 ist unser Ziel in drei konkrete Schritten unterteilt:

1. Schritt: Finanzierung von 25 Stipendien für Teilnehmer des Path of Love (POL) und Awakening of Love (AOL) in Deutschland, für Menschen in unserer Gesellschaft, die finanzielle Unterstützung benötigen.

2. Schritt: Finanzierung von insgesamt 35 Stipendien

3. Schritt: Finanzierung von insgesamt 50  Stipendien und von einem Meditationswochenende für Syrische Flüchtlinge*

* in Kollaboration mit Path of Love Global Foundation-London, UTA Akademie - Köln

 

Wie du helfen kannst

Es gibt viele Möglichkeiten, wie du konkret mithelfen kannst, Menschen auf dem Weg der Heilung die Teilnahme an Seminaren und Ausbildungen zu ermöglichen. Du kannst einen beliebigen Betrag spenden, indem du einfach auf die Schaltfläche "UNTERSTÜTZEN" klickst, oder du wählst ein kleines Geschenk aus der Liste der “Perks”:

 

Und Du kannst uns auch ganz einfach helfen indem du deinen Freunde und in deinem sozialen Netzwerk von Love in Action erzählst.

Verwende dazu den Link hier in Idiegogo (siehe Bild unten)

 

Wohin gehen die Spenden?

Wir haben einen Stipendienfond eingerichtet, in dem die Spenden verwaltet werden. Unser Love-in-Action-Komitee wird über die Verwendung von Mitteln entscheiden und jährlich werden wir auf unserer Website transparent machen, welche Projekte wir unterstützt haben und wie viele Stipendien wir vergeben konnten. Je nach Erfolg dieser Kampagne wollen wir 2018/19  Stipendien und Wochenendseminare für 25 bis 50 Teilnehmer ausgeben. Teilnehmer können während der Einschreibung zum Seminar, Ausbildungsbeiträge beantragen. Der persönliche Anspruch auf Unterstützung wird anhand klarer Kriterien und einer Defizitrechnung ermittelt.

story:
The Heroic Journey: Teaching Kids Empathy and Resilience. Ending Bullying.

We turn kids’ struggles into strengths, with mental health skills that last a lifetime. Teaching inclusion and ending bullying in all its forms!

 

OUR MISSION

Hello, my name is Jeanie Burdi. I am raising money for Pop Culture Hero Coalition, a powerful charity using psychology to end bullying in schools. My friends, family, and I have all been victims of bullying. 


Every child deserves to be psychologically and physically safe. And secure, empathetic, and resilient kids are the key to a positive future for us all. But research shows that:

  • 48-90% of children 9-12 of age are victims of bullying at school or online.
  • 80% of teen suicides may be attributable to bullying.
  • A growing percentage of children and teens experience depression, anxiety, fear, shame, loneliness, self-doubt, anger, addiction, and suicidal ideation.

 

In 2021, Pop Culture Hero Coalition launched The Heroic Journey Curriculum — the 1st program to teach crucial mental health skills and bullying prevention using stories from TV, comics, and film, which children and teens (and adults!) find relatable.

 

THE SOLUTION

Created by psychologists and veteran educators, The Heroic Journey’s 32 lesson plans teach crucial skills over a period of time, including: 

  • Violence prevention 
  • Responding to bullying, racism, misogyny, LGBTQIA+bullying 
  • Teaching empathy 
  • Resilience 
  • How to seek help 
  • Teaching healthy personal identity (crucial for ending fear and bias)
  • Ending implicit bias and becoming allies for targets
  • Healthy conflict resolution 
  • Creating restorative justice
  • Navigating peer pressure
  • Creating positive peer relationships and activities
  • Navigating anger, depression, anxiety, which can lead to behaviors such as self-harm, addiction, and suicidal ideation

 

The Heroic Journey is THE program used by YMCA of the USA nationwide for mental health and bullying prevention — impacting over 200,000 children and their parents in 2021. 

Now more than ever, it is crucial to teach children these life-saving skills.

 

WITH YOUR HELP

 

  • Our goal is to raise $50,000 to distribute The Heroic Journey Curriculum to kids in need.
  • 100% of the proceeds goes to distributing this crucial work to schools.
  • We will reach 225 teachers and 6,750 students EACH YEAR, in perpetuity.
  • We are offering Be Kind T-Shirts, Tote Bags, Water Bottles, and Pay It Forward Heroic Journey Curriculum Bundles! What better message is there?

 

THE IMPACT

 Research shows that teaching the tools used in The Heroic Journey positively affects children’s lives as many as 18 years after learning them.


Created by psychologists and veteran educators, The Heroic Journey harnesses the phenomenon of stories kids love, along with evidence-based psychology — and teaches them to be heroes — for themselves and each other.


We must teach children and teens empathy and resilience, for all of our sakes. Our future is in their hands.

 

Risks & Challenges

  • The only risk is not reaching our goal. We must teach children these crucial skills — before it is too late.
  • Our challenge is letting enough people know how they can help. Please contribute and share this vital campaign!

story:
Do you know of a nurse or doctor who is in the front lines fighting the corona virus? Do you wish to help them? If you do, this is your chance. We are a small apparel business that wants to make a difference in the world by contributing to the corona virus relief. We're passionate about keeping our doctors and nurses safe--because they're the most exposed to the ill effects of this virus. When you purchase a custom shirt, you will help a them stay safe and you'll also acknowledge their hard work and effort with our Thank You Shirts. 

     This is how this campaign will work. When you purchase a custom t-shirt from us, we will take out the cost and use the profit to purchase masks, gloves, scrubs and other medical supplies for doctors and nurses. The major perk of this is that you will be able to use your money towards good at a time when we all feel helpless in our homes because of our inability to do much plus you will also get an excellent quality t-shirt.

     Our goal is to sell at least 50,000 shirts. But if we don't reach this mark, we will still contribute whatever we make to doctors and nurses in hospitals and charities focused on the covid-19 relief efforts. We will update you about how much we contribute, so you will be certain your money is going towards a worthy cause.

      If we get an overwhelming response, we will have to make sure to keep the flow of medical supplies coming faster than ever. However, our team is working hard to make sure our supplies reach us promptly, so we can help as many people as we can.

    Please know that if you can't purchase a shirt, that is okay. You can still contribute to the relief effort when you spread the word and share our campaign with your family and friends. Let's raise our voice together and give our doctors and nurses the much needed recognition and care.

story:
We Miss You!

All of us at Live Nightclub are devastated that we are temporarily unable to able to provide top-tier experience that you've come to love and expect: we are going stir-crazy without all of you! With the government-mandated closure, many of our lovely staff are running into financial hardships that they may not be able to recover from. We need you help!

You can help!

Our staff would be so grateful for any help you can send our way, but we'd also like to give you something in return for your generosity! We have put together a list of incentives and experiences for you to purchase. You will get the warm and fuzzy feeling of helping your favorite people pay their bills during this closure, and when we reopen, we will have an unforgettable experience waiting for you!

Your Impact

Remember, every dollar you spend here will not only come back to you later, but will help keep the lights on for all of the employees of Live. Thank you so much for your generous contributions. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We get that everyone is going through a tough time right now, and maybe monetary support isn't an option for you right now. That's ok! Just share the heck out of this with everyone, you'll be helping more than you know!

XOXO,

Live Staff

story:
Hello! We are Comparlante, a social tech Foundation which seeks to improve the quality of life of persons with disabilities.

Since 2015 a team of 10 young entrepreneurs from 7 different Latin American countries is working to make this a less disabled world. Our first objective was to develop tools to shorten the access gap to education and information. Then our goal expanded to create more and better opportunities for persons with disabilities.

We believe that it is possible to create a better world for all by working together, you and us!


Today, we are pleased to introduce you IncluYes platform, an online marketplace where persons with disabilities can access services and products tailored to their preferences and needs. In short, it is like taking the best of Amazon and groupon turning it into a big buy & sell page accessible to everyone. The idea of this accessible platform came out when we identified the problematic of a lack of opportunities available on the Internet for persons with disabilities.

IncluYes is conceived as a space where persons with disabilities can access training, study, leisure, entertainment, sports and more in an easy and unified way. All in the same platform that seeks to position itself as a benchmark in Latin America. There will converge such rich and diverse opportunities as cooking classes for visually impaired people, equine therapy, adapted scuba diving, sign language interpreters, among many others.

This campaign will allow us to develop this accessible online platform where all kind of inclusive products and services will be offered. The website www.IncluYes.com will be 100% accessible for the visually impaired. Which means a lot since sadly currently the 90% of websites worldwide are not accessible.

It is time to make a change, you can help to create more and better opportunities for all contributing to this campaign. Do not look the other way, we need your help to make this idea a reality.

What we need and what you get

We need $ 5000 USD to develop a 100% accessible platform for the visually impaired.


The impact

15% of the population has some kind of disability. Your contribution will help us to have a positive impact on this vulnerable sector that today is excluded and does not find quality and customized opportunities.

Every contribution is very valuable to us, and to them.

Risks and challenges

We are a team formed by 10 young change agents with the same dream, and we work day by day to achieve it. We want to reach every person with disabilities in Latin America, so we need the support and commitment from the whole community. Without support, we will not be able to develop the platform and persons with disabilities will continue to be on the margins of society.

We will do everything to achieve the success of this campaign, because we believe in the project and we know the real impact this will have on all persons with disabilities.

Other ways you can help.

Everyone can help making a monetary contribution or sharing this campaign. Help us by spreading our proposal on your social networks.

Versión en Español

¡Hola! Somos Comparlante, una Fundación que busca mejorar la calidad de vida de las personas con discapacidad.

Desde 2015 un equipo de 10 jóvenes de 7 países distintos trabaja para hacer de este un mundo menos discapacitado. Nuestro primer objetivo fue desarrollar herramientas que acorten la brecha de acceso a la educación y a la información. Luego nuestro objetivo fue crear más y mejores oportunidades para las personas con discapacidad.

Creemos en que es posible crear un mundo mejor, entre todos y para todos. Hoy queremos presentarte IncluYes, una plataforma tipo marketplace donde las personas con discapacidad pueden acceder a servicios y productos a la medida de sus necesidades. Esta plataforma accesible surge al identificar como problemática la falta de oportunidades disponibles en internet para personas con discapacidad.

IncluYes fue pensado como un espacio donde las personas con discapacidad pueden acceder de manera fácil y unificada a oportunidades de capacitación, estudio, ocio, entretenimiento, deporte y más. Todo en una misma plataforma que busca posicionarse como referente a nivel latinoamericano. Allí convergerán oportunidades tan ricas y diversas como clases de cocina para personas con discapacidad visual, equinoterapia, buceo adaptado, interpretación en lengua de señas, entre muchas otras.

Esta campaña nos permitirá desarrollar la plataforma online accesible donde serán ofrecidos los productos y servicios. El sitio web www.IncluYes.com será 100% accesible para las personas con discapacidad visual.

Es momento de hacer un cambio, tu puedes ayudar a crear más y mejores oportunidades para las personas con discapacidad aportando a esta campaña. No mires para otro lado, necesitamos de tu ayuda para hacer de esta idea una realidad.

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

Necesitamos $5000 USD para poder desarrollar una plataforma 100% accesible para personas con discapacidad.

El impacto

El 15% de la población tiene alguna discapacidad. Tu aporte nos ayudará a impactar positivamente en este sector vulnerable que hoy por hoy está excluido y no encuentra oportunidades de calidad y a su medida.

Todo aporte es muy valioso para nosotros, y para ellos.

Riesgos y desafíos

Somos un equipo formado por 10 jóvenes emprendedores con un mismo sueño, trabajamos día a día para conseguirlo. Queremos llegar a cada persona con discapacidad en América Latina, necesitamos del apoyo y el compromiso de toda la comunidad. Sin apoyo no lograremos desarrollar la plataforma y las personas con discapacidad seguirán quedando en los márgenes de la sociedad.  

Vamos a hacer todo para lograr el éxito de esta campaña, porque creemos en el proyecto y sabemos el impacto real que esto tendrá en las personas con discapacidad.

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar.

Todos pueden ayudar: haciendo un aporte monetario o compartiendo esta campaña. Ayúdanos difundiendo nuestra propuesta en tus redes sociales.

Our first objective was to develop tools to shorten the access gap to education and information. Then our goal expanded to create more and better opportunities for persons with disabilities.We believe that it is possible to create a better world for all by working together, you and us!Today, we are pleased to introduce you IncluYes platform, an online marketplace where persons with disabilities can access services and products tailored to their preferences and needs. In short, it is like taking the best of Amazon and groupon turning it into a big buy & sell page accessible to everyone. The idea of this accessible platform came out when we identified the problematic of a lack of opportunities available on the Internet for persons with disabilities.IncluYes is conceived as a space where persons with disabilities can access training, study, leisure, entertainment, sports and more in an easy and unified way. All in the same platform that seeks to position itself as a benchmark in Latin America. There will converge such rich and diverse opportunities as cooking classes for visually impaired people, equine therapy, adapted scuba diving, sign language interpreters, among many others.This campaign will allow us to develop this accessible online platform where all kind of inclusive products and services will be offered. The website www.IncluYes.com will be 100% accessible for the visually impaired. Which means a lot since sadly currently the 90% of websites worldwide are not accessible.It is time to make a change, you can help to create more and better opportunities for all contributing to this campaign. story:
Bref résumé

Je m’appelle Nicolas Guillemot, je travaille comme évangéliste SEO pour l’agence de marketing numérique Dialekta. Je tiens à remercier tout particulièrement Cyril Chaib, Président de Dialekta, qui depuis le début de ma formation en Qigong médical, m’a toujours arrangé pour que je puisse assister à chacune des sessions de formation dans les meilleures dispositions.

Qu’est ce que ça fait un évangéliste SEO ?
Mon rôle est en fait d’apporter l’éducation sur l’expertise SEO (Search Engine Optimization), et le travail d’optimisation des sites web pour qu’ils puissent se positionner dans le top des résultats des moteurs de recherche comme Google. Je participe donc à des conférences, je fais des formations afin de faire rayonner l’expertise et l’agence Dialekta.

C’est un milieu passionnant, certes qui n’a rien à voir avec le Qigong, mais qui demande toujours d’apprendre et de tester des choses pour s’assurer que ce que l’on va faire comme travail d’optimisation pour un client, va porter ses fruits.

Un  lien avec le Qigong, c’est le fait que cela demande de faire un suivi une fois que l’on a mis en place un travail, pour s’assurer que celui-ci va porter ses résultats.

En parallèle à mon travail, j’ai commencé à me former au Qigong médical depuis janvier 2015, en commençant par la formation de Praticien en Qigong Médical (220h) avec le centre de Qigong Laflamme. Celui-ci organise des sessions de cours hebdomadaires de Qigong (rayonnement intérieur) et des formations en Qigong médical :  Praticien (MQP) / Thérapeute (MQT) / Maîtrise et Doctorat.

Aujourd’hui je suis en phase de validation de ma formation de praticien  (MQP). Avant de commencer la formation de Thérapeute en Qigong Médical (MQT) qui va débuter le 21 septembre 2018, j’ai 45h de traitements à faire.

Si vous souhaitez être “cobaye” pour un soin dans le cadre des heures qu’il me reste à faire pour valider ma formation, n’hésitez pas à me contacter.

Vous pouvez découvrir les 2 environnements qui me touchent :
Dialekta
Centre de Qigong Laflamme
 

 Ce dont j'ai besoin et ce que vous obtenez

 J'espère obtenir 5000$ pour pouvoir faire cette formation de Thérapeute en Qigong Médical.

Cette formation en Qigong Médical (300h) débute le 21 septembre prochain.
L'argent récolté permettra de m’aider à financer les modules de cours que je vais suivre et les stages cliniques qui permettront de valider mes acquis en tant que thérapeute en Qigong médical.

© 2018 Sean Laflamme, Qi Gong & Acupuncture

Cela me permettra ainsi de pouvoir proposer ensuite des soins en Qigong, mais également d’amener ma vision de la gestion des énergies au sein des entreprises.
J’entends par là se questionner sur comment l’humain est considéré dans les entreprises, et comment faire en sorte qu’il soit épanoui pour bien y jouer son rôle, et faire en sorte que celles-ci rayonnent dans leurs domaines respectifs et apportent des bénéfices à leur environnement, dans une vision plus globale.

© 2018 Sean Laflamme, Qi Gong & Acupuncture

J'ai pensé à des contreparties qui soient originales, et qui vous permettent de toucher un peu l'univers du Qigong. Vous pouvez les découvrir sur le côté droit de mon projet.

Si je ne récole pas la totalité du montant, j'utiliserai ce que j'ai pu obtenir pour financer ma formation. Les fonds récoltés serviront uniquement à ce projet qui touche au Qigong.

 L'impact

En soutenant mon projet et en faisant une contribution vous ferez la différence et me permettrez d'être utile aux autres :

  •  En inculquant par le Qigong les principes d'une vie plus saine et équilibrée.
  •  En permettant de pousser la philosophie du Qigong au sein des entreprises, afin que l'Humain y ait une place prédominante.

Dialekta, l'agence marketing où je travaille est le meilleur exemple que je puisse prendre, nous sommes ouverts à un bien-être des personnes qui travaillent, en proposant des massages sur chaise, de la méditation, et bientôt du Qigong !

 Risques et défis

 Après avoir fait le niveau précédent de cette formation (Praticien en Qigong Médical) je sais que c'est parfois compliqué de cumuler son travail et une formation en parallèle. Aujourd'hui je suis en mesure de réaliser cette nouvelle formation car :

  •  La passion pour le Qigong me permet d'avancer vers mon devenir.
  •  Cette pratique me permet de tendre vers ce que je suis, de cultiver mon authenticité et d'apporter autour de moi une énergie inspirante.

 D'autres façons d'aider

 Mon projet vous plait, mais ne vous pouvez y contribuer financièrement.
Vous pouvez malgré tout aider de cette manière :

  •  Passez le mot et de faites parler de mon projet autour de vous, à vos amis, collègues.
  •  Utilisez les outils de partage Indiegogo pour partager sur vos réseaux Facebook, Twitter, Linkedin !

Merci d'avance pour votre aide !

story:
First-of-its-kind free app promises to bring life-saving transparency and choice to the sober living industry.

My name is Brianna Nowlan and I am the founder and CEO of Taste Recovery. Early in my own recovery journey, having moved across the country to an unfamiliar city to seek treatment, I moved into a women's sober living and I saw firsthand what can happen when a sober living lacks oversight and accountability. Since that time, I have learned that what these women and I experienced was just the tip of the iceberg: practices like patient brokering, insurance fraud, bribery, and even letting residents continue using drugs are all too common in the sober living industry. So, after losing my first boyfriend to a drug overdose, I decided to do something to address the rampant abuse that has resulted from a lack of regulation and oversight of the sober living industry.

Since launching our service a few months ago, we have added hundreds of peer-reviewed sober living homes, and thousands of individuals in recovery visit our website or app every day to search our listings. We’re raising money so we can expand our operations with the goal of helping 50,000 people find safe, peer-reviewed sober living homes nationwide.

A nationwide crisis that needs a nationwide solution.

More than 15 million Americans are battling addiction and more than 2 million Americans seek recovery every year. And last year, more than 70,000 Americans died of drug overdoses. Lack of a stable, substance-free living environment can be a serious obstacle to sustained recovery; but, unfortunately, a lack of regulation, oversight, and transparency has resulted in widespread abuse in the sober housing industry.

We created Taste Recovery to provide a free, trusted resource for individuals in recovery. Taste Recovery is the Airbnb of sober living homes, and the platform makes it simple to find a safe, peer-reviewed sober living home within budget in cities and towns across the United States. Users can search listings, chat live with sober living managers, and even book tours all for free.  

Each sober living home listing includes photos and a description of the property and, most importantly, is peer-reviewed for quality and safety. Current and former residents of the home can share insights from their personal experiences, ensuring that prospective residents have trusted, reliable, unfiltered data on which to base their choice of sober living homes.

Our platform provides much-needed transparency and accountability in a sober living industry that is riddled with abuse. Finding a safe, affordable sober living home is a crucial part of sustaining long term recovery from drug and alcohol addiction, which is why Taste Recovery is a critical resource that thousands of people across the country desperately need.

How We’ll Use The Money.

We are raising money to expand our operations in 2021 into all 50 states with a goal of helping 50,000 people find sober living homes nationwide. Every dollar you contribute gets us one step closer to this goal by helping us fund:

  • Direct outreach to sober living homes to invite them to submit their listing
  • Logistical costs associated with peer-reviewing of sober living homes
  • Direct outreach to rehabs, IOPs, and other treatment facilities
  • General advertising and marketing costs to ensure individuals in recovery are aware of our free service
  • General operating costs associated with operating the service (e.g., Amazon AWS)
  • Continued engineering and development of our free app

In addition to the above, and to advance our objective of helping 50,000 people find sober living homes, we have partnered with The HART Foundation sober living scholarship fund. Founded in 2011, HART exists to break the cycle of addiction by filling in the funding gap between addiction and recovery. HART provides scholarships for drug and alcohol addiction treatment, sober living, and therapy for people seeking change.  

A portion of every dollar raised will be donated directly to this fund, to help ensure that anyone who wants to go to sober living can go to sober living, regardless of their ability to pay.

story:
Our Story

Nile’s Edge Healing Arts was located in the Seattle Central District, but was closed due to COVID-19. Nile’ Edge  is focused on de-colonizing health and wellness education so that under-served communities can holistically flourish. We do this by using African and Indigenous practices to heal mind, body, and spirit. During COVID-19 we lost our space, we lost our practitioners, and we lost our programming. However, we used the time off to recalibrate and figure out a way to serve our community more effectively. We gained perspective, we gained partnerships, and we gained property! Nile’s Edge is officially partnering with the historical landmark the Dr. James and Janie Washington Cultural Center, also known as The Washington House. Dr. James Washington Jr. was a world renowned painter and sculpture artist that rose in popularity to the likes of such artists as Jacob Lawrence. It is the only black owned registered historical landmark in the city of Seattle. In 1992, Dr. James Washington had the foresight to protect the decades of art he had created in his home studio by registering the home and all of its artifacts as a historical landmark to be used for the continued advancement of black people in Seattle. The mission of the  Washington House is to promote and preserve the art and legacy of James and Janie Washington Jr. to inspire creativity and build community. 

 

Wellness at the Washington House is a collaboration between Nile’s Edge Healing Arts and The Washington House to renovate the outdoor space for drum circles, outdoor film screenings, classes on herbalism and meditation, and private outdoor ceremonies and events. The Washingtons had a big beautiful garden, pond, and greenhouse that they used for teaching and entertaining that has not been maintained due to a lack of funds and issues with accessibility. Nile’s Edge would like to renovate their garden to its original glory with an additional focus on medicinal herbs and meditative spaces. We realized we could not thrive as an African centered space indoors! We needed a place to be in the grass and in the trees for more in depth healing work, especially during COVID-19  when being indoors is no longer a safe option.

Our Goal

We need $50,000 to turn this jungle into a gem. This budget includes the following:

  • Landscaping
  • Vintage greenhouse repair
  • Deteriorated shed demolition
  • Covered pavilion construction
  • Land and medicinal garden consultants
  • Project management fees
  • Plants
  • Furnishings

Every little bit that we raise will help us move forward on some part of the project, so please do not think that you do not have enough to give. A rosemary bush only cost $5. It is easily propagated, and can be used for skin conditions, mood disorders, and of course a delicious culinary spice. Now imagine a family coming to the garden to learn how to use, grow, and take care of rosemary at a Nile’s Edge program, then having the opportunity to take it home to continue to benefit from its uses for years to come. See what your $5 just did? Now imagine $20, $100, or $1000...

Our Plan

Marginalized communities are often left to fight each other over funding opportunities. Nile’s Edge’s partnership with the James and Janie Washington Cultural Center is our effort to join forces across organizations, missions, and generations of art and community activism. They have the space, we have the ideas, and you have the funds to help us build together.

In less than two years, Nile’s Edge has brought together practitioners and community members to heal individually and collectively. 

Some of our highlights include: 

  • Opening a Black, women-owned holistic health center in the historically Black neighborhood of the Central District.
  • Offering an incubator space for Black healers and practitioners to grow their practice.
  • Monday Night Mediation, where we introduce our community to various forms of mediation techniques. 
  • The Diaspora Series workshops; an online learning program that allowed Black people a space to learn history and health for and by Black teachers around the country.

Potential Difficulties

The James and Janie Cultural Center has been underutilized for many years. This means there are probably many hidden issues in the landscaping that we may not be aware of. Because of this we are including a land use analysis in the budget. Also, the money that we raise is just the beginning of a much larger goal of revitalizing this cultural center. We will use any funding that we raise over our $50,000 goal to begin upgrades and renovations in other parts of the property like the library, the creative studio, and the kitchen.

Other ways you can help!

There are plenty of moving parts to this project and we want you to jump in and help at whatever your comfort level is. Here is how:

  • Share this campaign across your social media platforms 
  • Record a video testimony of how Nile’s Edge has helped you on your holistic health journey and email it to us so that we can share it. 
  • Ask your place of employment if they offer matching funds and have them match us at $1,000, $5,000, or $10,000.
  • Donate medicinal plant seeds or starter plants 
  • Donate gardening tools and supplies
  • Sponsor a garden by pledging upkeep and maintenance for a year
  • Become a Nile’s Edge Spirit Member and donate $10-$100 a month
story_txt:
Our StoryNile’s Edge Healing Arts was located in the Seattle Central District, but was closed due to COVID-19. Nile’ Edge  is focused on de-colonizing health and wellness education so that under-served communities can holistically flourish. We do this by using African and Indigenous practices to heal mind, body, and spirit. During COVID-19 we lost our space, we lost our practitioners, and we lost our programming. However, we used the time off to recalibrate and figure out a way to serve our community more effectively. We gained perspective, we gained partnerships, and we gained property! Nile’s Edge is officially partnering with the historical landmark the Dr. James and Janie Washington Cultural Center, also known as The Washington House. Dr. James Washington Jr. was a world renowned painter and sculpture artist that rose in popularity to the likes of such artists as Jacob Lawrence. It is the only black owned registered historical landmark in the city of Seattle. In 1992, Dr. James Washington had the foresight to protect the decades of art he had created in his home studio by registering the home and all of its artifacts as a historical landmark to be used for the continued advancement of black people in Seattle. The mission of the  Washington House is to promote and preserve the art and legacy of James and Janie Washington Jr. to inspire creativity and build community.  Wellness at the Washington House is a collaboration between Nile’s Edge Healing Arts and The Washington House to renovate the outdoor space for drum circles, outdoor film screenings, classes on herbalism and meditation, and private outdoor ceremonies and events. The Washingtons had a big beautiful garden, pond, and greenhouse that they used for teaching and entertaining that has not been maintained due to a lack of funds and issues with accessibility. Nile’s Edge would like to renovate their garden to its original glory with an additional focus on medicinal herbs and meditative spaces. We realized we could not thrive as an African centered space indoors! We needed a place to be in the grass and in the trees for more in depth healing work, especially during COVID-19  when being indoors is no longer a safe option.Our GoalWe need $50,000 to turn this jungle into a gem. This budget includes the following:
Landscaping
Vintage greenhouse repair
Deteriorated shed demolition
Covered pavilion construction
Land and medicinal garden consultants
Project management fees
Plants
Furnishings
Every little bit that we raise will help us move forward on some part of the project, so please do not think that you do not have enough to give. A rosemary bush only cost $5. It is easily propagated, and can be used for skin conditions, mood disorders, and of course a delicious culinary spice. Now imagine a family coming to the garden to learn how to use, grow, and take care of rosemary at a Nile’s Edge program, then having the opportunity to take it home to continue to benefit from its uses for years to come. See what your $5 just did? Now imagine $20, $100, or $1000...Our PlanMarginalized communities are often left to fight each other over funding opportunities. Opening a Black, women-owned holistic health center in the historically Black neighborhood of the Central District.
Offering an incubator space for Black healers and practitioners to grow their practice.
Monday Night Mediation, where we introduce our community to various forms of mediation techniques. 
The Diaspora Series workshops; an online learning program that allowed Black people a space to learn history and health for and by Black teachers around the country.

Because of this we are including a land use analysis in the budget. Also, the money that we raise is just the beginning of a much larger goal of revitalizing this cultural center. We will use any funding that we raise over our $50,000 goal to begin upgrades and renovations in other parts of the property like the library, the creative studio, and the kitchen.Other ways you can help!There are plenty of moving parts to this project and we want you to jump in and help at whatever your comfort level is. story:
Family and friends! 

Thank you all so much for your support in our campaign! We appreciate you and your contributions. The Divinatrix Archetype Deck is on it’s way to you!

Now that the campaign is over, please visit us at our website divinatrix.world and on instagram @divinatrix_world.

 

 

The Divinatrix Archetype Deck

It’s been a long road. We’ve worked The Divinatrix Way and the way works. Now we’re ready to share it with you and your community. You can support us in launching Divinatrix by purchasing the archetype deck(s) and/or one of our other offerings, and by spreading the word. Please share!

 

CHECK OUT DIVINATRIX art and The Archetype Deck in the windows of abc carpet&home!!!

 

What is The Divinatrix Archetype Deck?

⚬ A provocative new system of self-inquiry

⚬ Like the Tarot, Divinatrix is a deck of guiding cards that help you disrupt your patterns and discover hidden aspects of yourself 

⚬ A tool to accept and integrate the light and shadow of 7 major feminine archetypal energies 

⚬ 7 archetypes, 42 cards, and 1 guide to exploring yourself and the dynamics in your life

The root 

Our friendship! A 30-year friendship that began on our first day of College. Playmates, soulmates, soul-sisters. 

The heart 

The love and trust we’ve shared over decades are truly the heart of this project. We witnessed, honored and mirrored countless aspects of each other without judgement. This support helped us to see ourselves more honestly and accept ourselves more deeply. Our mutual loving bluntness (that at times felt ruthless) was always tempered with unforgettable laughter and deep care. In gut-wrenching moments we reminded each other of our capacity to rise up from the ashes, and when one was seduced by an old destructive pattern the other would invite the one back down to earth and home to self. Together we learned to stay in vital circulation, spiraling toward more present, grounded, and fully expressed selves. 

The realization

Then our supernatural cocreative chemistry kicked in! We realized that we wanted to share the benefits of this experience with others...and so The Divinatrix Way was sparked.

The result 

Through radical trust and in the spirit of curiosity and commitment we developed a system using the light and shadow aspects of 7 major feminine archetypes: The Innocent, The Lover, The Huntress, The Mother, The Queen, The Sage, and The Mystic. The system inspires honesty and inquiry into your relationship with yourself and the world. Each archetype serves as a quintessential anchor to an essential part of you. 

The side note 

The archetypes are universal approximations of shared experiences and common projections. Our individual realities are highly nuanced and personal. We offer these archetypes as anchors from which to explore the subtleties of your unique lived experience. 

Our mission 

To make the unconscious conscious. We strive to serve and support others through the creation of meaningful tools and content that are accessible to anyone who’s curious.

Why are we raising money?

⚬  To cover printing costs for the first edition of The Divinatrix Archetype Deck

⚬  Any additional money will go toward building our website, a platform for sharing articles and information around the topics of empowerment, wellness, psychology, spirituality, creativity, philosophy, and social justice; a second round of printing; and the production of other Divinatrix goodies. 

Connect

⚬  Explore our website: divinatrix.world

⚬  Follow us on instagram: @divinatrix_world 

⚬  Find us in stores (April 2021): abchome.com

⚬  Email us to schedule a 1:1 reading or session: info@divinatix.world

We are so excited to be embarking on this next leg of the journey. To get here and be able to invite all of you to be part of The Divinatrix Way, we are eternally grateful to the people who have been instrumental to our process: Imogen for keeping it real, Maia for finding the right words, Tara for dotting the i's and crossing the t's, Dan for archetype play in the studio and first getting us online, Puritan Press for sharing our love and concern for the natural world as well as our pursuit of beauty. Wendy of Dear Hancock stationary for challenging us to do better and for sharing her printing and business prowess. Last but not least, infinite gratitude to the very talented Rosana, our Sage-Queen, for her art and design expertise that built the bridge with our printer and you.

Wendy of Dear Hancock stationary for challenging us to do better and for sharing her printing and business prowess. Last but not least, infinite gratitude to the very talented Rosana, our Sage-Queen, for her art and design expertise that built the bridge with our printer and you.

story:
Slipp is a sexual wellness company creating condoms for women-first. We deliver condoms discreetly to your door, so you can avoid the awkward trip to the condom aisle.

Through discussions about our personal struggles with birth control, we've realized that many women feel awkward buying condoms; don't carry condoms with them; and even feel uncomfortable enforcing the use of a condom.

We noticed that the condoms on the market focus primarily on male pleasure and don't address women's sexual health. 

Slipp condoms will be made with natural rubber latex and 100% silicone oil lubricant. We seek the best quality ingredients to avoid any irritants and to achieve vaginal comfort and health.

Our mission is to inspire women to feel comfortable buying, carrying, and using condoms in an effort to improve reproductive health. 

We're currently raising funds to help place our initial inventory order with our manufacturer, as well as to launch our e-commerce platform.  Our only current source of funding is the personal savings of our Founder.

Any contribution would be SO appreciated. 

This isn't just about condoms. We're building a community to encourage conversations about sexual health. Given the lack of proper sexual education many of us had growing up, it's no surprise that there is a lot of misinformation and stigma in the sexual health category. It is important to us to extend our mission to "get comfortable" by encouraging discussion around the way we talk about sex.

Some of the things we talk about:

 

Want to join the community?
Follow us on social media:

Instagram | Facebook | LinkedIn | Twitter

 

As an experienced advertising creative, Victoria believes in the power of brands to make a difference in the world. She founded Slipp in early 2021 with the mission of empowering women to feel comfortable buying, carrying, and using condoms. She credits the influence of her mom (a family physician and obstetrician & an advocate for women's health) and her dad (a Business PhD & educator) for inspiring her to pursue both health and business, all wrapped up in one package: Slipp. When she's not working in the ad world or building the business, she's probably out for a walk or tasting craft beers. 

 

Risks & Challenges

We have accurately demonstrated our project how it stands at this point in time, but we understand that no campaign comes without risks and challenges, and circumstances may be out of our control despite planning to our best abilities. Our team will communicate any setbacks as early as possible.

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this with someone you think it would resonate with!

Follow us on social media: 

Instagram | Facebook | LinkedIn | Twitter

Reach out with any questions at info@slipp.org

Or visit our website Slipp.org

story:
Please help us raise funds to support our Spiked Spin flagship studio now open in one of the most culturally iconic neighborhoods, Bed-Stuy, Brooklyn!

Since 2016 we have been adding our flavor to the bland boutique fitness industry, providing a wellness experience for those who Insult the Standard. Our mission is to improve the health narrative for underserved groups while diversifying the industry, but we need your help to do it! Join the Spiked movement and help us bring our flagship studio to life by donating now!

Why We Need Your Support

We're so close to providing the Spiked experience that our community deserves! We have the doors open, riders on bikes, and have received great feedback, but there are still a few details we need to have finalized in order to provide an even greater space for you! 

Please help us to raise $3,500 by the end of the year, with your help, WE CAN DO IT!!

Follow us on social @SpikedSpin to stay up to date on our growth!

T H A N K  Y O U ! ! !

story:
For those of you who don't know me or haven't experienced the work that I do here in Bristol, My name is Tristan and I run a healing practice called Snailspace Therapies in Easton that specialises in massage, energy healing and sound healing therapies. My goal has always been to provide an affordable, caring service to my community and hopefully bring about positive change to peoples lives through my work, whilst having a wonderful and fulfilling experience.

As a musician and audio engineer, I'm particularly passionate about sound, and combining my skills as a musician with my training as a healer has been a remarkable journey for me. Sound can be used to initiate amazing, positive transformation, and bringing this awareness, education and healing work into my community has become a huge part of my life over the past 2 years. I run drop in evening sound journeys from my home and I also run sound healing workshops which have now begun to expand into larger spaces with more people. 

SO ONTO GONGS... As my work expands, the equipment required to bring this work to larger audiences also needs to expand. So, for this reason I am looking to purchase a large gong for my healing practice, future workshops and community events. Gongs are by far the most incredible tools for healing I have ever discovered and for those of you lucky enough to have experienced a gong bath you'll understand exactly what I mean. For those of you that haven't, then this could be a great opportunity for you to experience something truly wondrous whilst contributing to my cause!

So as you may have guessed, gongs aren't cheap! So, in order to achieve this goal, I've started this fundraising project in the hope that willing contributors will want to experience the work that I do. I'm not simply asking for a handout (although any help is greatly appreciated!) My wish is to work very hard in exchange for the monetary contributions I receive by offering discounted treatment sessions, workshops and gong baths. I will also be offering donation based gong baths from our home studio in Easton twice a week.

The gong that I have chosen for my practice is the Meinl 36" Planetary Tuned Earth Gong as pictured below. I recommend having a listen to the Youtube clip to get a taste of it's amazing presence.

The breakdown of the costs are as follows:

Meinl Earth Gong - £1692.99

Paiste M6 Gong Mallet - £86.99

Harmony Wooden Gong Stand - £237.00

Total = £2016.98!!!

I thank you all in advance for helping me achieve my goal and I hope to hear from you soon to book in for a session or workshop!

(for more information on my work or for bookings - www.snailspacetherapies.com)
