story:
If you want to know what's in the MUMBOX before you read the story

Check out the reveal of what's in the MUMBOX video series 

Now on to the story...

Hi, I’m Rachel Maskell, founder of the #mumboss podcast, wife, sister, 5/2 manifestor, a child of the 80’s, a world traveler and mother. The mama thing is definitely the most demanding role I’ve ever had to play and one that I am learning how to embrace more each day. 

Like most mothers I’m often pulled in many directions at once and it’s hard to feel grounded and in touch with my own needs.

I often will go, go, go until the coffee runs out or a I simply crash.

And this, as we know, isn’t good for anyone!

How can I be there for my family, friends, and community if I can’t pick myself up off the ground?

I’ve been told the solution is self-care. To take plenty of ‘me’ time and eat well. 

Which all sounds great but also boring and difficult. Why should taking care of myself feel like work?

What I want is…

  • Clean products that make me feel beautiful
  • Activities that inspire my creativity
  • To play and have fun
  • To build a sisterhood 
  • Support in taking time for myself
  • And no extra work

It seems crazy even writing that out because in the past we would have to go away somewhere, or cobble together a bunch of different solutions, all of which feels like work. 

Till now…

The MUMBOX: your retreat delivered. 

It's a quarterly subscription box but more. It's not only filled with high-quality products, that I've personally selected, there are online resources like yoga and movement, guided meditations, journal exercises and more. To build the sisterhood and bring the tribe together we encourage the use of hashtags and social sharing. Plus there are tools to help you ask for the time and support you need to enjoy your MUMBOX. The best part...it gets delivered to your doorstep. 

No more over priced chocolates and flowers. This Mother's Day spread a little love and joy by purchasing a MUMBOX for yourself or a loved one.

PS...they're designed for mamas but there's plenty of goodies that every woman will love. 

 

So why the indiegogo campaign?

 

Although I have the contents of the first box mapped out I need your help.  (See below for what's in the box).

There are 200 boxes that will be available in time for Mother's Day. Every box purchased will go towards fulfillment and production of that box. This means even if the campaign is not fully funded, those who purchased a box, will get a box. 

Every dollar backed above $10,000 will go towards creating an enriching experience from start to finish. The online shop, content, and community will all benefit from your contribution. 

And because the MUMBOX isn't for everyone you can check out all the other cool perks available (updated throughout the campaign). You don't have to be a mother to make a statement that #mamasmatter.

 

What exactly is in the MUMBOX?

There are five main components of the MUMBOX. The welcome pack, self reflection, self realization, self actualization, and self expression. Each will be packaged with products, online and offline activities and tools to support you on your journey of self. 

Explore your MUMBOX.  Our initial theme: #mamalove includes...

Welcome pack:

Get started.
In the box:
Quarterly #mumboss zine, chocolate, Beauty Dust from Moon Juice and air plant.
On the web:
Creating sacred space.

View video on MUMBOX Welcome kit. 

Self- Reflection:

Pause, invite stillness. 
In the box:
Figs and feathers Farm bath soaks, simply curated travel candle, sage stick, and other goodies in a reusable bag. 
On the web: 
Heart opening meditation 

Video on Self Reflection Kit

Self Realization:

Receive insight, propel ahead. 
In the box: 
mantraband and gratitude journal with a le pen. 
On the web: 
Tunes and activities

 

Self Actualization:

Create ritual, be change. 
In the box: 
lotuswei love spray and Figs and Feathers Farm lip tints, plus other goodies in a reusable bag. 
On the web: 
heart opening yoga poses

 

Self Expression:

Celebrate life. Shine on.
In the box: 
tattly tattoos, DIY love notes, and more in a reusable bag. 
On the web: 
tunes and activities.

Plus:
Get supported with our prewritten letters and use #mumbox and #mumboss4life to connect with the tribe.
story_txt:
If you want to know what's in the MUMBOX before you read the storyCheck out the reveal of what's in the MUMBOX video series Now on to the story...Hi, I’m Rachel Maskell, founder of the #mumboss podcast, wife, sister, 5/2 manifestor, a child of the 80’s, a world traveler and mother. The mama thing is definitely the most demanding role I’ve ever had to play and one that I am learning how to embrace more each day. Like most mothers I’m often pulled in many directions at once and it’s hard to feel grounded and in touch with my own needs.I often will go, go, go until the coffee runs out or a I simply crash.And this, as we know, isn’t good for anyone!How can I be there for my family, friends, and community if I can’t pick myself up off the ground?I’ve been told the solution is self-care. To take plenty of ‘me’ time and eat well. Which all sounds great but also boring and difficult. Why should taking care of myself feel like work?What I want is…
Clean products that make me feel beautiful
Activities that inspire my creativity
To play and have fun
To build a sisterhood 
Support in taking time for myself
And no extra work
It seems crazy even writing that out because in the past we would have to go away somewhere, or cobble together a bunch of different solutions, all of which feels like work. Till now…The MUMBOX: your retreat delivered. It's a quarterly subscription box but more. It's not only filled with high-quality products, that I've personally selected, there are online resources like yoga and movement, guided meditations, journal exercises and more. To build the sisterhood and bring the tribe together we encourage the use of hashtags and social sharing. Plus there are tools to help you ask for the time and support you need to enjoy your MUMBOX. The best part...it gets delivered to your doorstep. No more over priced chocolates and flowers. This Mother's Day spread a little love and joy by purchasing a MUMBOX for yourself or a loved one. PS...they're designed for mamas but there's plenty of goodies that every woman will love.  So why the indiegogo campaign? Although I have the contents of the first box mapped out I need your help.  (See below for what's in the box).There are 200 boxes that will be available in time for Mother's Day. Every box purchased will go towards fulfillment and production of that box. This means even if the campaign is not fully funded, those who purchased a box, will get a box. Every dollar backed above $10,000 will go towards creating an enriching experience from start to finish. The online shop, content, and community will all benefit from your contribution. And because the MUMBOX isn't for everyone you can check out all the other cool perks available (updated throughout the campaign). You don't have to be a mother to make a statement that #mamasmatter. What exactly is in the MUMBOX?There are five main components of the MUMBOX. The welcome pack, self reflection, self realization, self actualization, and self expression. Each will be packaged with products, online and offline activities and tools to support you on your journey of self. Explore your MUMBOX.  Our initial theme: #mamalove includes...Welcome pack:Get started.In the box:Quarterly #mumboss zine, chocolate, Beauty Dust from Moon Juice and air plant.On the web:Creating sacred space.View video on MUMBOX Welcome kit. Self- Reflection:Pause, invite stillness. In the box:Figs and feathers Farm bath soaks, simply curated travel candle, sage stick, and other goodies in a reusable bag. On the web: Heart opening meditation Video on Self Reflection KitSelf Realization:Receive insight, propel ahead. In the box: mantraband and gratitude journal with a le pen. On the web: Tunes and activities Self Actualization:Create ritual, be change. In the box: lotuswei love spray and Figs and Feathers Farm lip tints, plus other goodies in a reusable bag. On the web: heart opening yoga poses Self Expression:Celebrate life. Shine on.In the box: tattly tattoos, DIY love notes, and more in a reusable bag. On the web: tunes and activities.Plus:Get supported with our prewritten letters and use #mumbox and #mumboss4life to connect with the tribe.

story:
I’m Mat Chandler, founder of The Float Center. A few years ago I found myself pursuing two masters degrees, working full-time directing the University of Florida’s Digital Fabrication Lab, and spearheading my first startup. I was at the brink of what I could physically and mentally handle and was in desperate need of some relief. I visited my first float center in Orlando and finally found the level of relaxation and rejuvenation I had been looking for. More clear, calm, creative, and energized than ever before, I was hooked, and knew I had to share this profound experience with the residents of North Florida.

Two years a year ago I founded Aurora Healing Arts Center, here in downtown Gainesville, FL. Among other traditions like yoga, meditation, dance and communication workshops, it has been my intention to offer the powerful healing tool of floating to this community, so others could have the opportunity to experience what I had, right here in our own city. Thus, The Float Center was born and is now coming to you through this campaign.

 

A rendering from street-view of the soon-to-be, modern and stylish Float Center.

 

What Is Floating?

Imagine relaxing in your own, private ocean. The floating experience is a sound and light proof tub filled with over 800 pounds of Epsom salts dissolved in a shallow pool of water, heated to your skin’s temperature. Without any sensory information for your brain to process, your parasympathetic nervous system activates, promoting healing, increased learning capacity and the ultimate in relaxation. There’s nothing like it on earth.

 

By backing this campaign you will help make history by building the very first float center in Gainesville. You will help build a revolutionary healing space where people can come to rest, relax and rejuvenate, on a cellular level.

 

The magnitude of what your contributions will help achieve for our community might be hard to conceive, but to get a hint, just take a look at the list above and see some of the many benefits of floating for the body, mind and spirit.

 

 

Maybe you’ve heard of the New England Patriots... Did they just won the superbowl or something? Well, the whole team floats and Tom Brady even has his own float tank in his house.

Familiar with Steph Curry? He and his entire team go floating on a bi-weekly basis because of the power it gives them on the court. Click Here for an ESPN Interview with Curry

 

In this powerful testimonial, UFC commentator and Mr. Fear Factor, Joe Rogan, discusses floating and how it is the single most important tool for developing the mind.

 

What We Need

We need $108,000 to build The Float Center, a state-of-the-art float facility in which to provide you with the most optimal experience possible. Utilizing repurposed shipping containers and being fully solar-powered; the center will be as sustainable as it is beautiful. Your money will go towards the costs of construction, 2 state-of-the-art float pods, a deck below to hang out before and after floats, and a café for refreshments.

 

An X-ray view into the Float Center. Lobby on the left and the two float rooms and pods on the right.

 

The above image shows the organization of the different programmatic elements                occurring within The Float Center / Aurora spaces.

 

The Float Center will be centrally located in the heart of downtown Gainesville, next to the Sun Center and the Hippodrome, and just a mile from the University of Florida and Shands.

 

The Perks

In exchange for your contribution, you will be pre-purchasing floats and giving yourself the gift of ultimate relaxation, heightened learning capacity and increased physical healing. You’ll be the first to experience The Float Center when its doors open this Fall.

 

In addition to your floats, we are offering limited edition Fracture™ glass prints by visionary artist, Miles Toland. A Fracture™, which is a high definition printing directly onto glass, is some of the best quality printing in the world, resulting in the most vivid colors and depth for this dreamy float artwork. You'll be proud to hang this on your wall.

 

As another beautiful perk for your backing this project, we are offering these unique wooden necklaces, (created by lasers!) engraved with your name and The Float Center motto, "Experience Nothing. Be Everything."

 

Community Impact

How do we see The Float Center impacting our community? Well, we feel the benefits of floating are numerous, if not endless. As you may have seen in the campaign video testimonials, people are touched by their float experiences in so many ways. We feel that this modern-day healing modality meets just about everyone, right where they are at. Be it a business person, a medical professional, a meditator, or perhaps someone with bodily disabilities; the benefits that floating provides you and your self-care of mind, body and spirit are profound. We want to have this available to everyone in Gainesville to heal, grow and explore themselves further. In the video below, you'll see one example of a world-renowned business leader from Gainesville and how float therapy has changed his life.

In this short testimonial, Top 100 Business Thought Leader in America - John Spence, describes his own personal experience of floating and why he can't wait for The Float Center to exist in Gainesville, FL.
Direct Impact in the Community: Giving back is at the core of what we do. We have formed a partnership with the Alachua Conservation Trust and a portion of all proceeds that The Float Center brings in will go towards supporting them and all of their affiliate organizations in which they provide assistance.
 

Timeline

 

Challenges

We may face some challenges along the way, we realize this. It probably wouldn't be a project worth pursuing if it was "easy." The following are issues we may face and how we plan to minimize and overcome them if they arise.

Risk 1: Construction. Coming in behind schedule and over budget. Building The Float Center from the ground up, brings in variable factors of time and money into the equation.

Mat Chandler and architect Stephen Bender meet to discuss plans for the upcoming float center.

Plan 1.1: Expertise. We have partnered with local architect Stephen Bender, who specializes in shipping container architecture, to mitigate the possible risks of running out of money before the project is complete or taking much longer than the 6-8 month timeline we have proposed to opening our doors this fall. You can see the project on the BNDR Architecture website here: http://www.bndrd.com/about-bndr-llc/in-the-news-media/the-float-center-in-gainesville/

Mat Chandler, founder of The Float Center, also has a Masters Degree in Architecture and much of the necessary skill to manage this construction of this project from on the inside, as well.

Plan 1.2: Foresight. We have met with the City of Gainesville in a 1st Step meeting to foresee any other issues that may arise and were pleasantly surprised that there is nothing that would prevent this project from coming to fruition that they can see currently.

Plan 1.3: Outside capital. In addition to the proper planning, and thus the budget we have set out accordingly, we are prepared to make up the difference if unforeseen circumstances arise and drive the cost up past the budget. Through outside capital such as a bank loan or an investor, we will be able to complete the project and bring The Float Center to fruition and provide you with the floats you've paid for and we promised.

 

Lastly, and most importantly, if any other obstacle arise, we have a team that is here working hard for you and to make The Float Center a reality. We are confident that with determination, careful consideration and a result-oriented mindset as we move forward, we can overcome any obstacle that shows up in our path and proceed to success in bringing floating to Gainesville, FL.

 

What happens if we don't meet the goal?

We are prepared to move forward with additional funding options, such as outside investors and bank loans. We are determined to bring floating to the Gainesville community and continue to take care of use all through this healing medium. Lastly, if for some reason we were not able to complete this project and do not begin any major portions such as construction to where the funds will have gone to, we will refund your money. 

 

What Should You Do Now?

Back the campaign now. What are you waiting for? Find which perk sounds good to you, and click that little button to get going, and help make history by bringing the coolest thing to Gainesville since the Hippodrome!

Then, please share with your friends by word of mouth and by using the Indiegogo share tools! This is how we can make this happen and all get to benefit from having this exciting tool at our fingertips, by spreading the word and crowdfunding it into being.

Lastly, visit www.FloatGNV.com to see the site we have begun building out to relay all the benefits and more to you. You can also find out more about our Business-To-Business Packages orchestrated to take good care of you, your team and even your clients.

 

Thanks.

The team at The Float Center offers you much thanks and gratitude for your support thus far, and for the future. Had the overwhelmingly positive response from the community not been there far before this campaign began, we wouldn't have made it this far, this joyfully. Thank you and we look forward to floating with you soon.

Experience nothing. Be everything.

Best wishes,

The Float Center Team

www.FloatGNV.com

story:
The Butterfly Boxes of Ottawa-Gatineau are:

  • The first-of-their-kind in our region
  • Packed with thoughtful items and local non faith-based resources to support grieving families
  • A tool to grow awareness and bust stigma surrounding pregnancy and infant loss in our community through a card-writing and storytelling project
  • Free of cost for bereaved families
     

It takes a community: We need your help 
We are deeply grateful for the support of the community for Ottawa-Gatineau Butterfly Box. Beyond the generous startup grant from JustChange Ottawa, this initiative relies entirely on volunteer time and community donations to ensure families have access to this resource in their time of grief.
The need is great. Since launching two short weeks ago many of boxes in our pilot run are already claimed. We never want to have to turn away a family from this resource.


What's in the Ottawa-Gatineau Butterfly Box?
Each box is packed with carefully selected items chosen by families who have experienced pregnancy and infant loss first-hand:

  • Kleenex
  • Journal
  • Forget-me-not seeds to plant a memorial garden
  • Lavender soy candle (locally crafted)
  • Lavender bath bomb (locally crafted)
  • A snack
  • Bereavement reading list 
  • Listing of local resources for bereaved families
  • A pre-stamped postcard for families to share an aspect of their loss with communtiy (optional, to be displayed in public awareness-raising project October, 2018)
  • A card of condolence written by a fellow member of the community

How will the funds be spent?  
Each box costs 20CAD to source and assemble. We will allocate 95% of funds to directly develop and distribute more boxes to bereaved families. The remaining 5% of donations will be used to fund communications, expanding our web presence and an exploration of how to bring these boxes to other regions (requests from across Canada are rolling in!). 100% of every donation will go towards these two efforts which are entirely volunteer-led. Every donor, no matter how big or small will be asked to send a personal message of condolence to be hand-written in the sympathy card included in every box. 

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!!

story:
G3 Delivery's WHY? 

We have a problem!!! It is super easy to eat fast food and almost impossible to eat fresh food. 

  • Because of this problem we have widespread hunger and obesity. 
  • As of today, it can be very difficult to find fresh food at grocery stores and local markets.
  • And even if that food looks fresh, most of it comes from non-organic mono cultures some of which can even use GMOs, colors, and preservatives in order for the produce to maintain the same "good looking" color and shape even after several days. 

That's why we want to create G3 Delivery, an efficient and convenient way to have fresh produce delivered to your doorstep quick as a click.

How It Works 

So we are sure you are curious to how such an amazing service works so here it is, 

  1. First thing's first.
    • It all starts with you. You order a G3 Delivery Fresh food baggy on Indiegogo, The G3 Delivery Website or G3 Delivery App (coming soon). 
  2. Second thing's second 
    • We receive your order and a G3 Delivery Man (or Woman, how about we just call them a person) arranges your fresh food from our local G3 farm into a G3 Delivery Baggy! 
  3. Third thing's thirds 
    • Then they drive it to your door and Ding Dong fresh food from G3 Delivery.

 

Bag4Bag

Our goal is to help anybody get fresh food delivered at their doorstep, that includes also all of those families who don't have the resources to afford to buy fresh food. That's why we're launching a revolutionary program called Bag4Bag. Through this program, for every bag that is ordered through our website or app, another bag full of food will be donated to a family in need. Automatically! So as soon as you purchase your bag of food to cook your dinner, you've already helped another family have access to a meal for the night. When are you enacting Bag4Bag? The answer is RIGHT NOW! For every bag you buy through our Indiegogo perks, another bag will be donated and you will receive a picture with the family you helped as proof.

And There you have it, Easy as One, Two, Three! While you are delivered your food, a family in need is too! 

 

What we Need and what You'll Get!

In order to help you we need your help:

  • In exchange for your donation and precious help, you will get rewards that range from an electronic thank you, to G3 Fresh Food Baggies, which all come with an FREE G3 City launch party ticket (this will include your favorite fresh food, hand picked by you and prepared into a delicious. Once we are all fueled up there will be a DJ to allow us to have a dance party to your favorite song). 
  • With your donations we need to create an e-commerce website that will allow customers to buy directly from local farms (~$100), Hire a developer to create a highly efficient mobile app ($800), Hire our first delivering man and pay all the taxes and fees required to start a non-profit ($1200)
  • If we don't hit our goal we're still going to use all the funding received to give everybody's perks

The Impact

The G3 Community is a movement of people that are focused on creating a better future

  • We're first going to start providing fresh food to the whole Denver metro area. With that, we are working with farms to make sure you get the fresh food dropped off at your door fast!
  • The plan is to expand the service to every major city in the US and eventually in the world.
  • This project can improve people's lives on an ever-increasing scale and even revolutionize the food market by changing the whole fresh food philosophy.

Risks & Challenges

We know the path to success will have many obstacles along the way, some of which are:

  • Create The G3 City 
    • To overcome this we will keep work with big companies like Arrow and closely analyze every mistake along the way to learn as much as possible from them.
  • Distributing the food in a cost-effective and timely manner
    • We will overcome this by becoming the direct distributor, rather than relying on a third party shipping company and we are expand to controlling the whole process from seed to door! 
  • Competitors and copycats
    • To overcome this, innovation is key. Things like using self-driving Tesla cars to cut distribution costs is on the list... 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have the financial resources to donate, don't worry! There are many ways you can still help our cause, here are a few easy ones:

  • Follow us on social media
  • Share this campaign on your social media account: Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Snapchat, and Pinterest... those are all great!
  • If you know a local farmer in the Denver area who would like to participate write us an email at info@ghostprint.bio with the farmer's contact details so that even more people can access fresh food.
  • Check out our companies websites,  http://www.ghostprint.bio 
  • Check out our services website, http://g3delivery.com

So we are sure you are curious to how such an amazing service works so here it is, 

First thing's first.It all starts with you. You order a G3 Delivery Fresh food baggy on Indiegogo, The G3 Delivery Website or G3 Delivery App (coming soon). 

Second thing's second We receive your order and a G3 Delivery Man (or Woman, how about we just call them a person) arranges your fresh food from our local G3 farm into a G3 Delivery Baggy! 

Third thing's thirds Then they drive it to your door and Ding Dong fresh food from G3 Delivery.


 
Bag4Bag
Our goal is to help anybody get fresh food delivered at their doorstep, that includes also all of those families who don't have the resources to afford to buy fresh food. That's why we're launching a revolutionary program called Bag4Bag. Through this program, for every bag that is ordered through our website or app, another bag full of food will be donated to a family in need. Automatically! So as soon as you purchase your bag of food to cook your dinner, you've already helped another family have access to a meal for the night. When are you enacting Bag4Bag? The answer is RIGHT NOW! For every bag you buy through our Indiegogo perks, another bag will be donated and you will receive a picture with the family you helped as proof.
And There you have it, Easy as One, Two, Three! While you are delivered your food, a family in need is too! 

 

What we Need and what You'll Get!
In order to help you we need your help:

In exchange for your donation and precious help, you will get rewards that range from an electronic thank you, to G3 Fresh Food Baggies, which all come with an FREE G3 City launch party ticket (this will include your favorite fresh food, hand picked by you and prepared into a delicious. Once we are all fueled up there will be a DJ to allow us to have a dance party to your favorite song). 
With your donations we need to create an e-commerce website that will allow customers to buy directly from local farms (~$100), Hire a developer to create a highly efficient mobile app ($800), Hire our first delivering man and pay all the taxes and fees required to start a non-profit ($1200)
If we don't hit our goal we're still going to use all the funding received to give everybody's perks


The Impact
The G3 Community is a movement of people that are focused on creating a better future

We're first going to start providing fresh food to the whole Denver metro area. With that, we are working with farms to make sure you get the fresh food dropped off at your door fast!
The plan is to expand the service to every major city in the US and eventually in the world.
This project can improve people's lives on an ever-increasing scale and even revolutionize the food market by changing the whole fresh food philosophy.


Risks & Challenges
We know the path to success will have many obstacles along the way, some of which are:

Create The G3 City To overcome this we will keep work with big companies like Arrow and closely analyze every mistake along the way to learn as much as possible from them.

Distributing the food in a cost-effective and timely mannerWe will overcome this by becoming the direct distributor, rather than relying on a third party shipping company and we are expand to controlling the whole process from seed to door! 

Competitors and copycatsTo overcome this, innovation is key. Things like using self-driving Tesla cars to cut distribution costs is on the list... 



Other Ways You Can Help
If you don't have the financial resources to donate, don't worry! There are many ways you can still help our cause, here are a few easy ones:

Follow us on social media
Share this campaign on your social media account: Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Snapchat, and Pinterest... those are all great!
If you know a local farmer in the Denver area who would like to participate write us an email at info@ghostprint.bio with the farmer's contact details so that even more people can access fresh food.
Check out our companies websites,  http://www.ghostprint.bio 
Check out our services website, http://g3delivery.com

story:
Introducing Heirloom Superfood Market

Heirloom is an organic superfood marketplace; a collaborative effort by like-minded entrepreneurs dedicated to living responsibly clean and sustainable lifestyles. Heirloom is also a platform to help local products and services become more accessible to the community. The objective of Heirloom is to foster community health, making healthy lifestyles accessible and fun.

  • In the superfood market, visitors can purchase organic produce, bulk ingredients, local brands and conscientiously prepared meals.
  • Heirloom will host holistic wellness workshops, connecting people with speakers and practitioners naturopathic medicine and the healing arts in areas such as acupuncture, reiki, yoga and sound therapy.
  • Heirloom serves as a supportive think tank and business incubator for health-minded local entrepreneurs who share the values of purity, simplicity and integrity.
  • The founders of Heirloom support youth education and will expose our youth to the benefits of an organically fueled diet. They will have hands on learning experiences on balanced nutrition including juicing, superfoods and cooking techniques.

 

More about the businesses involved

 

The Pittsburgh Juice Company

When the Pittsburgh Juice Company (PJC) launched its flagship organic juicery in Lawrenceville in 2014, one of the goals was to make organic produce and superfoods more accessible to the surrounding neighborhoods. Four years later, Heirloom Superfood Market represents this goal coming to fruition... and so much more!

Over the years PJC has formed alliances with many admirable health-focused food businesses. We are all driven by the same passion for creating nourishing food from wholesome, organic ingredients. By working together we share resources, knowledge and expertise, while also building a strong community.

 

Pure Grub

Pure grub uses only sustainable, regionally sourced, naturally grown and organic ingredients to provide the community with foods devoid of inflammatory agents and opioids. All products are also free of gluten, dairy and processed sugar. With a small research team comprised of alumni of the National University of Natural Medicine, Pure Grub creates meals that replenish and balance the body by using the appropriate amounts of fat, fiber, protein and macronutrients.

 

Frontier Cultures

Frontier Cultures produces raw vinegar infusions that aim to bolster the body's immune system and improve digestive health. Their signature Master Tonic offers a fiery blend of roots and peppers that promote the growth of beneficial gut flora, aid in circulation, and fight against colds and flus. The infusion can especially benefit individuals who struggle with gluten issues, IBS, "leaky gut," or other stomach sensitivities.  Each small batch is made by infusing raw organic apple cider vinegar with raw and organic horseradish root, ginger root, onion, garlic, turmeric root, jalapeno, habanero, rosemary, and grapefruit zest over the course of several weeks.

 

Fickle Fox Fermented Foods

Fickle Fox Fermented Foods was born of a desire to help people thrive on their health journey while still being able to indulge in something delicious. They believe good food is something that should bring people together regardless of dietary choices. Fickle Fox uses all organic and minimally processed ingredients and they get creative with the method. The results are unique batches of dairy free and grain free cashew based "yogurt" in foxy flavors like Blueberry Cardamom, Raspberry with Chocolate Ganache, and Coconut Banana Caramel Chip.

 

What We Need to Make Heirloom a Reality

Heirloom Superfood Market already has a secure physical presence at The Pittsburgh Juice Company’s commissary on the corner of 31st Street and Penn Avenue.  The space was formerly a rock and roll pub now undergoing a transformation into a bright health food haven.  All proceeds raised throughout the campaign will help to expedite the improvements necessary to open Heirloom’s doors and make whole, organic foods, produce and hard to find items available in the Strip District every day.  Funds will be put toward the following improvements:

  • Plumbing: hand sink, 3 bowl sink, mop sink
  • Storefront Remodel on Penn Ave and 31st Street
  • Interior Paint
  • Lighting Improvements
  • Shelving
  • Inventory

 

The Impact

Lawrenceville and the Upper Strip District and surrounding neighborhoods are often referred to as food deserts, where residents are forced to either

  • leave their neighborhoods to buy groceries
  • grocery shop at convenience stores
  • rely upon fast food or restaurant food

According to the US Department of Agriculture, people who live in food deserts have a higher rate of obesity, diabetes, and other food-related diseases than those who have easy and ready access to abundant food.  While the Central Strip District offers a variety of bulk ethnic foods, an organic health food market is something that does not exist anywhere in the surrounding area.  Because The Pittsburgh Juice Company already keeps an array of bulk superfoods and produce in stock for their own ingredients, Heirloom Superfood Market is a logical step in their business development and also toward neighborhood vitality.

 

Pioneers of the Upper Strip District

Heirloom Superfood Market is located in the middle of two booming neighborhoods: Lawrenceville and the Central Strip District, with easy access to Route 28 from the 31st Street Bridge.  By activating the 31st Street corridor we will be taking a step toward joining these neighborhoods.  When the Pittsburgh Juice Company opened four years ago (three blocks from Heirloom) Lower Lawrenceville was experiencing a similar shift toward become more densely populated and pedestrian friendly.  With Heirloom we are excited to provide another anchor in the growth and development of this thriving neighborhood.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute at the moment? That's okay! We would appreciate it if you would spread the word about what we're up to and follow our progress on social media.  In the meantime, keep an eye on our events schedule.  We hope to see you soon at Heirloom!

story:
Moving to Canada is something that arises after almost every US presidential election. However for me personally I have been striving toward this goal for nearly three years. Unfortunately I have had several setbacks in the form of seven surgeries or surgical procedures in the last two years. This has forced me to miss work and incur several thousands of dollars in medical expenses, I feel I'm now back on track to resume working toward my goal with tenacity. 

I was born in Newfoundland, Canada 41 years ago. I was adopted by an American service member as an infant and raised on military bases until age 16. We moved to the States and I've lived here since. As many Americans these days, I'm part of the working poor. A recent report stated middle and lower class people fair better in Canada than the U.S. This is a new development but my desire to permanently return to my country of origin is not. I've always thought I'd move back to Canada to retire but a few years ago a visit moved my return to the forefront of my thoughts. I'm still relatively young and employable and I want to take advantage while I'm still both.

With your help my repatriation will be possible. I will be saving money in earnest, however I'm unlikely to save enough to make a comfortably smooth transition. Did you know it costs 500 dollars to import and export a vehicle across the US/Canada border?  The car also must be cleaned and detailed to an extreme degree to avoid bringing in any contaminants. 

There are also the obvious apartment down payments and first months rent, plus travel and other miscellaneous expenses associated with relocating ones life to another country. I have acquired my Canadian passport which was my final hurdle in my preparation to return. I still need to find a job and a residence but I'll spend the next half year locating those.

I will be be moving 2,000-3,000 miles from where I've lived for the last 25 plus years. This means I'll be giving away most of my possessions and the best ones will be offered up here as perks for contributing to this campaign.

Thank you for reading this and any help is welcome,

Phil

story:
Who we are:

Siha Collins, the creator of Yellow Mat Yoga, is a multi-hyphenate teacher, speaker, and creative business consultant who uses the principles of yoga and meditation to show how positive, effective, and sustainable practice transforms lives and relationships. Her personal transformation started more than ten years ago on a sunny Yellow Mat, and in 2015 she left her advertising career to pursue teaching full-time. Siha believes that in order to live lives filled with love and joy, we must ask ourselves the question, "Who do I want to be?", and then move closer to that truth.

Calling on her colorful background in marketing and events, coaching and athletics, and community engagement, Siha finds and creates spaces for people to move and be moved.

 

Yellow Mat's Manifesto + Mission

Manifesto

We believe in the power of yoga
and we believe in the goodness of people.

We are so certain that yoga works that we will open
our doors freely to all who make their way, regardless of
age, race, color, creed, religion, sexual orientation, 
gender identity, citizenship, or physical and mental ability.

We believe that yoga should be available to all of the people,
regardless of cultural, political, or economic differences.

We believe that yoga unifies communities 
and it is through the acceptance of all people that we can be 
an example of real change.

We believe that your clothes don't make you better, 
neither does your car or your job, 

But the simple act of showing up completely 
in a place of acceptance makes your 
humanity shine brilliantly. 

MISSION

Yellow Mat Yoga will empower radical personal and social change by supporting the physical, mental, emotional, and energetic well-being and well-doing of every breathing human.

All of them.

What We Need & What You Get

Yellow Mat Yoga does not seek to be a business, but must pursue business activities in order to provide the resources necessary to share the practice of yoga. We pay to rent and maintain a beautiful, safe space, we compensate our teachers for their time and expertise, and we provide support to the causes that affect our community and resonate with our mission.

We do believe yoga should be as affordable as possible. So we call on you, our loved ones, to give generously and strive to ease the financial burden to those often need yoga the most.

All funds raised during this campaign will go towards building the studio infrastructure and establishing an inclusive yoga community.

To sustain our work, we intend to function as a multi-purpose space: Special Events, Retreats, Workshops, Community Gatherings will be an important part of the studio.

We will operate as a membership-based studio, so we can use the power of collective economics to offer free- and low-cost classes, as well as studio scholarships to ease the financial burden for students in need. As with any small business, there are several start-up costs associated with opening. We have already invested substantial funds into the prep and build out of the space.  With your support, we will be able to hit the ground running with a full schedule of classes, teachers, and opportunities for community fellowship and growth.

YELLOW MATS – of course! While students are welcome to practice on any mat they choose, we provide yellow mats for members and to host community classes within and outside the studio. Our gently used mats are gifted to students who wish to continue their home practice.

PROPS - As we strive to be an inclusive yoga community, a variety of props such as blocks, blankets, wedges, bolsters will help students enjoy an accessible practice, regardless of ability or previous experience.

TECH/ADMIN SUPPORT - to run a smooth and efficient studio, we’re taken care to source great class management software and technology resources.

GENERAL OUTDOOR MAINTENENCE - we have beautiful outdoor area that we plan to open to the community in the spring. We need help beautifying the space with lights and greenery.

We will also have a small retail section for props, yoga-wear, and books to support your yoga studies and home practice.

None of these aspects on their own is cheap, but taken together they become truly costly.  

The goal of Yellow Mat Yoga is to become an efficient, generous, self-sustaining entity. We ask for your love and support on this journey.

Here's how you can help:

Choose Your Perk

We're offering a wide variety of perks so you can try out the studio and see the exciting programming Yellow Mat is planning for 2018. With the holidays right around the corner, it's also the perfect time to give the gift of yoga to your family + friends, or #BeCommited to deepening your own yoga practice. 

Share with Friends

Whether or not you've made your way to a Yellow Mat yet, you can tap into your network of family and friends to share our story. Please share this campaign on social media to let other potential students know about YMY! Just click on the links at the upper right corner to share on Facebook and other sites.

Be Kind. Be Connected. Be Couraegous. Be Powerful. Be Moved.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Tracey Jewel, and together with Wellstrong Collective we are raising funds to develop a mental health support app for Women.

Personally, I’d never experienced anxiety or mental health challenges before appearing on the Reality TV program Married At First Sight last year but a combination of factors led to me battling terrible anxiety. After a year of therapies I have found many tools and skills that help me overcome my anxiety.

Through this journey I have realised how isolating and debilitating mental health can be.

Which is why I became an accredited Mental Health First Aid instructor and completing a diploma of mental health.

Together with Wellstrong Collectives beautiful range of Wellness products, I’m extremely passionate about creating an app to assist women and their mental well-being through four key areas focusing on happiness, energy, sleep and mindfulness.

Mental health apps can be effective in making therapy more accessible, efficient, and portable.

With your help and donations through purchasing our inspiring new range of wellness products and our experts who are assisting us developing this Wellshop app, we can help the 1 in 6 Women who will experience Depression and 1 in 3 Women who will experience Anxiety in their lifetime.

Donate to one of the following perk packages below to receive some beautiful products, Wellness Workshop services and all contributions get to access the app upon completion too!

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is raise $10,000 which will ensure we can develop this App and be able to gift the base level for free to users!

The product + service perks are donated by Wellstrong Collective at below cost so 90% of the money raised goes towards app development and free base level usability.

If we don't reach our goal? We will be creating a less cost website resource to assist Women's Mental Health instead of an app.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Everyone knows someone that's struggled with Mental Health. If you can't donate, please spread the word and share this with loved ones

Questions? Email hello@wellstrongcollective.com.au

story:
For years, Texas NORML and Texans for Responsible Marijuana Policy have been working to give patients access to medical marijuana in Texas and reduce penalties for low-level possession.

A Window of Opportunity This Spring

Right now, we have strong bipartisan support for reform in the Texas Legislature and a record setting number of bills have been introduced for consideration. There’s a very small window to make this happen before the session ends in May.

Let’s Get These Laws Across the Finish Line in 2019!
 
We’ve heard from thousands of Texas veterans, people with cancer or chronic pain, and other debilitating medical conditions who are suffering.  

And, chances are, you know many, too. It’s just wrong that families have to travel out of state to find relief through medical marijuana. It’s time to give Texans medical freedom without having to uproot their families.  And we are very close to making this a reality in this current legislative session, which ends May 27th.

Your Donations Will Work Hard to Get These Laws Passed

Your donation will be split between Texas NORML and Texans for Responsible Marijuana Policy. These two groups are led by well-known and respected advocates for individual liberty, and personal responsibility around marijuana laws in Texas. Jax Finkel is the Executive Director of Texas NORML and has been involved in cannabis law reform since 2005.  Heather Fazio leads Texans for Responsible Marijuana Policy and has worked in this arena for ten years.  Both are familiar faces at the Capitol who have worked tirelessly to inform and build coalitions with our Texas lawmakers to create fair and compassionate marijuana laws.

These two groups collaborate closely with others that span the political spectrum, but share a value of freedom for Texans to get fair and compassionate marijuana legislation passed.

These include the Tenth Amendment Center, Texans for Accountable Government, Texas Young Republicans, Texas Criminal Justice Coalition, Students for Sensible Drug Policy, Students for Liberty, the Republican Liberty Caucus of Texas, Republicans Against Marijuana Prohibition, the Reason Foundation, Progress Texas, the Marijuana Policy Project, the Libertarian Party of Texas, Libertarian Christians, Law Enforcement Action Partnership, Clergy for a New Drug Policy, the Austin Justice Coalition and ACLU Texas.

Your donation ensures we can deliver these critical action items for this current session:

• Lobbying of state legislators, regulatory agencies & community leaders

• Effective grassroots mobilization & coalition building

•  Education and media outreach 


Why Access to Medical Marijuana is So Crucial

Medical marijuana often relieves chronic pain and increases the quality of life for people with PTSD, cancer, autism and other debilitating conditions without harmful side effects.             
Too many patients are needlessly suffering.

Additionally, in states where access to medical marijuana is legal, opioid deaths have declined by 20% the first year following approval. Solid proof that access to medical marijuana is saving lives. 

It’s time to make a change in our law so Texans have safe and legal access to medical marijuana!

Thank YOU

Thank you for making Texas a more compassionate place. And thank you for supporting this work and helping us get this legislation passed. With your donation, we will make Texas a more compassionate place to call home.


Big THANKS to Jason Rink and Keith Wahrer with Dig Deep Films and Shaun McAlister with iamshaun.com!
story_txt:
For years, Texas NORML and Texans for Responsible Marijuana Policy have been working to give patients access to medical marijuana in Texas and reduce penalties for low-level possession.
A Window of Opportunity This Spring
Right now, we have strong bipartisan support for reform in the Texas Legislature and a record setting number of bills have been introduced for consideration. There’s a very small window to make this happen before the session ends in May.
Let’s Get These Laws Across the Finish Line in 2019! We’ve heard from thousands of Texas veterans, people with cancer or chronic pain, and other debilitating medical conditions who are suffering.  
And, chances are, you know many, too. It’s just wrong that families have to travel out of state to find relief through medical marijuana. It’s time to give Texans medical freedom without having to uproot their families.  And we are very close to making this a reality in this current legislative session, which ends May 27th.
Your Donations Will Work Hard to Get These Laws Passed
Your donation will be split between Texas NORML and Texans for Responsible Marijuana Policy. These two groups are led by well-known and respected advocates for individual liberty, and personal responsibility around marijuana laws in Texas. story:
Inspiration

Our local leaders come from diverse backgrounds and experiences. We lead with collaboration and are an inclusive network of women, men, parents, teens, young adults, Veterans, caregivers, families, advocates, providers, and researchers. Our vision for a better fibromyalgia future includes filling in the gaps for the following:

  • Patient-Centered Education
  • Healthcare Providers and Medical School Education
  • Fibromyalgia Research Coalition
  • Advocacy Training 
  • Affordable Complementary Medicine

Local Community Collaboration

Join us in fostering a greater connection to improve quality of life, but also build our capacity to create and take action together in order to save lives. We need your support to build a patient-centered and empowered community with free workshops, free educational materials and support for local leaders.

Programming

Your donation will help make a difference in the following areas:

Families & Fibromyalgia

Help us fund our School Advocates and Wellness Program to ensure success for our fibromyalgia teens, young adults and families through their academic years. 

We will recruit School Advocates and Health & Wellness Experts to work with our team around the country and provide one-to-one coaching, workshops, health circles, and online workshops.

Medical Education

Help us expand medical education and outreach through our new partnerships at Universities and healthcare centers nationwide. By supporting this campaign we can ensure more doctors and health professionals provide compassionate and knowledgeable care to our fibromyalgia community.

Fibromyalgia Tour

Help us contribute to local fibromyalgia communities! On the tour, we always provide free workshops, meetups, educational materials and training to local leaders. Our Fibromyalgia Tour continues to raise awareness with healthcare providers, Universities and researchers. Help others in local communities get the resources they need!

We are always looking for sponsors for the Fibromyalgia Tour. Full tour or local event packages available. Please contact us if you're interested! 

Research Coalition

Help us inspire a new generation of researchers to join this field!

With your support, we can create a Fibromyalgia Research Coalition that will expand research, improve upon clinicians summarizing the latest science, create conferences, and build new partnerships.

Advocacy Day 2019

Help us provide free advocacy training and support to local leaders headed to Washington, D.C. in September. We're mobilizing patients and allies to advocate for more investment in research, public awareness, and medical education. This campaign will help start a comprehensive plan of tools for local organizers, grow our network, support our events and online initiatives.

We are still looking for a couple more sponsors for Advocacy Day 2019 in Washington, D.C. Please contact us if you're interested!  

 

Other Ways You Can Help - SHARE or VOLUNTEER

We understand if you are not able to donate financially. You can #SupportFibro by sharing this campaign on social media or by email, tell friends about it, or create a Fibromyalgia Tour event!

We will be forever grateful. Together the fibromyalgia community FIGHTS ON! 

*Please note that colors on perk items may vary

Where to find us:

Website: https://supportfibromyalgia.org/

Find us on Facebook

Find us on Instagram

Find us on Twitter

story:
Roam Playspace 

Roam Playspace is  an intentional indoor play space created for kids AND parents to have fun and to grow increasingly grounded, empowered, and free. While children play,  parents step into relaxation, community, and can choose to explore and grow their vision for parenthood and life— all in one space. Offerings include top notch toys,  a beautiful space, community tables for a picnic, and an innovative style of interactive opt-in workshop learning for parents. Roam Playspace is a space designed by a team of experts in discovery-based, child directed free play. It is also a place to find community and  be cheered on as a parent!

What We Need

By supporting Roam Playspace you are investing in:

an indoor play structure 

stations designed for open-ended play

innovative and developmental toys

unique, discovery based workshop series for parents and families

a space that addreses the needs of both children and parents in Shasta Co

 

The Impact: Addressing ACEs

In recent years, the concept of Adverse Childhood Experiences (ACEs) has been a hot topic when it comes to child development and the well-being of a community. Experiences like incarceration of a family member, mental illness or substance abuse in the home, and abuse of any kind have a direct impact on the life outcomes of the children who experience them.

The number of ACEs a child endures correlates directly to an increased risk of many diseases and causes of early death. Children in Shasta County experience more ACEs than most children in the state.

Shasta county has some of the highest ACE statistics in the state. Here are a few of the statistics

17.1 % Have an incarcerated family member 

29.7% Have witnessed domestic violence

54.5 % Have experienced verbal abuse

57.7 % Have experienced family substance abuse

The good news is that kids who experience these things CAN heal and have a bright future.  In addition to healing, studies have shown that there are some specific protective factors against the impact of ACEs in a community. 

Roam Playspace will directly address ACEs through the protective factors of: 

Social Connections: Roam will be a place where families can connect, create, and strengthen the social connections that are integral for strong families and communities 

Knowledge of parenting practices and childhood development: Opt- in workshops at Roam Playspace will come from a variety of community voices and focus on many aspects of parenting and development 

Social and emotional competence in children: Learning to interact with and navigate relationships to other children and adults is key to a child's development, and this happens naturally through open-ended play. 

About the Founders

Alan and Anna have been on the parenting journey for 5 years and on a personal level have seen the force of a parenting community,  the lifeline of experts to support during challenges, and the power of intentional play. 

Alan studied medicine with an emphasis on the low-income families of Appalachia. He has been a physician assistant for 8 years, and he especially enjoys connecting with kids in the ER. He has worked mostly in emergency medicine, with some of that time in the ER of a children's hospital.  He feels honored to be connected to a community of people addressing child development and ACEs in Redding.

Anna was trained as a life coach in 2007 and has been a practicing doula since 2013. She has developed materials that guide women in utilizing the experiences of pregnancy, birthing, postpartum, and early motherhood as a catalyst for their own personal and parenting growth.  Anna saw the power of play and movement in trauma recovery  using swim and art therapy with children who lost their parents in the 2004 tsunami. She leads an international team that resources people in emotional and physical wholeness.

Alan and Anna are consulting with a team of individuals who are incredible thinkers and practioners in the areas of play, the use of space, child development, parent resourcing, healing, and community needs.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We love consulting with experts in the fields of childhood development, fun, parenting, and child-directed play. We are also creating a line up of workshops with a variety of voices. Be in touch if you would like to be involved! 

Thank you to our amazing design team:

Photo Credit: Rebekah Troll

Video Credit: Nathan Pruzaniec / Pru & Drew Inc. 

Logo and Website Design: Eric Hurtgen

story:
Soulside Healing Arts decreases barriers
to healing, health, and happiness by making
holistic wellness practices accessible to all.

With funds raised by bringing yoga to workplaces and studio clients, Soulside Healing Arts will be able to further our work of bringing trauma-informed wellness offerings to community settings and social service agencies across the area. 

We are already providing yoga in workplaces and community settings. But with your help, we'll also be able to:

  • open a brick and mortar studio, creating a beautiful space for the people of Peoria and surrounding communities to enjoy.
  • purchase studio props and equipment that will add diversity and comfort to our classes.
  • purchase enough mats and props to take to the social service agencies we teach in. Doing yoga in whatever space is available sometimes means cold tile, hard cement, or musty carpet floors.

Where We Work

Community - Trauma-informed yoga enables renewed agency and self-esteem. Soulside fosters healing and connection in social service settings where people can benefit from the tools of yoga, but haven't traditionally had access to them. 

Studio - We're working to create a space for community, where mindfulness and movement nourish the mind, body, and soul.

Workplaces - Custom yoga and mindfulness offerings improve mood and productivity among employees. Soulside helps employers promote a culture of wellness, and these partnerships sustain Soulside so we can expand our reach.

The Vision: Studio Space

The studio will be located in an historic 1880 building at 1311 SW Adams. This location, bridging Warehouse District development with longstanding neighborhoods is in line with Soulside's mission to become an accessible and community-centered space. We are excited to contribute to walkability and place-making in Peoria's downtown. 

The interior's natural light will invoke an ethereal sense of spaciousness. Ancient yogic symbols and odes to the natural world will figure into the studio's decor, serving as peaceful visuals to inspire meditation. Soulside's interior space, like the aesthetic concept of wabi-sabi, will show appreciation for the modesty of natural materials and the personal elements of process. It will be thoughtful, comfy, and earthy with attentiveness to nature and functionality. 

 

What We Need

Here is where your money will be going:

First two months of rent + utilities: $2,300
First two months of Insurance: $100
Yoga equipment: $3,000
Office equipment: $2,050
Incorporation Fees: $100
Design / Decor / Marketing: $450

FUNDING GOAL: $8,000

If more is raised, we will be putting it into Soulside's account to save for future expenses and to pay teachers for offering classes to our community partners at low rates. Donations to Soulside are not yet tax deductible. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Make sure you're on our email list to hear about events and stay updated on the studio launch. Spread the word to friends, too! Join at www.soulsidehealingarts.com
  • Bring a regular or one-time yoga class into your workplace. Email us at info@soulsidehealingarts.com to talk about the possibilities. Corporate partners will be featured on the website and have opportunities to sponsor, attend, or promote events regarding community wellness.
  • Organize a class at a social service agency you're connected to. Sliding scale and donation-based pricing options are available. Email us for more info: info@soulsidehealingarts.com
  • Share this campaign! 
  • Follow us on Instagram and Facbeook
  • This next one is a big one so we're giving it its own header...

Who We Are

Executive Director:
Hannah Ramlo - Hannah is a certified yoga instructor with a specialization in trauma-informed yoga. She will graduate from Bradley University with a Masters degree in Nonprofit Leadership in May.

Board of Directors: 
Brent Baker - Brent is the GP Pathways Co-Director at the Greater Peoria Economic Development Council, where he works to improve equity of access to opportunities that have historically evaded local communities. 

Emily Dahlhoff - Emily is a prenatal yoga instructor, doula, and advocate for women and families. She currently serves as a childcare provider at UnityPoint, and has experience serving mothers in communities often affected by trauma.

Peter Kobak - Peter serves the City of Peoria as a Project Manager on the Innovation Team. He has expertise in web development and design, and a drive to transform our city through innovative work that promotes equity and connection.

Jamila Wilson - Jamila heads the Peoria Corps program working to provide job training to youth ages 18-24 while maintaining Peoria's green infrastructure. She has served on several local boards and developed programs to mitigate the effects of stress in marginalized communities. 

What people are saying...

"I’ve been attending the class for the past couple of months and I look forward to attending every week. Hannah always offers modifications for exercises for those still learning or with injuries. She fosters a calm, supportive, and judgement-free environment in her class. I’ve noticed myself slowly getting stronger and more flexible in areas which helps build my confidence and improve my relationship with my body. I leave class each week feeling so good about myself and like I can conquer anything."
-Erin Fenton; Pekin Insurance Workplace Yoga

"It is my belief that yoga is beneficial to young people as they encounter challenges in their lives; physical conflicts, social behaviors, or emotional challenges. Yoga is something that children and youth can practice anywhere. For most of our kids, the world is a noisy, crowded environment. Even without electronics readily available, the ability to concentrate is hindered. One of my students once commented that she had “never listened to herself or heard her own heart -until she tried yoga.” 
-Pam Rumba; Executive Director, Common Place

"After one particular yoga class with Hannah I told her that at the end of class, my heart felt so full of love and I felt as whole as I've ever felt in my whole life and in that moment I did not think I could feel any better than I did right then. That's what yoga does for me."
-Suzanne Johnston; Yoga Student

 

You can help bring yoga to more people.
Back the campaign to launch Soulside Healing Arts into a studio space.

story:
*NOTE: for anyone unfamiliar with how indiegogo works, there is no minimum amount that you must donate. The "perks" are simply for those who are interested in them as a bonus. :D


One World Wellness's Mission:

Our intention is to travel around the globe, to wherever our assistance is needed, to support everyday people to take their health, wellness and level of joy to an all-time high. It's no secret that our world is struggling as a whole.
We feel that every single person who becomes healthy, self-empowered and balanced is one more person who will tip the scales toward a positive tomorrow for all of us and future generations.


Our preliminary research project....in a nutshell:

After 6 months of traveling in our car from Vancouver Island to Guatemala and back again on a small budget, and connecting with many dozens of people from all walks of life, we have realized something HUGE: Most of us do NOT have the time or extra finances to take a “wellness vacation” or retreat. However, almost everyone we connect with has a desire to feel more joy, live a healthier lifestyle and to have the support to fuel their passions. Wow! How do we solve this dilemma?

GOOD NEWS! We have a solution:

One World Wellness will bring the wellness retreat and personal guidance right to your home! We are a mobile, flexible team with knowledge to share with you about healthy lifestyle shifts, spiritual exploration and how to expand your consciousness to assist you in creating the vibrant and joyful life that you dream of living! We will offer the support needed to the people who need it the most. 

What can One World Wellness offer to our students?

Our services may include: shifting to healthier eating, moving our bodies, healthier thinking and heart-centered communication, deepening spiritual practices, growing your own food, improving the quality of your surroundings...and the possibilities go on and on. We can work with you at your own pace to guide you toward your personal path to greater joy and wellness. Keep us around for a week or ask us for a month of our time. The amount of support required for each individual will vary.

Who is One World Wellness?

We are Kristin and Tanner. A happy-go-lucky, upbeat, vibrant, 30-ish couple who's mission it is to continue to live simply and joyfully while supporting others in finding their own joy though balancing body, mind and spirit. Our passion is to show others that it's possible to live a vibrant and joyful life every single day!

We began One World Wellness in the fall of 2014 while we were living on Vancouver Island. We had both worked many "normal" careers (both for ourselves and for employers) in the last decade. We were feeling downright unfulfilled and way too tired and stressed at age 30! Hmmmm. How can we work so darn hard and only make such a tiny difference in our world? Why aren't we following our own passions instead of someone else's? Are we answering our greatest calling on the planet? What if we just forget the naysayers and just do what we love?! Well that's what we are doing starting right now! Help us to help our world to thrive.

What will the Funding that we receive from this campaign pay for?

Our vision is to offer our services to people on a sliding scale. At the end of our stay at each home, we will give each person or family the opportunity to make a donation to One World Wellness to assist us in continuing our work as a mobile wellness team. Some will be able to give more than others and under NO circumstances do we want to deny our services to anyone that truly needs them. It will be a pay-it-forward type of system. Every little bit of funding we receive will assist us in extending the life of this project! :)

How will you know where the money is getting spent?

We write a blog each week about our experiences and adventures and the amazing connections that we make with people like you. You will be able to see what we are up to and where we are spending the money that is so generously donated to our project.

Read Our Blog Here!

Your donations may go toward things that will make our project sustainable, such as:

Books and other teaching materials for our team and students

We are in need of a smaller, more portable (and less ancient than our huge laptop) device for making videos and communicating with our students. iPad?

Purchasing minor health and wellness products to support clients (ex: gardening supplies, yoga mats, sports equipment, etc.)

Rentals of venues for wellness events, workshops, etc.

Fuel to get our team and our car to our next student(s)

Routine and/or unexpected repairs/maintenance for our aging OOW car (if/when needed...hopefully minimal!)

Travel Insurance (a necessity for out-of-Canada travels)

*If our fundraising goes exceptionally well, we would love to upgrade our 2003 Jetta to a larger vehicle (such as a van or small motor home) so that we may have a place to lay our heads between students, as well as haul larger items, such as a massage table and other healing tools.


TESTIMONIALS...

"Some people you just really wish were your neighbors. Theses guys just jump right into your life and make you glad to be alive. Welcome back into my world anytime." - Kent, Idaho, USA

"Tanner and Kristin are such positive, high-spirited people! We had some of the best conversations and they spread the most amazing energy and enthusiasm to me in their entire stay. I think Tanner has changed my life with his drumming ceremony and I will never forget anything about them!!!!!!" - Kristine, Oregon, USA

"What a pleasure to be a last-minute host for these two. When I think of them, the words that come to mind are balanced, grounded, engaged and respectful. I highly enjoyed my brief time with them and totally recommend you open your doors to them if you have the opportunity. All the best in all you do Kristin and Tanner. You are the kind of young(er) people that give me some hope for the survivability of this planet." - Carol, Florida, USA

"The thing I appreciate the most about Tanner and Kristin is that they walk the talk." - Dave, British Columbia, Canada / Mexico

"I did the cacao ceremony just out of curiosity. I didn't have any expectations. I just wanted to see what it would be like and what it's about. It was a really interesting experience and it was also very therapeutic. It was also really beautiful.  I'm really grateful to Kristin and Tanner, not just for doing the ceremonies, but for being the right people to host them because that makes all the difference." - Deb, New York, USA 


If you would like to read additional information about our project, please see our blogs at:

www.oneworldwellnessblog.blogspot.com (our lifestyle, spirituality and travel blog)

www.cacaoconnection.blogspot.com (our Cacao Plant Medicine blog)

We also have a Facebook page. Follow One World Wellness on Facebook


If you have any additional questions about One World Wellness, please email

oneworldwellness@yahoo.ca


THANK YOU for supporting this project and the future wellness of our world.

PS. If you are inspired by our project, but just don't have the extra funds to donate, that's ok! We ask that you please spread the word to folks that may be able to support One World Wellness. Thanks!
story_txt:

Our
intention is to travel around the globe, to wherever our assistance is needed, to support
everyday people to take their health, wellness and level of joy to an
all-time high. It's no secret that our world is struggling as a whole. We feel that every single person who becomes healthy, self-empowered and balanced is one more person who will tip the scales toward a positive tomorrow for all of us and future generations.



Our

After
6 months of traveling in our car from Vancouver Island to Guatemala
and back again on a small budget, and connecting with many dozens of
people from all walks of life, we have realized something HUGE: Most
of us do NOT have the time or extra finances to take a “wellness
vacation” or retreat. However, almost everyone we connect with has
a desire to feel more joy, live a healthier lifestyle and to have the
support to fuel their passions. Wow! How do we solve this dilemma?

NEWS! We have a solution:

right to your home! We are a mobile, flexible team with knowledge to

story:
Hello, thank you for reading, my Name is Kristinna Counsell, and I'm a disabled full time mummy to two daughters one of whom has a very rare cancer in her spine.

Pippi (Aged 10 nearly 11 years) was in and out of hospital early 2016 and had many tests and a small spinal operation before finally being diagnosed with Langerhans Cell Histiocytosis in a vertebrae in her spine at the end of April 2016.

We have watched our child become so sick before our eyes and felt so very helpless to heal her.  We were very lucky our oncologist respected our wishes to hold off on chemotherapy and steroids for as long as possible and explore every alternative first.

After many months on indomethicin and anti acids Pippi was still in a great deal of pain and added to that she was having intense headaches and being very sickly as the medications were burning her insides.  After another X-ray at the end of October 2016 showed there were no changes and increasing pain in her arm meant an inconclusive secondary site.  So, we took the decision to take her off all medication for a month and under the consultants permission we moved to try hemp oil.

Pippi started the hemp oil in November and moved onto cbd  oil in December.  We returned to the oncologist in January 2017 to have further X-rays and it is looking like the oil is working.  

Along with the oil we are maintaining an organic dairy and meat limited diet.  Pippi now has colour in her cheeks and seems to be blossoming.  She actually had a 1" growth spurt over Christmas!

 

Our oncologist has said no more medications, just the CBD oil.

 

The purpose here is to ask you all to help us maintain this medicine and diet regime by helping fund the extra costs.

 

Our daughter has been in more pain than usual these last 6 weeks but it appears that is due to the bone re growing itself and destroying the LCH mass.  There appears to be a 50% improvement.

 

Pippi has also now started to return to school and is managing 2-3 mornings a week.  I was working but due to Pippi needing me and my own increasing disability I've had to give that up.

 

So what are we asking from you?

  • On going funding help so that we can maintain Pippi's diet and CBC oil regime which currently increases our weekly cost of living by around £100 a week;
  • Funding to enable us to install an at source water filtration system, currently we are buying copious amounts of bottled water.  The cost for this is anticipated to be around £1000.

  • Help to raise £395 to enable us to have her hair tested for analysis into her make up which will enable us to further compliment her diet to clear her system of the toxins that caused the cancer in the first place.

Any further funds will be used to get help out there for other families and children going through the same as we are.So what are we asking from you?

 

So please help, even if its only £1 and please do share and help us raise awareness too.
