It is a stylised representation of female genitalia representing the goddess Shakti and the feminine flow of energy.  I also have the original Moonspun Moon by Ali Davis available as beautiful little Moon note cards. Celebrate women and magic and all that is good with one of a kind jewelry pieces by Katherine Sanz (Moonspun Jewelry) and Original artwork by Ali Davis. 
 
Featured Perk! I will be your Birth Doula!
If you choose this perk, you will have me with all my fresh new doula skills as your future Birth Doula!!! I'll be ready for you beginning June 2018 $2222 
 Moon Cards 
Moon note cards original art by Ali Davis blank inside with envelope. three for $22 or ten for $55+ shipping 

 
Tiny Moon Ring 
A tiny silver moon on a tiny golden ring by Moonspun Jewelry Flash Sale! $20 + free shipping in the US!

 
Hot Pink and Rosewood Mala
 A hot pink and rosewood mala hand knotted with love by Moonspun Jewelry. $77 + shipping
 
Golden Yoni Bracelet
A golden yoni bracelet by Moonspun Jewelry. $88 + shipping
 Golden Yoni Necklace
Teeny Golden Yoni on a 16" golden chain necklace by Moonspun Jewelry. $99 + shipping


Golden Yoni Earrings

Golden Yoni Stud earrings by Moonspun Jewelry. $111 + shipping

 
Golden Bangles
Golden bangles handmade by Moonspun Jewelry  1 for $123 or 3 for $300 + shipping

 
Custom Golden Yoni Necklace
A custom golden yoni created just for you by Moonspun Jewelry. I'll work with you to create a One of a Kind Yoni power piece. Example pictured $333 and above + shipping
 The Yoniverse Necklace
A baller One of a Kind Golden Yoni necklace wrapped in gold, raw diamonds, and black sapphires on a long golden chain. $1111 + shipping
 Custom Solid Gold Yoni Necklace
I'll work with you to create a One of Kind Solid Gold Yoni power piece necklace using fine materials like solid gold and precious gemstones. $3333 and Up + shipping
 Full funder Prize!
If You are the full funder of my birth doula education, I LOVE You! I could create a fabulous piece of jewelry for you using the finest materials on earth! I could bake you a magical chocolate cake! I could throw you a rainbow unicorn parade! Heck, I could even be your Birth Doula! I could do anything for You! If this is You, let's talk. Choose anything! $22222

 
You can donate any amount.  If you would rather just contribute and not receive any goods in exchange, just choose No perks when checking out.
 
The Investment in my Birth Doula education
Here's the cost of my education, broken down so you can see specifically where your contribution will go:

Doula training course from Doula Trainings International $1597 + Course books $180 + Doula Training International Membership fee $157 + Childcare for my son during the training $640 + Birth support for three families as a doula in training $1200 + 16 hours of postpartum support for two families as a doula in training $640 + Childbirth education course $400 + Breastfeeding class $150 + CPR certification $100 + Childcare for my son while I complete the course requirements $9200 = Total cost of Birth doula education $14,264
+
Push goal! Doula training retreat! One Doula Retreat from Doula Trainings international $2400 + Airfare $500 + Childcare for my son while I attend the training $1250 = Total cost of bonus $4,150
+
Push goal! Postpartum Doula training with The Matrona $495 + Childcare for Ocean while I attend the training $1090 = Total cost of Postpartum addition $1,585
__________________________________________
Total Goal:: including the training and retreat $19,999
+ Indiegogo and Credit Card Fees $2,223
$22,222
+ shipping
 
The total cost of my birth doula education alone is all I'll need to become a certified professional birth doula. The first Push goal is for an optional Doula retreat where I'll get to learn more skills for birth, dive more in depth with with my community of professional doulas, and celebrate my new path! I don't necessarily need to attend the retreat, but I really want to!! The second Push goal is an additional postpartum doula training led by an elder midwife, The Matrona. This will be a potent spiritual workshop which will complement my official training.
I appreciate your contribution to my education!  If 10 people hire me to be their future Doula, My education will be totally funded. If 1,000 people order moon note cards, that works too. It will probably be some combination of prizes. Every little bit helps! If I don't receive the whole goal amount from my community, I'll be funding my education on my own. 
If I raise more than I need, the extra funds will go to Planned Parenthood.

Since becoming a mother, my time has become extra precious. Just another way motherhood is a great clarifier. This is why your support means so much to me.  It's a little scary stepping into a brand new profession, especially because I already have a successful jewelry business. Yet, I must follow my truth and passion. And so, into the great unknown I leap!! I know whatever challenges I encounter along the way will become my teachers as I become the best birth doula I can possibly be!
 

Other Ways You Can Help
If you just can't contribute actual money at this time, I understand. Your emotional support and sharing this campaign with your community means so much to me! If you already have a friendship with Ocean, volunteering to spend quality time with him while I work towards my education is also appreciated. 
Thank You!!!!

story: Jordan is the greatest.
story_txt: Jordan is the greatest.

story:
Welcome to our R3volution!
 

Chris Nelson, author, entrepreneur, yoga teacher and the founder of Ashiyana Goa heads up the Ashiyana Brazil team

 

 

Ashiyana is a Hindi word meaning home, and it was precisely this sense of feeling at home that Chris had in mind when he founded Ashiyana Goa. The retreat has grown to become one of the most loved yoga and spa retreats in India, attracting 1000s of guests from all corners of the globe. The magic of the retreat though, lies beyond the beautiful design of the centre, the incredible beaches and the delicious, fresh food, and is rooted in the heartfelt desire for our guests to drop all of their worldly worries. This is clear to see in the beautiful smiling faces of the staff :)

With an eye for detail and his own published approach to wellbeing, Chris has created a unique experience for all who visit Ashiyana Goa.

 

 

Many of our guests are aware that Ashiyana is expanding and they're as excited as we are about the next Retreat opening in Brazil!

 

 


When asked about his vision for Alto Paraiso, Brazil, Chris explained: 

Alto is a very special  place. It has an unassuming air, an understated beauty, and Mother Nature’s healing embrace is palpable. It's a truly unique location with exceptional bio-diversity, and its bedrock of crystals interwoven with rivers and waterfalls means that walks off the beaten track are truly spectacular.
 


Over the last few years, we've been slowly developing the land, planting trees, making wonderful friends and learning about the needs of the local community. We’d like to invite you to be part of our campaign, or what we’re calling our R3volution. With your help we’ll be able to implement the 3 Rs of our R3volution:

  • Relaxation - Complete the building of the Retreat that will finance the other two elements moving forwards
  • Rehabilitation - Build a community/workshop space for the Rehabilitation Project, which integrates men and women back into society following drug and alcohol abuse
  • Reforestation - Prepare the 9Ha of our agro-forestry project land for further planting, and build a sheltered structure with store for the workers​
     

​

 

Our whole philosophy is based upon the creation of a virtuous loop of sustainability -

  • Once the Retreat (Relaxation) is completed next summer, we'll be able to further fund the Rehabilitation and Reforestation elements of the project, as well as employ some of the workers who've been displaced from the fields by modern farming methods
  • Our agro-forestry project will employ the same men and women that have been rehabilitated back into society, and their labour will enable the sale of seeds, saplings and trees, providing funds for our other social projects
  • Our good friend Zizo, who lives on the land, is an expert in permaculture and agro-forestry, and with his help we hope to inspire many others to live in harmony with the land, teaching them that over-grazing, stripping of trees and seasonal burning, create long-term depletion of the land
     

 

Here are some of our projects at Ashiyana Goa:

  • Nepal fund - After the 2015 earthquake, we have continued to support the families of our kitchen team by contributing a portion of our profits as well as raising donations from workshops and events throughout Europe and India
  • Teacher Training Scholarship - we offer four scholarship places per year to those who can't afford the normal tuition fees
  • BBC Media Action Correspondence Dinner - luxury holidays offered through fundraising auction 
  • Brighton Yoga Festival - sponsored fundraising event run by Brighton Yoga Foundation
  • The Sisterhood foundation aims to give women and girls in the third world a brighter future.  Ashiyana partners with the Sisterhood Foundation and supports their large scale fundraising events
  • Welfare for Animals in Goa (WAG) is an NGO dedicated to rescuing animals in need. Ashiyana partners with WAG and some of the Ashiyana family-members volunteer at the clinic to give love and care to the animals in need 

  • Cleaner environment - we help run a local rubbish clear up every year and have sponsored the installation of local rubbish bins

In addition, in the twelve years since Ashiyana Goa has opened, well over 10,000 guests have been supporting the local shops, businesses and restaurants, enabling them to thrive.
 

 

This is what we have achieved so far in Goa. Our intention is to expand upon this in Alto Paraiso, Brazil with our 3Rs. Whilst the projects in Goa are hugely supportive in the community, the size of our land in Alto Paraiso will enable us to take this to the next level!    

Please support this opportunity - with your help and contributions we can both transform lives and continue the process of returning the land to its natural, verdant glory. Our perks include a range of experiences that you can enjoy as part of the journey. 

The perks section on this campaign will give you an idea of the incredible deals we are offering  you, but to view expanded descriptions please visit: http://www.ashiyana.com/brazil-perks

 

With your help we can transform a community and the surrounding ecosystem. Our goal is modest:

Our requirements in phase 1 have been carefully costed so you know exactly how your contribution will help. Much of this is construction, which in turn supports the community in and around Alto Paraiso.

Phase 1: We require an initial cash injection of £50,000, which will be used as follows: 

  • £27,500 to complete 10 guest rooms
  • £7,500 for the rehabilitation project's workshop space
  • £5,000 to build the retreat's organically constructed yoga shala
  • £5,000 for final preparation of the 9Ha of land to be ready for further planting
  • £5,000 for a worker’s shelter which will also house equipment in a safe storage facility

The completion of the guest rooms and yoga shala will enable the retreat to open for paying guests, which allows funding to begin for key parts of the social projects and the reforestation programme.

Guests will be invited to help on the land if they wish, or those with relevant qualifications will be invited to assist with the rehabilitation and reforestation projects.

We've put together some fabulous perks that we hope you'll be excited about...

  • Generous discounts for retreat stays. During your stay you will have an opportunity to help on the land or with the social enterprise areas of the project. Enjoy a walk around the region where you can explore the most diverse flora and fauna on the planet, including the 200 million year old crystal bedrock, dramatic gorges, and the magnificent waterfalls and rivers where you can refresh yourself with a cool dip
  • A one to one with Chris Nelson, who will talk you through the SOAR philosophy from his book Wake Up and SOAR, including tools for relaxation, optimal lifestyle hacks, and keys to being inspired and fulfilled
  • All of you who contribute will have your names imprinted on the entrance wall to the retreat, so that your kindness will never be forgotten

If for whatever reason we don't hit out target, we'll ensure that all donations go towards the completion of the guest rooms, as this will ensure we have the means to generate income from paying guests to fund the other two of our Rs. This is our essential objective!

If in our selection of retreat perks you don't find the exact experience you are looking for, please speak to our team who we will create the right package just for you.

Please note, once you purchase a perk you will be sent a confirmation email receipt.  Please forward this to our bookings team when booking your experience.

For Goa bookings, please contact: ashiyana@ashiyana.com

For Brazil bookings, please contact: brazil@ashiyana.com

*Please note Brazil bookings will not open until January 2019, with a view to open the retreat centre in July 2019. 

 

Your impact can and will help!

Your contribution will matter a great deal to many in the community that our project is supporting, plus it will have a hugely positive impact on the local environment. We have a wonderfully compassionate and energetic team at Ashiyana, and we'd love you to get involved and support us too!

So we welcome you on-board, knowing that together we can create lasting, positive change in Alto Paraiso. In fact Chris' vision is expansive, and once we've made a success of the R3volution Project here, we'll begin to spread our efforts to other areas around the world.
 

 

Is there a risk?

Some may view building and running a retreat in uncharted territory as a risky business, but rest assured that we've had 12 year's experience of running a successful retreat in Goa, India. Here's what Chris said about founding Ashiyana Goa:

"Whilst my intentions when buying the land were pretty humble, it seems that life had other ideas. Ashiyana has grown to become quite a substantial community - providing a home away from home to many thousands of guests, employment to 50, predominantly, local Indians, and support for a large array of social projects. Ashiyana has become the manifestation of a dream that I had a long time ago. But it has become so much more than I’d imagined, and because of the efforts of many people, and a few key people in particular, it is now a world-renowned yoga retreat and community that has spawned hundreds of yoga teachers, many thousands of happy guests, and is a fundamentally important element of the local community."
 

 

We know that there will be challenges along the way, but we've set up an amazing network in Alto Paraíso and the team is primed and ready to complete Phase 1 of our beautiful project! Everything is in place, and with your help we can move it forward...

 

There is always a way to help!

If a cash contribution is tricky for you at the moment, there are many other ways that you can help - the most important being to share our campaign as far and wide as possible! Indiegogo is a great platform with plenty of tools to use for this purpose, so, if money is tight but you like our project, do please share it around your network of friends. We would be so grateful, and you truly would be a part of our R3volution!
 

Join our R3volution!

story:
Short Summary

Who am I? 

I'm a girl from Fort Bragg, who left for a decade or so to go to school in Humboldt County. While completing my college degrees in education, I worked in a restaurant with a staff that felt like family, and practiced Hot Yoga at a small, sweet studio. Little did I know the first time I walked into that studio 12 years ago that I was beginning a lifelong passion. 

Regardless of what life has thrown at me, what continent or state I've been in, or what my current profession is, Hot Yoga has been my anchor in some otherwise tumultuous times. And it's like nothing other - there is no substitute. After moving back to my little hometown 4 years ago, I decided I needed to do whatever I could to build a hot studio here on the Mendocino Coast. 

The summer after my second year teaching at a local charter school, I left to complete my teacher training with Evolation Yoga. It was one of the most incredible experiences of my life, and that month of training helped me find an equanimity that I had been searching for my whole life. When I got home, I was ready to hit the ground running with studio ownership. However, my new husband and I decided that it would be the wise choice to start our family before a new business, which is exactly what we did! Our baby girl, Zeplyn Mae, was born last June, and being her mom has brought me SO much joy. 

At 8 months old, she is so much of my WHY. She is the main reason I am so driven to fulfill my dream of studio ownership - not only because I want to show her that dreams can come true with hard work and dedication, but I also want to create a community that is centered around self-care and wellness, that supports families, that demonstrates to her what a healthy work-life balance looks like. I want to create a space for respectful, constructive discourse in our often volatile public dialogue, and hold workshops for adolescents that are trying to figure out who they are. I want to create something that is beautiful, dynamic, and full of diverse personalities that nonetheless treat each other with kindness, respect, and compassion. In short, I want to create something that I am proud to share with my daughter, and that will send ripples of wellness out into our small community. 

Your contribution will help provide all of the features that will make this studio so incredible. First off, a heating system that will consistently achieve the desired 105* for Hot Yoga (you yogis know this is CRUCIAL), while also allowing for air flow to keep air fresh despite the heat. After getting suuuuuper sweaty during  Hot Yoga (or hot pilates, or line dancing, or TRX) class, students can rinse off in our awesome new showers before leaving to go run all of their other errands in town. Especially in such a rural community, where folks often drive in from surrounding, remote areas for their shopping, school pick-ups and drop-offs, workdays, etc., being able to squeeze in a workout without having to walk around sweaty all day is pretty amazing. After getting all cleaned up, and before heading over to the grocery store (or laundromat, or the bank...), students will be able to get a protein shake or smoothie, a nice cold glass of kombucha on tap, or a light snack and coffee. In addition to providing the workout, the showers, and the fuel, your contribution will help build the ONLY studio in town that plans to offer drop-in childcare to those taking class. I plan to offer this within 3 months of opening the doors, to accommodate all of the mamas out there with babies who aren't yet in school. And with more funds coming from crowdfunding and less from loans, this can happen sooner rather than later! 

 

What We Need & What You Get

So - here's the scoop!

  • The $70,000 goal is based on my projections for opening costs, plus 2 months of operating costs, so that everything can run as smoothly as possible as soon as doors are open! Here is the breakdown of exactly where all of it is going:
    • $15,000 is for the heating system - the infrared heating system is not only super high quality, but it is also low energy consumption, and much easier to install (and cleaner!) than a forced-air system. 
    • $20,000 is for theshowersand café plumbing – I know, it’s a lot, but the showers are SUCH a key piece of this, and long term, it makes much more sense to install them now – and do the café plumbing while we’re at it. Otherwise, the studio will have to close to get into the concrete subfloor in a year or two, and that isn’t good for anyone! 
    • $10,000 is for 2 months of operating costs, things like heat, water, rent, insurance, payroll, and the like. This way, in case things start off slow, there's an opportunity to save the first 2 months of revenue to go towards the 3rd month! 
    • $10,000 is for platform fees, reserve funds that they hold to protect you all, and shipping for swag! 
    • $5,000 is for all of the other construction-type modifications – lighting upgrade, new windows, bathroom vanity, café counters, etc.  
    • $5,000 is the cost of ourequipment– dishware, yoga mats (made from recycled wetsuits – so cool!), towels for rent, kombucha kegerator, mirrors, curtains, toilet paper, you get the picture – all the “stuff.” 
    • $5,000 is left over for all the other stuff we don’t even know we need yet, or the unexpected stuff – permitting fees, licensing, ambiance, the finishing touches. 
  • Our perks contain some pretty cool stuff - handmade glass straws, SoulFire gear, and best of all, a chance to try some of our awesome classes at a lower rate than our regular membership! 
  • And if we don't raise it all? 

    Simple – we start small.We’ve raised almost $17,000 at this point, so we have about $53,000 to go. I really think we can do it. But if not? We have enough for the basics – for the heat, the floors, and our permits to open the doors. And we’re totally ok with starting there if need be. BUT, we’d rather make it so you can shower after your class, and have dressing rooms, and a nice refreshing beverage. Doesn’t that sound so much better? 

    We need your help to make it happen though! So if you can, chip is $5, $10, whatever you can – every little bit helps. And tell your friends! This is a project BY the community, FOR the community. I think of it as a barn raising – you help us raise our roof, and we’ll be around to help you raise yours when the time comes. 

    Because that’s what community does.

The Impact

  • In all comes down to creating a better world. With everything going on around us, making a difference in our immediate communities and lives is where real change begins. So, I'm starting with me. I'm building a business that is ethically sourced - that uses local materials and labor, recycled or responsibly produced goods, and that strives for zero waste. The cafe will not supply disposable dishware or cups, encouraging patrons to instead bring their own, or pay an extra $1 for something reusable that they can take with them. 
  • I'm hiring people to lead classes from all walks of life for all kinds of people - not just the typical, fit young people you see leading the classes at most gyms (tho I do have some of those too!) My instructors come in all shapes and sizes and ages, and I love that about them. They have very different specialties, personalities, and histories, and these are all things that benefit the studio, and the community. 
  • I want to give back. I want to provide a resource for self-care for those struggling with addiction, those struggling to find themselves, and those that are just having a hard time finding a balance in their lives. I want to offer work-trade for low-income teenagers and parents, who can't afford the usual boutique yoga experience. I want to be the anchor that my home studio was for me, for so many years. 
  • Although this is my first time owning a yoga studio, I'm no stranger to new things. I've worked my way through a BA, 2 teaching credentials, and an MA. I've rebuilt my truck and my home, and my heart in the process. I've backpacked through Patagonia, hitchhiked through the Argentine Desert, driven through Mexico, and ridden my bike, alone, down the East Coast. I'm no stranger to hard work, and I've had a few falls and setbacks, but I know how to work hard, how to persevere,  and how to ask for help. 
  • There is no Plan B. I grew up with the old adage that when there's a will there's a way, and I am hellbent on creating this for myself and most importantly, for my daughter. But, it'll be a whole lot easier with your help!

 

Risks & Challenges

  • Some possible setbacks include issues with construction, slow attendance, or low interest in the classes we are starting with. With any new business, there is an expected progression of development and projections of how it will be received by the community. In almost every step of this process thus far, from meetings at the small business development center, to meeting the planning department, to the neighboring businesses in the shopping center and their employees, I have heard "Oooh yay! I'll be there!" However, getting people through the door may take different strategies and techniques. Not only am I open to trying new things, but I have the help of an organization that was highly recommended, who specializes in fixing studios that are struggling. By working with them from the beginning, I already have an advantage in learning from the experiences of others, without having to learn the hard lessons on my own. And, I trust that they'll have myriad ideas if those that we launch with don't work right off the bat! And as far as construction goes, I am working with a contractor who was highly recommended, who I have known for almost 15 years. I have seen the work ethic present, and trust that any issues or setbacks will be handled respectfully, professionally, and fairly. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Even if you can't help financially (tho even $5 goes a long way!) you can still help spread the word! Tell you family, tell your friends, tell your neighbor! If everyone shared, and we got 7,000 people to each chip in $10, we'd be there! And every little bit helps, gets this studio one step closer to reality, and makes our community a little bit better. 
  • Check out (and share!) our website, at www.soulfiremendocino.com to learn more about our classes, our philosophy, and our instructors!
story_txt:
Short Summary
Who am I? 
I'm a girl from Fort Bragg, who left for a decade or so to go to school in Humboldt County. While completing my college degrees in education, I worked in a restaurant with a staff that felt like family, and practiced Hot Yoga at a small, sweet studio. Little did I know the first time I walked into that studio 12 years ago that I was beginning a lifelong passion. 
Regardless of what life has thrown at me, what continent or state I've been in, or what my current profession is, Hot Yoga has been my anchor in some otherwise tumultuous times. And it's like nothing other - there is no substitute. After moving back to my little hometown 4 years ago, I decided I needed to do whatever I could to build a hot studio here on the Mendocino Coast. 
The summer after my second year teaching at a local charter school, I left to complete my teacher training with Evolation Yoga. It was one of the most incredible experiences of my life, and that month of training helped me find an equanimity that I had been searching for my whole life. When I got home, I was ready to hit the ground running with studio ownership. However, my new husband and I decided that it would be the wise choice to start our family before a new business, which is exactly what we did! Our baby girl, Zeplyn Mae, was born last June, and being her mom has brought me SO much joy. 
At 8 months old, she is so much of my WHY. She is the main reason I am so driven to fulfill my dream of studio ownership - not only because I want to show her that dreams can come true with hard work and dedication, but I also want to create a community that is centered around self-care and wellness, that supports families, that demonstrates to her what a healthy work-life balance looks like. I want to create a space for respectful, constructive discourse in our often volatile public dialogue, and hold workshops for adolescents that are trying to figure out who they are. I want to create something that is beautiful, dynamic, and full of diverse personalities that nonetheless treat each other with kindness, respect, and compassion. In short, I want to create something that I am proud to share with my daughter, and that will send ripples of wellness out into our small community. 
Your contribution will help provide all of the features that will make this studio so incredible. First off, a heating system that will consistently achieve the desired 105* for Hot Yoga (you yogis know this is CRUCIAL), while also allowing for air flow to keep air fresh despite the heat. After getting suuuuuper sweaty during  Hot Yoga (or hot pilates, or line dancing, or TRX) class, students can rinse off in our awesome new showers before leaving to go run all of their other errands in town. Especially in such a rural community, where folks often drive in from surrounding, remote areas for their shopping, school pick-ups and drop-offs, workdays, etc., being able to squeeze in a workout without having to walk around sweaty all day is pretty amazing. After getting all cleaned up, and before heading over to the grocery store (or laundromat, or the bank...), students will be able to get a protein shake or smoothie, a nice cold glass of kombucha on tap, or a light snack and coffee. In addition to providing the workout, the showers, and the fuel, your contribution will help build the ONLY studio in town that plans to offer drop-in childcare to those taking class. I plan to offer this within 3 months of opening the doors, to accommodate all of the mamas out there with babies who aren't yet in school. And with more funds coming from crowdfunding and less from loans, this can happen sooner rather than later! 
 

What We Need & What You Get
So - here's the scoop!

The $70,000 goal is based on my projections for opening costs, plus 2 months of operating costs, so that everything can run as smoothly as possible as soon as doors are open! Here is the breakdown of exactly where all of it is going:
$15,000 is for the heating system - the infrared heating system is not only super high quality, but it is also low energy consumption, and much easier to install (and cleaner!) than a forced-air system. 
$20,000 is for theshowersand café plumbing – I know, it’s a lot, but the showers are SUCH a key piece of this, and long term, it makes much more sense to install them now – and do the café plumbing while we’re at it. Otherwise, the studio will have to close to get into the concrete subfloor in a year or two, and that isn’t good for anyone! 
$10,000 is for 2 months of operating costs, things like heat, water, rent, insurance, payroll, and the like. This way, in case things start off slow, there's an opportunity to save the first 2 months of revenue to go towards the 3rd month! 
$10,000 is for platform fees, reserve funds that they hold to protect you all, and shipping for swag! 
$5,000 is for all of the other construction-type modifications – lighting upgrade, new windows, bathroom vanity, café counters, etc.  
$5,000 is the cost of ourequipment– dishware, yoga mats (made from recycled wetsuits – so cool!), towels for rent, kombucha kegerator, mirrors, curtains, toilet paper, you get the picture – all the “stuff.” 
$5,000 is left over for all the other stuff we don’t even know we need yet, or the unexpected stuff – permitting fees, licensing, ambiance, the finishing touches. 


Our perks contain some pretty cool stuff - handmade glass straws, SoulFire gear, and best of all, a chance to try some of our awesome classes at a lower rate than our regular membership! 

And if we don't raise it all? Simple – we start small.We’ve raised almost $17,000 at this point, so we have about $53,000 to go. I really think we can do it. But if not? We have enough for the basics – for the heat, the floors, and our permits to open the doors. And we’re totally ok with starting there if need be. BUT, we’d rather make it so you can shower after your class, and have dressing rooms, and a nice refreshing beverage. Doesn’t that sound so much better? 
We need your help to make it happen though! So if you can, chip is $5, $10, whatever you can – every little bit helps. And tell your friends! This is a project BY the community, FOR the community. I think of it as a barn raising – you help us raise our roof, and we’ll be around to help you raise yours when the time comes. 
Because that’s what community does.


The Impact

In all comes down to creating a better world. With everything going on around us, making a difference in our immediate communities and lives is where real change begins. So, I'm starting with me. I'm building a business that is ethically sourced - that uses local materials and labor, recycled or responsibly produced goods, and that strives for zero waste. The cafe will not supply disposable dishware or cups, encouraging patrons to instead bring their own, or pay an extra $1 for something reusable that they can take with them. 
I'm hiring people to lead classes from all walks of life for all kinds of people - not just the typical, fit young people you see leading the classes at most gyms (tho I do have some of those too!) My instructors come in all shapes and sizes and ages, and I love that about them. They have very different specialties, personalities, and histories, and these are all things that benefit the studio, and the community. 
I want to give back. I want to provide a resource for self-care for those struggling with addiction, those struggling to find themselves, and those that are just having a hard time finding a balance in their lives. I want to offer work-trade for low-income teenagers and parents, who can't afford the usual boutique yoga experience. I want to be the anchor that my home studio was for me, for so many years. 

Although this is my first time owning a yoga studio, I'm no stranger to new things. I've worked my way through a BA, 2 teaching credentials, and an MA. I've rebuilt my truck and my home, and my heart in the process. I've backpacked through Patagonia, hitchhiked through the Argentine Desert, driven through Mexico, and ridden my bike, alone, down the East Coast. I'm no stranger to hard work, and I've had a few falls and setbacks, but I know how to work hard, how to persevere,  and how to ask for help. 
There is no Plan B. I grew up with the old adage that when there's a will there's a way, and I am hellbent on creating this for myself and most importantly, for my daughter. But, it'll be a whole lot easier with your help!

 
Risks & Challenges
Some possible setbacks include issues with construction, slow attendance, or low interest in the classes we are starting with. With any new business, there is an expected progression of development and projections of how it will be received by the community. In almost every step of this process thus far, from meetings at the small business development center, to meeting the planning department, to the neighboring businesses in the shopping center and their employees, I have heard "Oooh yay! I'll be there!" However, getting people through the door may take different strategies and techniques. Not only am I open to trying new things, but I have the help of an organization that was highly recommended, who specializes in fixing studios that are struggling. By working with them from the beginning, I already have an advantage in learning from the experiences of others, without having to learn the hard lessons on my own. And, I trust that they'll have myriad ideas if those that we launch with don't work right off the bat! And as far as construction goes, I am working with a contractor who was highly recommended, who I have known for almost 15 years. I have seen the work ethic present, and trust that any issues or setbacks will be handled respectfully, professionally, and fairly. 
Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't help financially (tho even $5 goes a long way!) you can still help spread the word! Tell you family, tell your friends, tell your neighbor! If everyone shared, and we got 7,000 people to each chip in $10, we'd be there! And every little bit helps, gets this studio one step closer to reality, and makes our community a little bit better. 
Check out (and share!) our website, at www.soulfiremendocino.com to learn more about our classes, our philosophy, and our instructors!

story:
Who I am

Hi, I'm Ulrike Selleck. I'm a healing voice expert with 25 years of experience, a 4th generation musician and classical singer, mother, speaker, originator of Healing Voice Yoga, and author of Sing Yourself Well in 7 Seconds.

Every one of my hundreds of clients needed to free her/his full voice, in order to regain health and happiness. I created Sing Yourself Well to bring this vital, and practical knowledge of the forgotten power of our voice to the world. Sing Yourself Well in 7 Seconds is a profound 7 step system that allows anyone who practices it to manifest the 7 qualities of wellness into their body, in 7 seconds, all with their own voice. This Healing Voice Yoga improves health, strength, energy, and overall well-being.

My own life, and that of hundreds of clients has been permanently changed with this system. I am super passionate about sharing it with the world. It is much needed today.

My Story:

25 years ago I experienced a major health crisis. It was Deepak Chopra who told me: If you want to heal, you have to learn to sing, speak up and express yourself.

Did you know, most of us use only 20% of our full voice and breath?!

What if there's a link between that and all the major health concerns today? Depression, anxiety, asthma, high blood pressure, obesity, diabetes, and heart disease. These are all symptoms of a constricted energy!

I was already in my 30s, when I studied voice, took lessons, and learned to sing, operatic style. Since then, I've performed for thousands, and taught what I have coined Healing Voice Yoga to hundreds of students and clients—privately, in class rooms, and workshops. I soon found that every single person coming to me, seeking healing help for all types of issues, needed to open their full voice. Every. Single. One. Wow. I did not expect this.

I realized, if every single one of hundreds of clients needed to heal and free their voice—and always in a specific way—the chances are very high that there are many more people in the world who could benefit from this knowledge. It was decided: I wanted to bring it to the world!

Sing Yourself Well was born! It took me two years to write the book and publish the 2 hour, 10 lesson accompanying online course. But they are done!

Now that this life-changing, health-giving product is created and available, I realize that sadly, this doesn't mean, the world knows about it instantly. I need help sharing it!

This is where you come in.

The Impact

What Your Support Will Do:

Your generous donations will allow me to spread this knowledge far and wide, as quickly as possible.

I've identified 10 critical fast-track projects I can complete in the next 6 months to get the word out about Sing Yourself Well and Healing Voice Yoga and let everyone know the importance of using our full voice.

With your support I will accomplish the following:

  1.  Write a minimum of 20 articles for distribution to the many health, wellness and voice-related websites, blogs and forums.
  2. Maintain and distribute a professional-quality Healing Voice Yoga Blog with regular, weekly publications of Q&A type posts.
  3. Identify and connect with a minimum of 10 other bloggers in the wellness/yoga/alternative health/voice arena to share content and explore joint venture opportunities.
  4. Identify and contact a minimum of 10 appropriate journalists, radio and TV hosts for interviews.
  5. Design and produce at least 20 videos for my Sing Yourself Well YouTube channel, complete with transcripts so search engines can find the videos (Did you know Youtube competes with google as one of the largest search engines?).
  6. Prepare a polished signature presentation, complete with audio-visual support, handouts and main points pdfs to share with audiences large and small.
  7. Create at least 3 variations of the signature presentation that are tailored to target specific interest groups: entrepreneurs and speakers, wellness enthusiasts, yoga teachers, singers.
  8. Research alternative health fairs, yoga conferences, wellness meetups, etc, within our Midwest region, and give presentations at the most promising events.
  9. Prepare a detailed Facebook ad campaign, with a minimum of 6 ads, budget, and a testing schedule.
  10. Prepare a TED or TED-X talk targeting the TED audience.

With your support and my focused work, at the end of the 6 months I am hoping that the business will be able to self sustain.  I work fast, focused, and have been averaging working 10 hours per day the last 3 years.

If for some reason we raise less than the goal, I will tackle as many of the projects as possible. But let's aim high and exceed our goal, so the above 10 goals can be met easily, and quickly. Thank you!

If more than our target goal is reached, the extra funds will support these additional projects:

  1. Translate Sing Yourself Well into German
  2. Have translations made into Spanish, French and Italian (for starters)
  3. Continue writing the other 6 related books, all of which I have started
  4. Re-record the online course professionally
  5. Record a kids' version of Sing Yourself Well called "Holy Monkey Chatter."

The funds we raise will support the Sing Yourself Well projects outlined above by covering my basic (very basic!) living expenses as well as the direct expenses for the specific projects.  While many people may ask for support for their separate business, in the case of Sing Yourself Well, I am the business!

My Jobs include:

Founder; healing voice expert; singer; voice teacher; healer; ideas specialist; producer; production manager; strategist; publicist; copy writer; blogger; author; editor; book cover designer; typist; photographer; publisher; script writer; script girl; set designer; lighting technician; camera woman; director; musician; audio expert; video editor; make-up artist; YouTube channel, pinterest, and facebook business page designer; marketing personnel; public relations manager for blogs and radios; on location scout; presenter; motivational speaker; venue booker; costume designer; web designer; website developer; funnel designer; membership site developer; accountant; book keeper; accountant; press release writer; ... and I'm sure I'm missing a few more.

You can see, why I need your support!!

What I need and what you get

Breakdown of Expenses:

  • Overhead/Month

Rent & Utilities (includes internet, electric, heat, phone): $800

Stipend (Includes food, misc. living expenses) $675

-------------------

$1,475/mo = $8,850

  • Direct Business/Month:

Websites, hosting, newsletter service: $110

Internet marketing programs, continuing education: $75

Facebook ads: $115/week, $460/month

$645/mo = $3,870

TOTAL: $12,720

  • EXTRA Business Expenses:

If we can exceed the above goal, an estimated $7000 will allow me to professionally re-record the course and intro videos/buy professional equipment to re-record these myself, and start on the 5 projects listed above. Can we do it? 

TOTAL: $19,720

My Gifts to You:

  • For every one of your contributions please know that Nature is rejoicing, as that means you see the value of this mission, the value of sharing this priceless wisdom with as many people as possible, and thereby with the whole world.
  • Also please know that you have my profound respect, deep appreciation, and love flowing your way, ad infinitum.
  • In addition, as a manifest token of my deep appreciation for your generous contribution I'd like to offer you a variety of health-giving gifts—7 different ones all in all—to choose from. They range from a signed copy of my book, to private healing voice sessions, all the way to an in-person house concert.

Other Ways You Can Help

For Extra Brownie Points I'd love the following support:

  • Please share this page and video with anyone you feel would support this mission. Please share privately, rather than on social media. If you know anyone who has contacts in radio, TV, the press, TEDx, or TED, please share this with them. Thank you.
  • Your loving support and Light. See this accomplished, see Sing Yourself Well taught in schools, helping kids feel so good about themselves, they neither get bullied, nor feel the need to bully. Helping parents feel calm and secure, making good decisions, while having the energy they need. Helping couples have loving, fulfilled relationships. Helping everyone on earth be healthy and happy, and creating a world of peace.
  • A good, safe car. If you are—or someone you know is—able to donate it to the cause, it'll allow me to travel to towns and cities to give talks. Ideally a white Toyota RAV 4. Or white Kia Soul. Or a white Infinity QX50. Thank you so much.

Remember: 50 years ago Yoga was largely unknown in the West. Now it is a household name. The importance of using our full voice with Healing Voice Yoga is still unknown. Let's make Sing Yourself Well a well-loved household name, and create health and happiness wherever it is practiced. So that in 5, not 50 years (thank you internet) you can say: "I was there. I was one of the original supporters."

So Thank You, Dear One, for Your Support!

Love and Light,

~ Ulrike

story:
Elise Marques London is a beauty brand that puts you first, and makes You Matter

 

I am Michelle Margaret Marques Founder and Creator Elise Marques London, I want to share my story with you. 

I am a mum of four, three beautiful grown-up sons and my stunning daughter who is five. I've been a mum for almost 27 years now and it's been the most rewarding yet challenging journey of my life. I lost my mum to heart failure just before my 19th birthday she was just 37, I was devastated. My family pretty much fell apart from that moment on and I had to rely on myself. I was taking care of everyone, I already had a son who was two by that time, my sister was 14, my brother 18, and my father became an alcoholic. I guess that's part of the reason I care so much about people, but really I learned it from my mum, she cared deeply about people. 

As life developed I became a single mum with three very energetic and boisterous boys, it was challenging at times and the stress I felt was immense. I knew I had to do something to not only combat stress, but look after myself. The threat of dying from a heart attack young and leaving my boys behind was a very real fear for me, I'd seen it happen to my mum and I believed if I didn't do something to look after myself in some way it was a real possibility it would happen to me. 

I began to develop a bedtime routine, after the long day and the stresses and strains had subsided and the boys were finally in bed I would sit in the quiet, switch off the TV, switch most of the lights off, light a candle and begin a skincare routine. I would really take time to massage my face, breathing deeply taking in the smells. Relax my mind, massage my arms and across my shoulders, I love to smell the scent as I fall asleep. Ahh the smell of Rose takes me to a place of peace. I would then massage my legs a little, we all know how good that feels after a long busy day, oh gosh just heaven. I didn't know it then, but what I was doing was more than dealing with stress levels, I was taking care of my well-being, taking care of myself, loving myself, making my self matter.

I didn't know then that routine was going to change my life. Every single moment of that routine was going to matter deeply to me as I developed and my life went through different stages. I didn't realise how important the silence was going to become I just had the need for a little quiet after dealing with three noisy boys, little did I know that it was what would keep me sane. I couldn't know back then how important those scents would become, oh boy I love amazing scents, I came to learn what effect different scents have on us and how they help our well-being. I couldn't even begin to imagine just how significant taking 10 to 20 minutes to yourself at the end of a long day, to pamper and take care of yourself would be. This made me feel loved, important, I mattered to me. I slept better, I felt better, I was able to cope with stress better, heck I even felt happier and more positive. I developed a love of skincare and lifestyle products and began to notice a huge difference in not just the look and feel of my skin, also how I felt inside. 

This is why I developed Elise Marques London, I learned I matter and I want you to remember that You Matter. 

 

What's Inside Our Products:

 

We are excited to get our highly anticipated products into your hands, on your faces and bodies!

We are true advocates here at Elise Marques London, we love what we do and we believe that by sticking true to our values and principles, our uniqueness will seamlessly shine through our products.

Your purchase not only means a lot to us, but it benefits you as well. How? Our products contain 0% Chemicals, Parabens, SLS, MI, MCI, Mineral Oils, Microbeads and of course is Never tested on animals.

We use botanically sourced ingredients derived from nature mainly plants, flowers and herbs and avoid as many nasties as possible. We sometimes use fragrances/perfumes which are often actually safer than essential oils especially for some very sensitive skins. This also makes it more accessible for consumers from a commercial point of view. Our primary concern is the safety of customers as we know nature in its purist form isn’t always ideal, however, having a sensible approach, for example some of the alcohols are naturally derived such as Benzyl Alcohol. This makes the products more accessible for different skin types and holds the aroma and colour of the product. It is about getting the balance right in between safety and efficacy. In general we have less than 2% alcohol, perfume and preservatives in our range of products and our packaging is recyclable.

Some of our products are produced right here in the UK and although we make every effort possible to support our local economy, some products are produced in France; this simply ensures the highest quality is achieved. Exceptional quality is paramount to what we do.

If you like to know it all, get to know us more and learn about our vision for the future by clicking here.

Thank you for your time, I hope you have chosen to receive one of our beautiful packages in the mail soon.​​

​

​

​

story:
The purpose of this trip is to bring attention to the public health benefit that community bathhouses and saunas have to offer by restoring a sense of belonging and creativity. At the centre is the relationship with water and nature, which is vital in these times of ecological and human degradation and distress. The journey will highlight and celebrate the stories and the people who embrace this way of life, while inspiring what is possible by building a steam sauna culture in Nova Scotia. The cold damp climate here points to an obvious need to gather in warm cozy spaces!

At this time isolation, speed, disease, nature deprivation, depression, increased exhaustion and burnout, are on the rise. There has never been a greater need or opportunity to create accessible places where people can gather to cleanse, rest, and take a much needed break from screen time. 

The journey is mapped out and you can follow us as we steam and document our way through Denmark, Sweden, Finland, Lithuania, Latvia, Estonia and Iceland. Find us on social media! There will be a final video of the journey, eventually finding its way into a book.

 I am offering theatrical story telling and poems from my sweat pilgrimages in Asia and Europe during the tour and inviting conversation and impressions on experiences and why these places matter.

Your Support

Your financial support is invaluable to me and Steam Space. Every dollar raised will help with:

* Training — On this trip, I will deepen my practice in a sauna offering and treatment through additional training. I look forward to offering this more widely upon my return!

* Travel costs

* Camera

* Insurance

* Accommodations

* Entrance fees

If Steam Space exceeds its target, the funds will go towards the Steam Dream fund to ground a ‘home' for Steam Space. This new home will introduce the first communal steam sauna bathing spa to Nova Scotia (small scale) and consistently accommodate more people by weaving together community health and water. 

There are many ways to support this campaign regardless of your monetary situation. Simply sharing it is a huge contribution and very much appreciated.

Locals can enjoy Steam Space offerings such as body care treatments, aromatic infusions, gatherings, scrub mitts, tree brooms, and workshops.

Wherever you are in the world, you can receive a post card from the Steam Culture Tour! I can also connect you with the Baltic sea by saying your name and offering a stone in your honour.

Thank you for spreading the steam goodness and helping to plant steam culture here in beautiful Nova Scotia!

story:
About PauseNow

 A 27-foot bus will be custom-converted into seven private spaces where visitors can meditate for up to 15 minutes. Each space will be outfitted with a comfortable seat, cushions, a tablet computer and noise-canceling headphones. The tablet will offer a menu of meditations, including guided meditation, chanting, nature soundscapes, mindful music and silence. 

PauseNow will stop at designated spots in downtowns, office parks, hospitals, schools, farmers markets and conventions around the Bay Area. It will also be available for rent by companies that wish to offer meditation as a wellness perk for employees.

 

The Benefits of PauseNow

For Individuals

                    

 

For Companies and Organizations

                 

 

How Your Money Will Help

The bus has been purchased, for $47,000. It is ready to be renovated,
a process that will take four to six weeks. Donations to this campaign will help fund:

Total Costs Estimate: $48,000

Jackie is hoping to raise half of these expenses through this crowdfunding campaign and will use her own funds to pay for the rest.

 

Estimated Timeline

       

 

Perks

We like to call them Thank You Gifts. 

Make sure to "select" a perk on the right hand side of the campaign!

 

          

 

About the Founder

PauseNow was founded by Jackie Corwin, who left a 30-plus-year career in banking to share the benefits of meditation with more people. 
A consistent top national producer at Wells Fargo Bank, Jackie worked long hours against ambitious goals and struggled to find life balance. The stresses of her job brought regular migraines and for years she tried an array of treatments—from medication to massage—but none solved her severe headaches, until she discovered meditation. 

After one particularly stressful day, Jackie put down the phone and 
walked the hallways of her San Francisco office building in search of a
place to calm her mind. She found a quiet nook next to a fire exit, a small oasis away from everyone. From that day on, whenever work stress peaked, she would escape to her spot for 15 minutes. She added a yoga mat, a cushion, a singing bowl and a little plant. There she found peace and, when she did, her migraines eased. 

One afternoon, as she walked to her space, she looked down from a window at Financial District employees buying lunch from food trucks parked on the street—and a light went on. What if there were a “meditation truck” down there? People could take a 15-minute break in their own quiet space and return to work feeling refreshed. The PauseNow idea was born and, in the months that followed, Jackie grew determined to make the idea a reality.

               

"I bow and take a deep pause now to express my abundant and heartfelt gratitude to each and everyone of you."

Jackie Corwin, PauseNow Founder

 

See the full illustrated explainer video: https://vimeo.com/203046031

www.pause-now.com

 

This PauseNow project was designed in collaboration with Behavior Delta, a behavior design consulting team of behavior designers, neuroscientists, and product design experts.

story:
The Concept Behind GuideFul

Justin Whitaker started teaching mindfulness meditation 14 years ago and he's taught students all over the world. One of his students was Bob Funk. Both Justin and Bob came to meditation to improve their mental wellness and find relief from anxiety. It worked and improved their lives in so many more ways, just like it has for so many millions of people around the world.

After meeting, Justin and Bob began work on a unique, accessible, and affordable meditation platform: GuideFul.

There are plenty of apps, CDs, and self-help books out there, but there isn’t a meditation platform that embraces community, coaching, and convenience.

GuideFul brings all the important elements of a successful meditation practice into one place: meditation teachers, video tutorials, guided and live meditations, an online community, meditation check-ins, Q+A podcasts, a mobile app, and so much more.

According to the Mayo Clinic, mindfulness meditation has been proven to 

  • help alleviate anxiety disorders, depression, and sleep disorders
  • boost creativity and cognitive processing
  • cultivate health habits and encourage weight loss
  • improve digestion and lower blood pressure
  • decrease the risk of heart attack
  • decrease the perception of pain

We know and neuroscientists know that we humans have the ability to literally shape our own minds through neuroplasticity. By practicing meditation, we can improve both our mental health and our physical health. Think of it this way: meditation is like a gym for the mind.

And just like at a regular gym, most people stop going. That's why we've been developing GuideFul. A successful meditation practice is dependent upon motivation, guidance, support, and a community. GuideFul helps people stay on track and succeed in their meditation practice.

 

Why We Need You

Our first priority is to have you join the GuideFul community. That’s why we’re offering highly discounted memberships to the GuideFul meditation platform through our IndieGoGo perks. The more people that join GuideFul, the more successful our platform will be for everyone involved.

IndieGoGo backers will get early access to our teachers, forums, and more, to help build the meditation community that will then welcome new members.

By backing us here, you will also help us develop a team of guest teachers. We want to offer you a variety of perspectives on meditation so that you can find the right fit for you.

How We'll Spend the Funds We Raise

One of GuideFul’s meditation guides and founders is Justin. Justin has practiced meditation under many Tibetan teachers including the Karmapa and the Dalia Lama, Japanese and American teachers from the Soto Zen community, Vipassana, Thich Nhat Hanh’s Order of Interbeing, Lin-chi Ch’an (Rinzai Zen), and Samatha (calming) practices.

We want to bring more people like Justin on board for guided courses and live meditations. We’ll invest the money we raise in hiring qualified meditation teachers from all over the world.

The other place we’ll invest in is our website (GuideFul.org) and app to ensure the best user experience possible.

No matter what happens here at IndieGoGo, we’ll be launching GuideFul, but GuideFul will be a lot better with your help.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can’t contribute? That’s ok. Please consider sharing this IndieGoGo campaign on your Social Media netowrks and through email.

Also LIKE us on Facebook and FOLLOW us on Twitter.

story:
The Music Meditation Muse Overview

My name is Roxanne Christian, International Board Certified Music Therapist.  My 12 years experience as a music therapist include, and are not limited to, working for the California Department of Mental Health in one of their psychiatric hospitals, private mental health hospitals in southern California, private and Municipal Nursing Homes in the Durham Region, retirement homes within Durham, and schools within the Durham District School Board.  For more information be sure to visit www.LiveLoveLifeMusic.com were you can see how music therapists are therapists who use music as a tool to facilitate healing, wellness, rehabilitation, and the creative processes. 

Thank you for taking the time to find out more about this initiative.  This campaign is very dear to me.  Many times after my interactive guided music mediations and cool down exercises, people give positive feedback and request these mediations on CD.  It never occurred to me as a priority to put these mediations on CD until one individual reported life altering experiences as a result of doing these mediations; they stated: “this literally saved my life!” This gave birth to the Music Mediation Muse.  A CD that will relax, inspire and empower the individual.

I currently live in the Durham Region and I would love to provide others with a tool that can alter their life for the better.  I value education.  I love and server seniors who have paved the way before us and deserve a good quality of life with activities to look forward to.  As a facilitator of music therapy sessions for those struggling with mental health as well as a recipient of psychotherapy, I value the need for healthy, supportive and creative outlets for healing.  These are the reasons I have chosen to gift the Municipal Nursing Homes within the Durham Region, all the 131 schools within the Durham District School Board, all the Centers for Addiction and Mental Health in the Greater Toronto Area, and the Unison Benevolent Fund.  These organizations will be able to use this interactive guided music meditation CD within group settings as an activity, or individuals can listen to the CD on their own as a powerful to escape and help one self-regulate their mood to better function in life.   

What We Need & What You Get

This initiate needs to raise $3,911.33 for the studio production, mastering of the tracks, duplication, packaging, and the distributing of 500 CDs to go out to these community organizations.

What can you do?

  • Donate  to the cause

What do you get?

  • Donations under $40.00 help get this CD made and gifted to the community
  • Donations between $40.00  - $99.00
    •  receive a free CD and help get this CD made and gifted to the community
  • Donations between $100.00  - $249.99
    • receive a 3 free CDs and help get this CD made to the community
    • receive a complimentary music therapy session  for an individual, group, or organization of your choice facilitating up to 200 people within the GTA and Durham Region
  • Donations of $250.00 +
    • 3 CDs shipped to all of your organization’s locations and help get this CD made and gifted to the community
    • Your name or organization’s name thanked and written about in an article distributed in Move Magazine
    • Your organization’s name listed on the CD album art as a contributor
    • You’re organization promoted through Live Love Life’s Music Social Media feeds
    • Your organization receives media recognition and promotion through Live Love Life Music’s Newsletter
    • Receive a complimentary 1 hour music therapy session  for an individual, group, or organization of your choice facilitating up to 200 people within the GTA and Durham Region

 

Every $100 raised above the target goal goes towards gifting groups or organizations within the community who are unable to afford music therapy with 1 music therapy session at no cost. Every individual who donates can provide the name of an organization they would like to receive music therapy sessions at no cost.

A receipt for all contributions indicating what you donated to is given upon request.

Should the target goal not be reached all funds will go towards funding organizations that are unable to afford music therapy with music therapy sessions at no cost. 

 

Who do you help?

  • You will be the cause for empowering, relaxing, and inspiring individuals to feel better about themselves so they can self regulate their mood through this interactive music meditation tool
  • Your contribution helps in delivering this gift to other organizations

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please spread the word
  • Text, email and post the link of my video and this donating platform site
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
