receive a complimentary music therapy session  for an individual, group, or organization of your choice facilitating up to 200 people within the GTA and Durham Region



Donations of $250.00 +
3 CDs shipped to all of your organization’s locations and help get this CD made and gifted to the community
Your name or organization’s name thanked and written about in an article distributed in Move Magazine
Your organization’s name listed on the CD album art as a contributor
You’re organization promoted through Live Love Life’s Music Social Media feeds
Your organization receives media recognition and promotion through Live Love Life Music’s Newsletter
Receive a complimentary 1 hour music therapy session  for an individual, group, or organization of your choice facilitating up to 200 people within the GTA and Durham Region


 Every $100 raised above the target goal goes towards gifting groups or organizations within the community who are unable to afford music therapy with 1 music therapy session at no cost. Every individual who donates can provide the name of an organization they would like to receive music therapy sessions at no cost.A receipt for all contributions indicating what you donated to is given upon request.Should the target goal not be reached all funds will go towards funding organizations that are unable to afford music therapy with music therapy sessions at no cost.  Who do you help?You will be the cause for empowering, relaxing, and inspiring individuals to feel better about themselves so they can self regulate their mood through this interactive music meditation toolYour contribution helps in delivering this gift to other organizationsOther Ways You Can Help
Please spread the word
Text, email and post the link of my video and this donating platform site
Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
WHO, WHAT & WHERE:

Howdy, y’all! My name is KEN and I have a dream that I am trying to turn into a reality. I want to establish a unique cemetery unlike any other in the USA, in a very unique town, unlike any other in the world: Pioneertown, CA. Before I tell you more about that dream, I want to make sure that you know where I am writing you from..

Pioneertown, USA is a small town in the High Deserts of southern California that forever changed the history of Western Cinema! The town was established in 1946, when actor Dick Curtis shared his dream for a “living breathing movie set”. Shortly afterwards, seventeen investors, including Curtis and his celebrity friends, Roy Rogers, Dale Evans, The Sons of the Pioneers, Russell Hayden and Bud Abbott, all invested and incorporated. They purchased 32,ooo acres of land with a simple goal: to create a place where they could all work and play with friends, family and co-workers. It was to be an 188o’s themed town which was easily accessible from both Los Angeles & Palm Springs, that would serve as a fully functioning filming location, vacation destination & permanent High Desert neighborhood!

The first structures established were fully functional businesses like the Land Office, White’s Grocery, the Townhouse Motel, the Red Dog Saloon, the Golden Stallion Restaurant, Maggie’s Feed Barn, Nell’s Ice Cream Palace, Pioneertown Likker, the Klip ‘N’ Kurl Beauty Shop, Pioneer Bowl, Trigger Bill’s Shooting Gallery & the Pioneertown Gazette; just to name a few. Ranch sites with utilities soon to be available and road access already established were offered starting as low as $9oo for over an acre of land! Pioneertown became a legitimate town with its own zip code, an established community and big plans for expansion.

Pioneertown was a dream come true for Western film producers and soon caught the attention of numerous Hollywood studios. All six seasons of The Cisco Kid, all five seasons of The Gene Autry Show, all three seasons of The Range Rider & the Annie Oakley show, both seasons of Buffalo Bill Jr. & 26 Men as well as the entire Judge Roy Bean series were all filmed or framed in Pioneertown. In addition to Roy Rogers, Dale Evans and The Sons of the Pioneers, the tiny town was host to actors, producers and directors like Gene Autry, Philip N. Krasne, Frank McDonald, Spencer Bennet, Rex Blair, Armand Schaefer, John English, John Sturges, George Archainbaud, Duncan Renaldo, Leo Carrillo, Minna Gombelle, Pat Buttram, Smiley Burnette, Gail Davis, Frank Richards, Gloria Henry, Robert Livingston, Jack O'Mahoney, Barbara Stanwyck, Barry Sullivan, Ralph Meeker, Peggy Stewart, Dickie Moore, William Fawcett, Kirby Grant, James Griffith, Lew Ayres, Teresa Wright, Thurston Hall, Harry Lauter, Anne James and many, many more.

You will find that Pioneertown’s Mane Street, the heart of the town, where only horse an foot traffic is allowed, is only a few city blocks long. Businesses here have dwindled and thrived, back and forth. But the die-hard community has always remained committed to keeping Pioneertown alive. And while a demand for western filming locations has died down, the town is still a fully functioning production set where movies, independent films, music videos and commercials are filmed every month. Today, Mane Street in Pioneertown still retains its charm and Old West image. Visitors are welcome to come enjoy Pioneertown any day of the week; but weekends are when the town really comes to life!

Retail stores and art studios are located on Mane Street and the Pioneertown Corrals Campground is right around the corner. There are also numerous false fronts in town, like the Bank, Bath House, Jail, Saloon and the Mining Corporation. They are great for pictures, fun for kids and a wonderful distraction to help you forget about the hustle of the big city. You can even catch a gunfight on Mane Street during most of the warmer weekends! Just about everyone who comes to Pioneertown visits the local restaurant/bar, Pappy and Harriet’s Pioneertown Palace, or “Pappy & Harriet's”, as the locals call it.

WHY:

Now.. that dream I am trying to turn into a reality, that I was talking about earlier.. I want to establish a cemetery in Pioneertown!

Over the years, Pioneertown found itself in the hands of several different owners, before being divided up into the privately-owned properties that it is today. But there has never been a cemetery planned for the town! The nearest cemeteries, and actually some of the only cemeteries in southern California’s High Desert, are down in Joshua Tree and Twentynine Palms. At Pioneertown’s level of fame, with its community’s degree of passion and with the town’s overall level of western American tradition.. Doesn’t it make sense that there should be a cemetery in Pioneertown? Just think of the number of celebrities and members of the community, both past and present, who would have enjoyed being able to enjoy Pioneertown forever!

Furthermore, focusing on the original theme of the town, Creative Synergy, said cemetery should have a unique dual purpose. . .

While there is plenty to do, see and enjoy in Pioneertown - Its residents, its visitors and Mane Street in particular, could truly benefit from a few extra amenities which the town currently does not have. With all of this in mind, I have formed a new corporation in the great State of California with the task of designing, developing, maintaining, promoting and ultimately preserving, indefinitely, the Pioneertown Preservation Park Project: a cemetery unlike any other in the world!

The Pioneertown Preservation Park Project (P4) intends to harvest the greatest past and present internment designs and technology to allow for maximum use of both space and resources. In addition to this, P4 aims to incorporate a revolutionary long-term cemetery financing plan by offering, from the start, amenities which present day cemeteries are only starting to offer. Said amenities should synergistically benefit both residents of and visitors to Pioneertown. In correlation with the numerous potential non-traditional amenities that P4 aims to offer, this necropolis intends to have a goal unlike many modern-day burial grounds: The celebration and preservation of life; both before and after death. Think of a Cemetery that also acts like a community center. Well- that’s exactly what P4 is going for!

This campaign is one of P4’s first major steps towards trying to establish a cemetery in Pioneertown. It is also your chance to help contribute to what will be one of the most unique and celebrated cemeteries in the USA!

HOW:

P4 has some pretty big goals. A lot of work has already been done and momentum is building; but there is a lot more work to do before the ball can really start to roll. A plan has been established and further funding is needed to help P4 reach the next levels of research, development and overall capitalization.

A website has been created to help everyone understand P4’s numerous ideas, goals, plans and the cool Backer Rewards that P4 has come up with. Check out  www.PioneertownPreservationPark.com to see more information on the project!

We also have a Facebook Group Page. If you want to help out but don’t feel like using Indiegogo, please share that website or our Facebook Page with your friends & family.

Word of mouth is, and always has been, very powerful!

The Crowdfunded $5,5oo will be used as follows:

  • -$44o FOR INDIEGOGO/STRIPE FEES   ($5,o6o LEFT)
  • -$15o FOR CROWDFUNDING CAMPAIGN ADVERTISING   ($4,91o LEFT)
  • -$1,1oo (ESTIMATED) FOR CROWDFUNDING CAMPAIGN BACKER REWARDS   ($3,81o LEFT)
  • -$1,35o (ESTIMATED) TO ISSUE COMMEMORATIVE LINE OF COINS    ($2,46o LEFT)
  • -$2,21o FOR 3' WIDE COIN FUNNEL    ($25o LEFT)
  • -$25o FOR BUFFER & FURTHER P4 R&D

This is a Flexible Goal. If we don’t reach our $5,5oo goal, then the funds raised will be used as follows:

  • ANY P4 FUNDING GENERATED BEFORE WE HIT THE $3,ooo MARK WILL GO TOWARDS THE CROWDFUNDING EXPENSES, BACKER REWARDS AND FURTHER P4 R&D
  • IF P4 REACHES $3,ooo OR MORE IN BACKER FUNDING, WE CAN ISSUE THE COMMEMORATIVE LINE OF COINS
  • IF P4 THEN REACHES $5,5oo OR MORE IN BACKER FUNDING, WE WILL ALSO SETUP THE 3' WIDE COIN FUNNEL

If the campaign passes its $5,5oo goal and an extended goal of $8,ooo is reached, the funds raised will be used as follows:

  • P4 WILL ALSO ISSUE A SPECIAL SERIES OF CAMPAIGN BACKER REWARDS
  • P4 WILL PURCHASE A 7' WIDE COIN FUNNEL INSTEAD OF THE 3' FUNNEL

BACKER REWARDS:

  1. $1o  -  pdf Version of PIONEERTOWN USA     Help us out and learn about Pioneertown.. Score an emailed .pdf copy of the book PIONEERTOWN, USA! This is the definitive history of Pioneertown. 15 Chapters and 299 Pages, Packed with Pioneertown pictures, maps, history and love!

  2. $1o  -  Limited P4 Postcard Mailed 2 U     Help us out and we will drop you a line! Get a limited edition P4 Postcard with a personally written "thank you" message, mailed to you from the Pioneertown, USA Post Office. These will make great gifts or will look great framed. The design for these Postcards will be released on November 1st. (Please Add $5 for International Shipping)

  3. $1o  -  Commemorative Pioneertown Coin     One limited edition Commemorative Pioneertown Coin mailed to you via USPS First Class Mail. The design for these coins will be released November 1st. They will be two sided, made of aluminum, 1.25" in diameter, 3+mm wide & will be adorned with Pioneertown History Free USPS Shipping Anywhere in the USA! (Please add $5 for International Shipping.)

  4. $25  -  Backer Bundle 1, Rewards 1,2&3     Here is your chance to get a Backer Bundle! Backer Bundle 1 includes: - .pdf Version of the Book PIONEERTOWN, USA - A Limited Edition P4 Postcard mailed to you from the Pioneertown Post Office &... - A Limited Edition Pioneertown Commemorative Coin Free USPS Shipping Anywhere in the USA! (Please add $8 for International Shipping.)

  5. $25  -  Limited Edition P4 T-Shirt     "Proud Supporter of Pioneertown Preservation Park" Unisex T-Shirts! Choose from sizes Small, Medium, Large, XLarge & 2XLarge. Choose from colors Grey, Brown, Moss & Sand. Image will vary as the actual design won't be released until November 1st. Free USPS Shipping anywhere in the USA! (Please add $12 for International Shipping.)

  6. $25  -  PIONEERTOWN, USA (B&W BOOK)     Help us out and learn about Pioneertown.. Grab a Physical Copy of the book PIONEERTOWN, USA, mailed to you before Christmas! This is the definitive history of Pioneertown. 15 Chapters and 299 Pages, Packed with Pioneertown pictures, maps, history and love! Free USPS shipping anywhere in the USA! Please add $15 for International Shipping.

  7. $5o  -  Backer Bundle2 Rewards1-3, 5&6        Backer Bundle 2 includes: - .pdf Version of the Book PIONEERTOWN, USA - Limited Edition P4 Postcard mailed to you from the Pioneertown Post Office - Limited Edition Pioneertown Commemorative Coin - Limited Edition P4 T-Shirt &.. - Physical Copy of the book PIONEERTOWN, USA Free Shipping in the USA! (Please Add $2o For International Shipping.)

  8. $5o  -  Set of 8 Pioneertown Coins     Eight limited edition Commemorative Pioneertown Coins mailed to you via USPS First Class Mail. The design for these coins will be released November 1st. They will be two sided, made of aluminum, 1.25" in diameter, 3+mm wide & will be adorned with Pioneertown History Free USPS Shipping Anywhere in the USA! Please add $1o for International Shipping.

  9. $5o  -  3o Ounce P4 Steel Water Bottle     Everyone needs to hydrate. Especially in the desert! These 3o Ounce Stainless Steel Water Bottles don't just look cool; they keep drinks super cool for approximately 12 hours! The actual designs for these Limited Edition P4 bottles will be released on November 1st. Free USPS Shipping Anywhere in the USA! (Please Add $25 For International Shipping.)

  10. $125  -  PIONEERTOWN LAND CO Board Game     Grab a copy of the official board game of Pioneertown: PIONEERTOWN LAND CO! This historically accurate game teaches you about local history and is fun for the whole family. 2-6 Players / Average Playtime is 9o Minutes. Buy & Build Pioneertown as you learn about it! Free USPS Shipping Anywhere in the USA! (Please Add $5o For International Shipping,)

  11. $25o  -  Backer Bundle 3! All Rewards!           Backer Bundle 3: -.pdf Version & Physical Copy of the book PIONEERTOWN, USA -Limited Edition P4 Postcard mailed from the Pioneertown Post Office -1o Limited Edition Pioneertown Commemorative Coins -Limited Edition P4 T-Shirt -3o Ounce Water Bottle -PIONEERTOWN LAND CO Board Game Free Shipping in the USA! (Please Add $1oo For International Shipping)

RISKS & CHALLENGES:

The plan that P4 has setup leaves very little to risk. There are, however, a bunch of challenges ahead! But this campaign is setup rather risk free, as the funding is being gathered simply to further P4 research & development. P4 isn’t guaranteeing anything other than the Backer Rewards. The rewards are easily produced and the campaign’s ending date leaves us enough time to ensure that All US backer’s rewards will be shipped out Before the 2o18 Christmas Deadline.

WHAT ARE SOME OF THE AMENITIES P4 MIGHT PROVIDE?

Bird Watching Platforms, Children’s Playground Equipment, a Non-Denominational Church, a Coffee/Concession Stand, a Community Center, a Community Garden, a Memorial Courtyard & Wishing Well, a Dog Park & Poop Stations, a Gym, more Hiking Trails, Horse Corrals For Visitors, Laundry Services, a Meals on Wheels Setup, “Outhouses”, an Outdoor Theater, a Pioneertown Radio Station, a “Pond/Lake” & a “Spring Fed Stream”, Shaded Areas, Picnic Tables, possibly a BBQ Pit, a Baseball Field, Bleachers, Basketball Courts, Tennis Courts, a Miniature Golf Course, a staged Old-Timey Cemetery, a Bambi Bucket House, a Wellness Garden, an XTRA Large XMAS Tree and a Yard Art Garden.

story:
Få floating til Odense

De mest afslappende omgivelser, et menneske kan opleve. I dag er verdenen ofte larmende og stressende. Floating eliminerer stress ved at reducere distraktioner (sensoriske input).

Et bad (pod) med saltvand, opvarmet til kropstemperatur, reducerer opfattelsen af tyngdekraft, lyd, lys, temperatur og mere. Floating har utallige beviste fordele og en stress-fri oplevelse er garanteret. Læs mere nedenfor.

Du kan hjælpe med at bringe denne praksis til Odense ved at forudbestille floats her via Indiegogo.

I tvivl? Indiegogo returnerer din donation, hvis vi imislykkes med at nå vores mål.



Plan over TAP floating-lokale (med absolut privatliv) 

 

Hvad er TAP?

TAP (Take A Pause) er en ny virksomhed, der vil bringe floating til Odense. Vi er et team på 3, der i øjeblikket arbejder fuld tid på udviklingen af TAP.
Men TAP er ikke blot floating. Vi lærer folk at skære gennem larmen i den moderne verden. Floating + Rest & Reflect bryder den cyklus af informationsoverbelastning, og hjælper den praktiserende med at kontrollere sin opmærksomhed.


Plan over TAP's reception

- Hvad mener andre? -

Nogle af de mest talentfulde og indflydelsesrige folk inden for kunst, videnskab, forretning og idrætsgrene anvender floating til at dekomprimere og skærpe deres mentale fokus, forbedre helbred og øge kreativiteten… De skal være deres bedste selv, og det skal du også. - floatmilwaukee

Forbes: Dit livs bedste lur. Når du kravler ud af pod’en, er der en følelse af at være fuldt opladet til en ny travl uge forude. Cortisolniveauerne bliver sænket bemærkelsesværdigt, så alle følelser af stress, spændinger og angst viskes væk.

Health.com: Få yderligere minutter inde i min session begynder jeg at forstå, hvorfor folk gør det her: Som jeg fokuserer på mit åndedræt – ind og ud – smelter mine spændinger væk. Jeg lukker mine øjne, og forestiller mig selv svæve på en sky.

ABC Everyday: Fordele kan variere fra reducering af stress til forbedret søvn, afgiftning, øget muskelgenoprettelse, reduceret blodtryk og smertelindring.

Joe Rogan: "Den sensoriske deprivationstank er det vigtigste værktøj, jeg nogensinde har brugt til udvikling af mit sind, til at tænke, til at udvikle mig selv."

Emma Watson: “For nyligt prøvede jeg en float-pod, som for mig lød sindssygt, men jeg elskede det faktisk. Float-pod’en gav et særligt sted til meditation, som jeg synes, var en stor hjælp.”

Robert Downey Jr. har en float-pod installeret i sit hjem i Hollywood.

Tim Ferris: Jeg ser floating som en af de mest angst-reducerende oplevelser, jeg nogensidnde har haft… jeg gjorde det som meditatorisk genopladning”

Jennifer Lawrence “havde en skøn oplevelse med floating”

Hvorfor er floating nødvendigt?

Den eksponentielle øgning af tilgængelig information, resulterer direkte i øgede stressniveauer. Det er blevet umuligt at følge med, men vi bliver ved med at prøve. 

I dag er vi alle overeksponerede til reklamer (+2000 om dagen) og konsumerer ekstreme mængder af information. I løbet af 1 dag lærer vi mere end det gennemsnitlige menneske i det 18. århundrede gjorde i løbet af hele sit liv. Tag et øjeblik og tænk over det. Vores hjerner er stadig de samme, men vi presser dem så langt ud over deres naturlige kapacitet hver dag, at det ikke er nogen overraskelse, vi føler os stressede.

Vision

Vi er alle passionerede om at hjælpe vores fællesskab med at håndtere stress, heale og vokse. Med praktisering af Rest & Reflection, vil fællesskaber lære at budgettere deres opmærksomhed til det, der er vigtigst, have øget kontrol over deres vaner og deres identitet.

Læs mere på vores Web.

Er det noget for dig?

Ved at bakke op om vores Indiegogo-kampagne køber du ikke blot floats, og gør TAP's vision til virkelighed i Odense; du begynder en rejse mod helbredelse af stress og spændinger, akkumuleret i din krop og dit sind gennem hele livet.

TAP er rigtigt for dig, der investerer i dit helbred, både mentalt og fysisk, og/eller hvis du aktivt søger selvudvikling.

Vil du have floating til Odense?

- Få det til at ske ved at støtte denne kampagne!
story_txt: Få floating til OdenseDe mest afslappende omgivelser, et menneske kan opleve. I dag er verdenen ofte larmende og stressende. Floating eliminerer stress ved at reducere distraktioner (sensoriske input).Et bad (pod) med saltvand, opvarmet til kropstemperatur, reducerer opfattelsen af tyngdekraft, lyd, lys, temperatur og mere. Floating har utallige beviste fordele og en stress-fri oplevelse er garanteret. Læs mere nedenfor.Du kan hjælpe med at bringe denne praksis til Odense ved at forudbestille floats her via Indiegogo.I tvivl? Indiegogo returnerer din donation, hvis vi imislykkes med at nå vores mål.Plan over TAP floating-lokale (med absolut privatliv)  Hvad er TAP?TAP (Take A Pause) er en ny virksomhed, der vil bringe floating til Odense. Vi er et team på 3, der i øjeblikket arbejder fuld tid på udviklingen af TAP.Men TAP er ikke blot floating. Vi lærer folk at skære gennem larmen i den moderne verden. Floating + Rest & Reflect bryder den cyklus af informationsoverbelastning, og hjælper den praktiserende med at kontrollere sin opmærksomhed.Plan over TAP's reception- Hvad mener andre? -Nogle af de mest talentfulde og indflydelsesrige folk inden for kunst, videnskab, forretning og idrætsgrene anvender floating til at dekomprimere og skærpe deres mentale fokus, forbedre helbred og øge kreativiteten… De skal være deres bedste selv, og det skal du også. - floatmilwaukeeForbes: Dit livs bedste lur. I løbet af 1 dag lærer vi mere end det gennemsnitlige menneske i det 18. århundrede gjorde i løbet af hele sit liv. Tag et øjeblik og tænk over det. Vores hjerner er stadig de samme, men vi presser dem så langt ud over deres naturlige kapacitet hver dag, at det ikke er nogen overraskelse, vi føler os stressede.VisionVi er alle passionerede om at hjælpe vores fællesskab med at håndtere stress, heale og vokse. Med praktisering af Rest & Reflection, vil fællesskaber lære at budgettere deres opmærksomhed til det, der er vigtigst, have øget kontrol over deres vaner og deres identitet.Læs mere på vores Web.Er det noget for dig?Ved at bakke op om vores Indiegogo-kampagne køber du ikke blot floats, og gør TAP's vision til virkelighed i Odense; du begynder en rejse mod helbredelse af stress og spændinger, akkumuleret i din krop og dit sind gennem hele livet.TAP er rigtigt for dig, der investerer i dit helbred, både mentalt og fysisk, og/eller hvis du aktivt søger selvudvikling.Vil du have floating til Odense?- Få det til at ske ved at støtte denne kampagne!

story:
Short Summary

Hello , my name is Brian Michetti.    I am a surfer from the 70's in Northern California. I first came here in 2001 . I have been living here in Peru for about seven years now with my 2 small children. I came to this famous location specifically to fulfill my childhood dream of this beach. Most of those years I spent here surfing Chicama, the longest wave in the world. Now I want to help share this amazing wave with the rest of the world, so I opened a hostal on the beach (also because i needed income).

IN March of 2017, NORTHERN PERU  suffered severe flooding, paralyzing the country for a few weeks. We are still recovering from this natural disaster.  The city is rebuilding the entire beachfront of this town. It will be finished and reopened in january of 2018. Until then we need help making ends meet. We are still open but our main entrance is blocked by construction, thus our income has been cut in half.  

By helping us now, we can survive this disaster and grow firmly into the  fantastic hostal we were meant to be. I can live my dream and provide an incredible future for my children for decades to come, future tourists can have fine dining and excellent accomodations here in this not so comfortable part of the world. We provide alot to our fellow surfer and backpacker to help them live their dreams as well..

What We Need & What You Get

I will break it down for you folks in more detail:

  • We are looking for about $3,500 usd. Every month we are short about  $800 us dollars just to pay the bare minimum of expenses, utilities and food and medicines and costs to run the hostel, wages, etc..  So if we can get september, october, november and decembers' losses covered then we can stretch to january and expect an increase in sales as the new beachfront opens up to the town and surrounding communities justin time for its summer crowds.

The Impact

Let me explain more about my campaign and let you all know the difference your contribution will make:

  • My project will bring peace to my family.  It will provide much needed relief for us and allow more quality time with my children. Being a single parent in a foreign country has its challenges and can take its toll.  I have diabetes and have been told that stress is a major contributor to this disease. I love my life here and just need a bit of help for a few months. i have worked hard all my life and this would reinforce my faith in humanity.
  • When I first came here from California in 2001,  I had a desire to become part of the community. I bought property and hired locals to construct additions. I have since become well integrated amongst the local community. My Hostal business has contributed greatly to the local community which is extremely poor. More poor than you have probably ever seen first hand. We are constantly working with everyone here to provide better lives, and jobs. This town is small and isolated, the locals know little about a modern day world and we do what we can to bring the two worlds together. They have helped me raise my children and taught me what life is really about, i have found a greater purpose and i treasure it. i came here to surf the longest wave in the world and what i  received was far above that of my wildest dreams.
  • I will be able to pay the employees in a much more timely manner. This relieves much stress for them and their families. This  project will help many people and their families.
  • I was receiving help from my mother since the flooding struck us in March. She has now become seriously ill and can no longer do anything more. I asked my daughter for a bit of money and she, being so eager to help came up with this information. i must now try it as i have exhausted all my other options. 
  • This project will help keep my immigration status current and legal for me and my 2 children.

i hope you value my transparency. i dont have much time to prepare these campaigns, i work 7 days a week all day long, runnning the hostal and its restaurant and raising my two children. I wish i had the time to provide more details, more adjectives and more love. if you ever make it down here you will be treated well, so very well, as all our guests are treated.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • i would ask you to get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.
  • Remember , you too can to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

i would ask you to get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.
Remember , you too can to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Welcome! 

Hi, I'm Tracey Price. I live British Columbia and have a love for children (who doesn't right?!) Particularly and not exclusive, the 3 to 5 years old's that attend my school in Entebbe, Uganda. 

"How does a woman from BC open a school in Uganda" you're probably thinking.. Well, I also love to run marathons.. health and wellness are passions of mine. I was in South Africa for race several years ago and after the race I traveled a bit. When i was visiting Entebbe, I noticed that many of the young children where just hanging around when what in my mind should have been a school day. I quickly found out that there were few schools they could attend and cost was another barrier. Immediately I set out to open a school. 

Today, over a hundred 3 to 5 year old's attend St. Micheal's school each year. We are proud of our achievement and want to build upon that success.  

OUR WHY

Recently, it dawned on the me that should something happen to me, the school would close since I'm the school's sole source of funding. 

And that is how Price Wellness House (PWH) was born. In the fall of 2015, the idea of financial sustainability put me in the direction of assembling a team to create a center that would provide health and wellness education as well as medical care for local women with AIDS/HIV. The business model is to market services that would cover Price Wellness House's and St. Micheal's operation costs. Making St. Micheal's school the beneficiary of PWH's success. Your contribution funds St. Micheals school  indefinitely, no more annual funding drives! 

TAKING ACTION

Last fall and winter, celebrity designer Emmanuel Belliveau from Toronto, headed up the task of designing the center. Together with Amon (architect in Uganda), they finalized the drawings,  applied for building permits and began construction earlier this year. 

I took the team to the Uganda this past November to check in on the progress. Emmanuel verified all the plans and got to meet Amon for the first time in person. Amon, is a huge asset to this team, as through him we were able to hire 14 locals to build the structure. It was very important for us to hire locals as they should benefit as much as possible from PWH presence. I'm happy to report the structure is coming along beautifully and I am so excited about what this means for many locals.

HOW THE COMMUNITY, LOCAL AND AT LARGE BENEFIT

With 8 guests rooms, learning center, kitchen, fitness center, roof top deck for sunrise and sunset yoga and outdoor pool we plan to host retreats; Yoga, mindfulness, safari, nutrition, NGO's, Corporate etc..

The medical clinic will be run 4 days a week by a private doctor and then 3 days a week as a free community clinic. The host and their guests will be invited to do some community interaction through special classes held at the center for locals to participate in as well as going to the school to interact with the children. Our large kitchen will give guests the opportunity to cook lunch for the kids too should they wish. Our learning centre will offer vocational courses for local women to enter the work force or possibly start their own business. We feel there is so  much potential with this center that the current ideas we have are just touching the surface of what is actually possible once the center is complete by your funding.

Your contributions will help not only locals, but those around the world seeking a way to contribute in a positive and uplifting way. We can't solve all the problems of the world all of the time, but we can be a positive influence most of the time. 

"THOUGHTS BECOME THINGS"

We are almost complete phase 1 of our project at a cost of almost $90,000. The shell of the building is up and now its time to finish the interiors and then finalize all the furnishings and decor as well as equipment and landscaping . During all this, we will create our day to day operations plan, seeking out bold peacocks with tribes who want to enjoy PWH.  AND, before thoughts can become things, we need your help! 

In order to get to occupancy, we need your help to finish:

Phase 2  

INTERIORS ($70,000 approx)

Wall plastering, plumbing and fixtures, electrical and lighting fixtures, kitchen cabinets, bathroom vanities, wall and floor tiles, paint etc..and labor.

 Phase 3

A. FURNISHING / EQUIPMENT / DECOR ($90,000 approx)

Bedroom furniture, class room furniture, computers for learning center, medical equipment for clinic, commercial kitchen appliances, washer and dryer, dinning and living room furniture, outdoor furniture, etc

B. EXTERIOR ($40,000 approx)

Landscaping, pool, security gate, fence, security system and labor.

PERKS

We have a unique set of perks available. We felt it was best to offer you something where you could really put your name on this project, have an opportunity to enjoy the center yourself and make it possible for someone locally to benefit from your contribution in a personal way. 

Put a Name on it. 

Align yourself with this project in a unique way! Many companies put their name behind projects as there is a core value that is in keeping with their brand or thinking. As an individual, the opportunity rarely comes up, so we'd love to offer this as an option.

Guest Room Dedication $3000

Get aligned with PWH with this perk. Guest room door and map will have your name on it, a card inside the room tells the guest of your support. And, that's not all, you get 1 week of accommodations for 2, airport pick up and drop off, breakfast each day and access to amenities. And..book future stays for 50% of reg day rate. Trip is transferable as gift.

If you are interested in the Medical Clinic, Fitness Center, Learning Center and Kitchen, please email us directly at pricewellnesshouse@gmail.com 

7 Days Accommodations/Food/Queen Elizabeth Park Safari $1900

7 glorious days in the Pearl of Africa for 2. Stay at PWH, Airport Pick Up and Drop Off, Breakfast and Dinner, 1 massage by the pool, 2 Day Trip to Queen Elizabeth Park to see Lions, Elephants, Rhino etc. Access to all PWH amenities. Transferable as gift. All of this for $1900

3 Day Get Away $350

3 relaxing days at PWH for 2. Airport Pick Up and Drop off, Breakfast and Dinner, Access to all amenities and a massage by the pool. Transferable as a gift. I feel relaxed writing this. This perk is just $350

Fitness Center Passes $150

We are offering one year passes for $150 to the fitness center that can be transferred to a local as we realize that not all of your will be able to come to Uganda! Our goal is to create a list of potential donor recipients so locals can directly feel your contribution. 

Gift Certificates for learning $50

We are offering gift certificates for learning for $50. Through the center we plan to offer many different types of classes through the various experts we will have at the center. These gift certificates will provide access for a local to enjoy. 

Gift of Support $25

You get our gratitude and the knowledge that you are helping make a difference for local women and children AND are keeping St. Micheal's school funded. We will also put you on our list to receive a 50% discount on future room bookings. 

Once PWH is up and running, I want to assure you that all profits will stay in Uganda to support the locals, to provide more programs, build better futures...I don't need the money, I just want them (the school) to be sustainable! - Tracey Price. 

 

Who's Behind This Project

Tracey Price - lives in Vancouver, BC Canada. She's an entrepreneur, multiple franchisee owner, founder of St. Micheal's School and Price Wellness House. 

Tracey has been an entrepenuer as long as she can remember starting as a retailer for Imperial Oil in her twenties and becoming a franchisee of 3 Tim Horton's restaurants which she is still actively involved in, this past year she celebrated her twenty year partnership and looks forward to her continued success with Tim Horton's.

Tracey is a compassionate supporter of empowering others through education , health and wellness, her journey took her to Uganda where she found a huge need for education , in 2010 she founded and built St. Michael's school. 

Tracey started running 18 years ago, she has competed in many race distances from 5km to the Comrades 89km Ultra Marathon and looks forward to many more races..

Tracey is very happy to call Uganda her second home and in 2013 she purchased a plot of land in Entebbe not knowing exactly what she would do with it,in 2015 a vision came to her to build a health and wellness center so she could give back to the community and a guesthouse for travelers to enjoy the beauty of Uganda

To me, entrepreneurship = independence...so being able to offer services like wellness education or hospitality training that will empower the women and give them a sense of independence is important to me.

- Tracey Price, Founder of PWC

Emmanuel Belliveau - lives in Toronto, ON Canada. He's a creative director at his own design business, former TV Host of several international home design shows including World's Greenest Homes seen on HGTV and presently on Save Our Shelter on the CW.  Emmanuel is Creative director and part owner at Marko Taylor, a handbag company based in Kenya.

Born in the East Coast of Canada, Emmanuel' s Filipino and french Canadian roots have given him a dual perspective that he says "can sometimes look like I"m riding the fence on issues, however it allows me to see three sides to many stories. It's created room for compassion and acceptance for many of life's differences". This project is important to him as his own mother is his inspiration. Her journey to immigrate to Canada was solely to offer a future generation options that she did not have. This project could do that. 

"The success of this project is not the completion of the physical building, its the progress that is occurs from the communities involvement with the centre, we see this as a hand-up, not a hand out "

- Emmanuel Belliveau, Creative Director of PWH

See the Complete Video of Price Wellness House / St.Michael's School below:

 

Risks & Challenges

Your money is going to build the physical building, it pays for materials, equipment and labour. Any extra money that is collected beyond our goal will be set aside to purchase the property next door as we have another goal of adding more guest rooms and meeting rooms. Guests rooms in Entebbe are hard to come by, so we know we can generate extra revenue for PWH by renting to groups like the UN and NGO personel.  Long term, we'd like to duplicate this model in other cities/countries. 

Our goal is to have an opening ceremony in Sept of 2017. Construction is moving well, however as with any international project there have been a few minor delays with equipment availability. Common building materials like wood are hard to come by and are as much as 3 times more expensive, so we are doing primarily concrete and brick construction. All of this work, including digging the concrete piers and foundation wall, is done by hand. Most equipment and finishing materials come in from Europe or the middle East, so cost are not surprisingly higher here.

We have great confidence in our team in Entebbe. Our contractor has great leadership and transparency. When possible, they have always presented multiple quotes for ongoing tenders and point out unnecessary cost by third party contractors. Corruption is very high in Uganda, yet with the local team we have in place, we've managed to avoid any major pitfalls. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute and you reading to this point in our story says you may still want to support our campaign. We encourage you to share our campaign with your friends in person and on as many social media platforms you currently use!  Please one of the many Indiegogo share tools (buttom on toop/bottom)

Again, from Tracey and Emmanuel, we thank you for being a part of this campaign!

It was very important for us to hire locals as they should benefit as much as possible from PWH presence. I'm happy to report the structure is coming along beautifully and I am so excited about what this means for many locals.
HOW THE COMMUNITY, LOCAL AND AT LARGE BENEFIT
With 8 guests rooms, learning center, kitchen, fitness center, roof top deck for sunrise and sunset yoga and outdoor pool we plan to host retreats; Yoga, mindfulness, safari, nutrition, NGO's, Corporate etc..
The medical clinic will be run 4 days a week by a private doctor and then 3 days a week as a free community clinic. The host and their guests will be invited to do some community interaction through special classes held at the center for locals to participate in as well as going to the school to interact with the children. Our large kitchen will give guests the opportunity to cook lunch for the kids too should they wish. Our learning centre will offer vocational courses for local women to enter the work force or possibly start their own business. We feel there is so  much potential with this center that the current ideas we have are just touching the surface of what is actually possible once the center is complete by your funding.
Your contributions will help not only locals, but those around the world seeking a way to contribute in a positive and uplifting way. We can't solve all the problems of the world all of the time, but we can be a positive influence most of the time. 


"THOUGHTS BECOME THINGS"
We are almost complete phase 1 of our project at a cost of almost $90,000. The shell of the building is up and now its time to finish the interiors and then finalize all the furnishings and decor as well as equipment and landscaping . During all this, we will create our day to day operations plan, seeking out bold peacocks with tribes who want to enjoy PWH.  AND, before thoughts can become things, we need your help! 
In order to get to occupancy, we need your help to finish:
Phase 2  
INTERIORS ($70,000 approx)
Wall plastering, plumbing and fixtures, electrical and lighting fixtures, kitchen cabinets, bathroom vanities, wall and floor tiles, paint etc..and labor.
 Phase 3
A. FURNISHING / EQUIPMENT / DECOR ($90,000 approx)
Bedroom furniture, class room furniture, computers for learning center, medical equipment for clinic, commercial kitchen appliances, washer and dryer, dinning and living room furniture, outdoor furniture, etc
B. EXTERIOR ($40,000 approx)
Landscaping, pool, security gate, fence, security system and labor.

PERKS
We have a unique set of perks available. We felt it was best to offer you something where you could really put your name on this project, have an opportunity to enjoy the center yourself and make it possible for someone locally to benefit from your contribution in a personal way. 
Put a Name on it. 
Align yourself with this project in a unique way! Many companies put their name behind projects as there is a core value that is in keeping with their brand or thinking. As an individual, the opportunity rarely comes up, so we'd love to offer this as an option.
Guest Room Dedication $3000
Get aligned with PWH with this perk. Guest room door and map will have your name on it, a card inside the room tells the guest of your support. And, that's not all, you get 1 week of accommodations for 2, airport pick up and drop off, breakfast each day and access to amenities. And..book future stays for 50% of reg day rate. Trip is transferable as gift.

If you are interested in the Medical Clinic, Fitness Center, Learning Center and Kitchen, please email us directly at pricewellnesshouse@gmail.com 
7 Days Accommodations/Food/Queen Elizabeth Park Safari $1900
7 glorious days in the Pearl of Africa for 2. Stay at PWH, Airport Pick Up and Drop Off, Breakfast and Dinner, 1 massage by the pool, 2 Day Trip to Queen Elizabeth Park to see Lions, Elephants, Rhino etc. Access to all PWH amenities. Transferable as gift. All of this for $1900
3 Day Get Away $350
3 relaxing days at PWH for 2. Airport Pick Up and Drop off, Breakfast and Dinner, Access to all amenities and a massage by the pool. Transferable as a gift. I feel relaxed writing this. This perk is just $350
Fitness Center Passes $150
We are offering one year passes for $150 to the fitness center that can be transferred to a local as we realize that not all of your will be able to come to Uganda! Our goal is to create a list of potential donor recipients so locals can directly feel your contribution. 
Gift Certificates for learning $50
We are offering gift certificates for learning for $50. Through the center we plan to offer many different types of classes through the various experts we will have at the center. These gift certificates will provide access for a local to enjoy. 
Gift of Support $25
You get our gratitude and the knowledge that you are helping make a difference for local women and children AND are keeping St. Micheal's school funded. We will also put you on our list to receive a 50% discount on future room bookings. 
Once PWH is up and running, I want to assure you that all profits will stay in Uganda to support the locals, to provide more programs, build better futures...I don't need the money, I just want them (the school) to be sustainable! - Tracey Price. 
 

Who's Behind This Project
Tracey Price - lives in Vancouver, BC Canada. She's an entrepreneur, multiple franchisee owner, founder of St. Micheal's School and Price Wellness House. 
Tracey has been an entrepenuer as long as she can remember starting as a retailer for Imperial Oil in her twenties and becoming a franchisee of 3 Tim Horton's restaurants which she is still actively involved in, this past year she celebrated her twenty year partnership and looks forward to her continued success with Tim Horton's.
Tracey is a compassionate supporter of empowering others through education , health and wellness, her journey took her to Uganda where she found a huge need for education , in 2010 she founded and built St. Michael's school. 
Tracey started running 18 years ago, she has competed in many race distances from 5km to the Comrades 89km Ultra Marathon and looks forward to many more races..
Tracey is very happy to call Uganda her second home and in 2013 she purchased a plot of land in Entebbe not knowing exactly what she would do with it,in 2015 a vision came to her to build a health and wellness center so she could give back to the community and a guesthouse for travelers to enjoy the beauty of Uganda
To me, entrepreneurship = independence...so being able to offer services like wellness education or hospitality training that will empower the women and give them a sense of independence is important to me. 
- Tracey Price, Founder of PWC
Emmanuel Belliveau - lives in Toronto, ON Canada. He's a creative director at his own design business, former TV Host of several international home design shows including World's Greenest Homes seen on HGTV and presently on Save Our Shelter on the CW.  Emmanuel is Creative director and part owner at Marko Taylor, a handbag company based in Kenya.
Born in the East Coast of Canada, Emmanuel' s Filipino and french Canadian roots have given him a dual perspective that he says "can sometimes look like I"m riding the fence on issues, however it allows me to see three sides to many stories. It's created room for compassion and acceptance for many of life's differences". This project is important to him as his own mother is his inspiration. Her journey to immigrate to Canada was solely to offer a future generation options that she did not have. This project could do that. 
"The success of this project is not the completion of the physical building, its the progress that is occurs from the communities involvement with the centre, we see this as a hand-up, not a hand out " 
- Emmanuel Belliveau, Creative Director of PWH
See the Complete Video of Price Wellness House / St.Michael's School below:

 

Risks & Challenges
Your money is going to build the physical building, it pays for materials, equipment and labour. Any extra money that is collected beyond our goal will be set aside to purchase the property next door as we have another goal of adding more guest rooms and meeting rooms. Guests rooms in Entebbe are hard to come by, so we know we can generate extra revenue for PWH by renting to groups like the UN and NGO personel.  Long term, we'd like to duplicate this model in other cities/countries. 
Our goal is to have an opening ceremony in Sept of 2017. Construction is moving well, however as with any international project there have been a few minor delays with equipment availability. Common building materials like wood are hard to come by and are as much as 3 times more expensive, so we are doing primarily concrete and brick construction. All of this work, including digging the concrete piers and foundation wall, is done by hand. Most equipment and finishing materials come in from Europe or the middle East, so cost are not surprisingly higher here.
We have great confidence in our team in Entebbe. Our contractor has great leadership and transparency. When possible, they have always presented multiple quotes for ongoing tenders and point out unnecessary cost by third party contractors. Corruption is very high in Uganda, yet with the local team we have in place, we've managed to avoid any major pitfalls. 

Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute and you reading to this point in our story says you may still want to support our campaign. We encourage you to share our campaign with your friends in person and on as many social media platforms you currently use!  Please one of the many Indiegogo share tools (buttom on toop/bottom)
Again, from Tracey and Emmanuel, we thank you for being a part of this campaign!

story:
What is #MoreThanMyNumbers?

This campaign was started by Kim "Kimmay" Caldwell, a bra fitter since 2005 and an advocate for women. Kimmay is devoted to helping women say hurray inside, outside, and underneath. Educating women on how to find a bra that fits well and feels great it just one way she helps women do that. And in the end, it all comes down to upgrading the conversations women are having with their bodies and themselves. 

When Kimmay first started bra fitting, was was barely 20 years old. In the fitting rooms of NYC, she fit women for A to N cup sizes, 28 to 54 bands, elderly women, young girls, models, mothers, pregnant women, cancer survivors - you name it! And many of them were afraid of what the tag of their bra said, or the number on the measuring tape. Kimmay realized that she, along with the women she was meeting, were defining themselves by numbers. And not just bra size, but other numbers, too. Numbers like salary, age, weight, number of children, Instagram followers, etc. 

The idea for the #MoreThanMyNumbers project started years ago when Kimmay first started her content marketing company. She was partnering with lingerie and intimates brands to upgrade the way they were talking to women, and creating educational and inspirational content with them. Kimmay realized that several of the brands she was working with shared her mission to empower women through undergarments and education. And she realized that so many women across the country and the world needed help to know their numbers, but not be defined by them. 

When you support this campaign project, you are helping women (and men!) around the world get to know their numbers and release any definition from them.

The first purpose and goal of the project is to educate. Through photo and video stories, women of different ages, heights, weights, abilities, and backgrounds will share their bra measurements and bra sizes, along with their stories around numbers. Just being able to see real women, with no photoshopping or airbrushing, sharing their actual measurements and sizing will help women understand bra sizing. Along with that, we're creating and upgrading tools to help women find their bra size starting points. These basic tools can empower a woman to find undergarments that help her stand tall, lead with her heart, and say hurray. I truly believe that when a woman honors and supports this sacred part of her body, she gains the confidence, love, and truth needed to go out in the world and make a difference. 

The second purpose of the project is encourage women on the journey of making peace with their numbers - to help them understand that numbers are information, not a definition. Each woman's powerful story is different, and she is bravely stepping up to share it.

We have applicants from women who are a size 24 and riding an elephant in India, who are 47 and running their first marathon, who were divorced and now remarried and expecting, who were told they were "fat at age 10 and now sharing her numbers with the world.

These stories won't just inspire women. They will change the way that we look at beauty, support, and "real". Help us bring these stories to light. Help us create a powerful windstorm of support, education, and inspiration.

Help us help women of the world stand up to say "I am #MoreThanMyNumbers". 

What We Need & What You Get

Photo and video campaigns require a lot of funding. Your donations help bring each woman's story to life! We have already funded five women's stories during two shoots. Your funds will help us: 

  • Fund at least 8 more women's stories {we have much bigger plans than that, but that's the start}
  • Build or upgrade our website landing pages, create graphics, write copy, and organize the content
  • Pay our all female production team: video, photo, makeup and hair, direction, production, and more 
  • Market and fund our PR campaign to bring this message to a global level, affecting more women across the world

Perks!

  • As a thank you for your donation, perks include one-on-one bra fittings (both in person and virtual) with Kimmay, as well as #MoreThanMyNumbers swag, thank you's on the landing page, and even a photo shoot with the project's photographer! Aside from the perk options, you can also choose any amount to donate.

We aim to continue to produce these stories and get them funded however we can. We're reaching out to you because you can make it happen with us. Your voice, your donation, and your support are so valuable. We can do this together! 

If we don't reach our funding goal here, we will produce as many stories as we can with the collected funds. In addition, we are seeking brand sponsorship - we already have two awesome lingerie/bra brands that have stepped up to support this campaign, and we welcome more! Contact Kimmay for more information on Sponsorship Packages: kimmay(at)hurraykimmay(dot)com

Other Ways You Can Get Involved

There are more ways that you can participate in and support this project! Go to: http://www.hurraykimmay.com/support-more-than-m...

story:
Short Summary

I'm Amy Mayo and I helped start Gable Heart Beats(GHB) in 2009 after my dear friend, Michael Gable (38), passed away unexpectedly from a Sudden Cardiac Arrest. Michael had Hypertrophic Cardiomyopathy (enlarged heart).  His diagnosis was missed because he didn't receive proper screening to detect his condition. An echocardiogram would have potentially saved his life. Two weeks after Michael passed away, his 11 month yr. old daughter (Grace Gable), went into heart failure and was later diagnosed with dilated cardiomyopathy. Grace was in ICU for over a month fighting for her life. Michael's wife, Michelle Gable, and older brother Matteo, prayed for her healthy recovery. After a hard fight, Grace has recovered, plays soccer, and is almost at a normal heart level receiving ECHOs and EKGs regularly.  Often these conditions can be genetic which was the case with Michael and Grace. 


In honor of Michael Gable, our board founded Gable Heart Beats in a worldwide effort to educate and help save lives from the #1 killer, Sudden Cardiac Arrest. We have screened hundreds of families and the funds we raise go towards both heart screenings and AEDs.

GHB Board Members -left to right- Steve and Shawna Lombardi, Amy and Stefan Mayo, Michelle Gable, Kathe and Ralph Barsi. 

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

100% of the funds we raise go towards our heart screenings and AED placement in communities. For every $100 dollars raised, we can screen one person with and ECHO & EKG at no charge. Normally the costs are approximately $1500 per person.  Gable Heart Beats is unique in our mission because we provide both an echocardiogram and EKG to everyone we screen. We feel strongly that both tests are necessary to rule out any heart conditions. 

 

Our extra funds are applied directly towards our next scheduled screening. In addition to heart screenings, we install AEDs in communities that may not have funding.

Heart screenings and AEDs have been proven to save lives. For every 200 people we screen, on average we have diagnosed 5 people with abnormal heart conditions that need to be referred to a cardiologist. The use of an AED before EMS arrival increases the odds of survival by 80 percent.  

Michael's children- Matteo and Grace Gable donating AEDs to the city of Pleasanton, CA. 

 

Risks & Challenges

Some of the risks include a person finding out for the first time that they have a heart condition.  Often there are challenges when we screen someone and they have to undergo heart surgery or can't continue their previous life style. We prepare for these challenges by having the proper waivers and consent forms signed by adults/parents before receiving a heart screening. We are always very sensitive to how they receive the news. Every person who has been diagnosed with a heart condition will receive a personal phone call from our staff sharing the report from our team cardiologist. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Educating about the risks of heart disease and sudden cardiac arrest are equally important to our fund raising goals. Most of us know a friend or family member that has been effected by heart disease or sudden cardiac arrest. 

Helping us spread the word and educate about heart disease on Indiegogo and other social media channels will help save lives!  Thank you for your support! The BEAT goes on!!
